title: More than I expected
text: I like this cheap little dashcam. It will never charge up but that's okay. When I want it to record, I plug it in. When I'm done, I unplug it and it dies in about 30 seconds. It writes over old files when it files it, but it's pretty much record and forget. The video's not bad, so for the price compared to much more expensive recorders, it's great.

title: Decent, but not great...
text: This does work and does what it's described to do.  However, file cycling on the SD card can be problematic at times where you need to put the SD card into the computer to clear the contents before the camera will record on it again.  It fills a 16GB card fairly quickly, so video cycling is a pretty important option that I would expect to work perfectly. The instructions are also a Chinese translation and not well written.  For the price, it's awesome.  For what it is, it's fair...  I would buy it again, but if I wanted a permanently installed full-time device, I'd opt for something of higher quality.

title: COMPLETE GARBAGE !!!!
text: Went against my better judgement. Complete garbage, Should have listened to the negative reviews. The battery cover would not close because the battery was too thick, Either it was a replacement battery or not the right one, Would not hold a charge, Would not record once it was charged for the short time that it did last. Returning it the same day it arrived. I wouldn't even give this a one star rating if I could. DO NOT BUY !!!!

title: It's really only good for recording crazy accidents for youtube
text:
This is a cheap knockoff of a real dashcam. It's really only good for recording crazy accidents for youtube. Don't expect to be able to actually read any license plates with this. Also the LEDs on the front are super weak infrared LEDs which will illuminate exactly nothing.

If you want a cheap automatic video recording device, this is it. If you want a good dashcam, this is not it.

title: Ehhh... Not so good quality.
text: It wouldn't stay on the windshield and stopped working after a few months.

title: Would be great if it worked
text: Ordered two of these little cameras. Did not expect too much at the price but hoped they would work at least long enough to play with. One would not power up right out of the box and within a day the second one had gone bad as well. Returns were no problem. May try a different brand in the future. Sure would be a cool gizmo to have.

title: ... to agree with other that the bracket could be better but a little finger nail polish fixes it just ...
text: I have to agree with other that the bracket could be better but a little finger nail polish fixes it just fine. Where's the price really can not be beat.

title: due to the bad LCD screen
text: OK. I know this i a $15 item and therefore, I shouldn't expect too much. The unit I received was defaulted to Chinese, with printed instructions in both  Chinese and English. It was a bit difficult for me to figure out how to change to English. That being said, The suction cup mount works very well, holding it in position well. Even though the directions mentioned turning the IR (night vision) OFF/ON, I couldn't find anything in the menus to do that.  The big letdown was that the LCD screen randomly displaying lines, then whiting out the screen entirely, even sitting on a table, so I don't think motion was a problem. I ended up returning it, due to the bad LCD screen. It's a shame really, because I think it would be just what I need and you can't beat the price.

title: good but menus are not in english
text: good for the price.  I just wish the menus were in english.  also, unless a car is right in front of you, you wont see their license.

title: Great value for price!
text: Cheap. It is some kind of HD dimension, but not quality. Great value for price. Bought two. One for front and back.

title: Not what I expected
text: A friend recommended this to me after I had a near-accident on the freeway. He uses a similar model, and he recommended this for the price. The instructions are confusing and inadequate, and the construction is cheap. In trying to adjust the aim of the camera, the unit broke at the join between it and the mounting apparatus. Why are these not separable? I finally bit the bullet and bought a better quality, more expensive unit from another source (Kommado). You get what you pay for.

title: Poor quality.
text:
There is no doubt that trucks are rough on these accident cameras due the to constant bumps and vibration. However, this camera is also sold in Truck Stops for nearly $100.

I bought mine through Amazon nearly 3 months ago. It started out OK, but the video quality deteriorated, The camera finally stopped working a couple of days ago. I've had cheap accident cameras last for years. This one didn't last a full 3 months.

With many of these cheap cameras, sometimes you get a good one. And sometimes you don't.

title: Picture went fizzy after a month of owning it.
text: Was working good then all the sudden the camera went fuzzy after owning it a month. Tried cleaning the lense to see if it qould help and it doesnt... everything is fuzzy but if you were in an accedent you could see for the most part what happened as long as the cam was facing that way. The lighting at night is poor. You can only see where your headlights are thats it.

title: The price is attractive but the product quality is not
text: The price is attractive but the product itselt is not. I bought this because of its price and size. I thought it would last a long time if I take care of it well. But it broke after a month, which made me unable to return it to Amazon. There is no warranty whatsoever in the package because this product was supposed to only in China I guess. The user manual is in Chinese and I have no idea how to read it. The product quality is bad as you would expect (I expected it actually because of the price, you know). The video quality is bad as well, you can barely see the license plate of the car in front of you even in the morning, I really wonder what the purpose is of this product. At night, it is even worse, cannot see the license plate of the car at all. Overall, I would not recommend this product to anyone. Period.

title: worth every cent. very happy, and have friends ordering them now.
text: Totally cool. Works great. Has cell battery so you can charge it and disconnect the wire. Easy to install, and can be figured out with there directions. Personal COP CAM, at your finger tips. I highly recommend. And great to bring to the insurance company for proof of fault. I recommend.

title: Not bad for price
text: For the price, decent. This isn't recommended for track racing, but everyday driving it is a good tool for those fender benders. Keep an eye out for the other people on the road...

title: SO-so
text: Daytime video is fine, nighttime not very good, the IR illumination points to the left of the camera so the view is not very good.

title: I don't like it
text: Not fluent in the instructional language. Have no idea what it's doing. If it's working or not. Won't stick on window. Aggravating.

title: Camera works fine. I dropped it on the dash while trying to attach it to the window
text: Camera works fine. I dropped it on the dash while trying to attach it to the window. The glue between the holders two parts failed and it separated. I glued it with goop and it seem to hold just fine.

title: Pay what you get for
text: Definitely can tell it is cheap. Don't expect battery to last without being plugged in. Quality isn't the best, but you could at least tell color and type of vehicle.

title: It's cheap but good
text: Knowing you are not paying much for this unit you can't expect top quality. That being said...this unit works as well as can be expected. Picture is not clear enough to see license plates but should be sufficient for law enforcement or legal use...for accidents or traffic violations. A good value.

title: Did not perform as expected
text: I tried it for a short car trip. Had problems programming - could not get to all the programming screens and could not set the date and time. It did not perform as expected so I returned it to Amazon for a full refund.

text: Doesn't come with an AV out cable. Windows 7 doesn't accept the USB input. The company doesn't have a software fix for this model. I got burned again!

title: Five Stars
text: Thank you

title: Great cheap dash camera.
text: I've thankfully never needed to pull video from this thing, but I'm always glad that I have it.  The video isn't quite clear enough to read license plates from, but it certainly is clear enough to have an accurate accounting of whats going on.  Just throw a card in it, change whatever settings you need, point it in the direction you want to record, and you're done.  It can automatically start and stop recording and overwrites the oldest videos to store the new ones.

title: decent

title: Minimum Dash Cam / Minimum Price
text:
You may find this when searching for the DVR007, DVR027 or DVR207, but the one I received were not any of those models. Each of them have an HDMI output socket and actually deliver a fine image. This one is an inexpensive knockoff of the original DVR007 design. KIRF. Amazon's search led me right to this when I searched for the DVR007, but it wasn't the real deal.

Amazon's return policy saved the day. No cost. No complaints. Eventually I found a suitable unit. If you want the best, highest resolution dash cam, look for the Mini 0803 or 0801. Amazon sells them.

The reason it's more than one star is the price! Anybody with a car and $16 should have one. For insurance purposes, if nothing else. Assuming that it's the other guy's fault--or extenuating circumstances--a video record of what goes on in front of your car when push collides with shove is priceless.

Or, in this case, around $16.

title: Works great, Especially for being so low in cost!
text: I am very happy with this purchase.  It works great, has decent video resolution and is not difficult to operate.  I would recommend for a first video camera for use on auto windshield.  At some point I'll probably upgrade to a more expensive unit to get even better resolution (like being able to read license plates from a distance) but it is fine for what I use it for, which is being able to document my actions while driving and the action of other drivers.  Should the terrible occur and I'm in an accident, I will have good video showing what really happened, whether I'm in the right ... or not.

title: Great for the money. It let`s you try out the whole car cam thing real cheap. Now I am ready to buy me a better camera.
text: This is a good car cam to see if you really want to pay to get a good one. Don`t expect the clearest picture quality. For example, you won`t be able to read road signs. But the canera is clear enough and well worth the small cost.  Now that i see how the whole car cam thing works, and it`s very simple, I am now ready to invest in a better camera.

title: this is a great product. The main drawback is the picture quality

For the money, this is a great product.
The main drawback is the picture quality. It claims to be hd, but the hd quality just seems like SD blown up to HD file size.
Due to the poor picture quality, plates are unreadable. But this is still a valuable tool in preventing insurance fraud, etc.

I have since upgraded to a G1W for my dash cam and I moved this camera to the rear for a rear cam.

title: For the price, great
text:
[[VIDEOID:a46e39bc9cf1e18278305aa7c69b5652]] For starters you're going to need one of these: [[ASIN:B003VNKNEQ Transcend 16 GB SDHC Class 10 Flash Memory Card TS16GSDHC10E]] You can get the 32 GB size as well but I know the 16 GB one works.

I uploaded a somewhat lengthy video from the unit with a fairly detailed review. Please note I had to shrink the file so it would fit under amazon's 100MB limit. The actual file is almost 500MB for 5 minutes and is 640x480. But what I uploaded should give a decent idea of the video quality. For this item please remember price matters. It is a cheap piece of hardware and it shows. I mention in my video review that I could not even use the power adaptor that came with the DVR because it caused interference on my FM radio. I had to use the adaptor that I had from my Garmin Nuvi 350. But, that worked so I'm less irritated than i would otherwise be.

Despite the problems I gave it 5 stars because of how cheap it is. Frankly I wish they'd double the price and up the build quality. But if you just want to play with something like this I think this is a good way to start.

title: Cheap, useable, don't expect too much!
text:
For the price, well, whaddaya expect? - lol.
If taken care of this will work fine - unless you require clear HD video.
The claim of this being "HD" is a little bit of a lie.
Just because the video will record at certain screen resolutions does not imply that the video will be anything less than crappy at best!

Fixed focus lens can be terrible - or not so bad - depending on how it has been hurriedly set at the factory.
Mine will focus at close ranges (10-20 feet)
An older one I had seemed to focus at farther distances.

If you auto gets hot in the summer, you may want to remove this device and take it inside or away from high temperatures.
I do not live in the desert, but the last two I had got too hot and stopped working properly.

This is a great deal if your requirements are not demanding.

title: You get what you paid for...
text:
This $20 cam is just that, a $20 cam. It has a narrow field of view, it's 640x480 (not sure how this qualifies as 'HD'), and the recordings mine take have a repeating stutter to them. There's also no option to flip the recording, so if you have to mount the camera upside down, your videos will all be upside down. There's a repeating video glitch on the LCD screen which seems to coincide with the stutter, but it only seldom shows in the recorded video. The mount is OK, and I appreciate that it uses a standard threaded camera mount. This means I can use other mounts with it.

I don't think it was used, but it had the unmistakable smell of cigarette smoke to it.

I didn't stick mine on the windshield because here in south Florida, the heat would just melt the thing in one day, so I used a weighted pad/mount on the dash, which means the camera is upside down (and so is the video.) The AmazonBasics GPS Dashboard Mount works perfectly. This way I can take it and put it down on the floor out of the sun when I stop somewhere. It's easy in VLC to flip the video 180 when viewing, so it's not the end of the world. Besides, once the novelty wears off, you won't be watching every video you take with it unless there's an event you want to see, like an accident.

The other video modes (1920x1080, 1280x720) are just upsampled from 640x480, so for the best image quality use 640x480.

UPDATE 1-22-16: After a couple days it seems like the USB power connection where the cord plugs into the unit is intermittent. The charging symbol changes to a battery symbol and then it shuts off.
Also the Camera was installed in the case at a bit of an angle, so unless I adjust it, it looks like I am driving on a side hill. It's no big deal, I drive a white vehicle, so I use the end of my hood to align it properly.

Update 2-15-16: Still working! It still feels like it's going to fall apart any minute, but it still works. I guess I was one of the lucky ones!

Was good for a couple laughs for 20 bucks.
Won;t buy again though.

title: Don't Buy

title: Less than $14 for a dash cam that works - SOLD!
text:
[[VIDEOID:be59e84ee8d9d62a7491c611f75082f2]] Granted, you'll also need an SD card (class 10), but those aren't too expensive. I went with this one from Transcend: http://amzn.to/1Kj8O8h $7 for 16GB, not bad.

I have the worst luck with vehicles and I've been wanting a dash cam for years, but never looked below the $100 mark. At one point I was pretty much convinced that I would have to get a GoPro for a dash cam to be any good. When I stumbled across this one while trying to research a specific (much more expensive) model, I thought to myself "$14? Geez it's going to suck. Oh look, video reviews. That's.... actually not bad. Oh that guy got hit! I hope he's okay. Yep, I'll try it."

So I ordered mine since I just had to get a new vehicle after I was hit from behind and pushed into another vehicle totaling my car. (I miss my car; it was darn near perfect!) Now, however, I'm driving this huge SUV that I love, but driving something bigger means there's more area for my vehicle to get hit. I think I will be buying at least one more of these for the rear of my vehicle, but I want a total of four - one for the front, one for the back, and one for each side!

My only two CONS for this item is the mini usb charging cable. None of the devices I currently have use anything other than micro usb, which means I have no option to share other device cables with this camera. It's not a huge deal, so I didn't even take away a star, but it is annoying. The other con was that it was originally in Chinese (I think) and I couldn't figure out how to change the language. Luckily, some other reviewers figured it out and shared the answer here! (Still not worth removing a star!)

All in all, for $14 I'm thrilled. I'm not making movies, I'm just trying to make sure that I'm protected if someone hits me again. True story, I was once sued by a woman who caused a wreck, ruined the front of my new vehicle (less than six months old), and then claimed she couldn't see my car. If I had this camera in my car, it would have been obvious that she was lying - instead she wasn't even ticketed and the wreck was listed as "unavoidable due to weather conditions" even though the day was crystal clear. She wouldn't have had a case to sue me, both of the insurance companies, the city, the parish, the state, and the railroad company that owned the tracks I was crossing when she claimed she couldn't see me. The camera clearly would have shown her face on screen the entire time I was driving up to and over the railroad tracks before she pulled across the road in front of my moving vehicle. (Stupid people, y'all. Can't do anything about them.)

About the video: I had to shrink it a bit in file size to upload it, but it doesn't look like the quality suffered too terribly. Also, the date and time is wrong because I didn't set it with military time the night before. It's twelve hours off, but I'm pretty pleased with the whole thing!

October 9, 2015 Update:
I've had this dash cam for a couple months now. I still like it, but the camera does not hold a charge at all. If it isn't plugged in, it doesn't turn on. And if my usb charger gets bumped or I hit a large-ish bump in the road, the camera goes off. Both of these problems are frustrating enough that I'm taking away two stars because, in addition to these problems, there's still the issues before of the language problem (it seems to default to Chinese on occasion) and the unsharable usb cord.

August 20, 2017 Update:
Okay... I've had this thing for about two years now. It's done it's job and finally given up the ghost. I haven't priced batteries, but the battery wants to explode and it's having difficulty with overwriting old video footage, so I'm just going to look into a new dash cam. For $14, I've definitely gotten my money's worth!

title: It's ok. It's not great
text:
Dash cameras don't seem as prevalent in the US as they are in other markets. They possible exception may the pricey public safety models. This is not one of those models. I've had this unit for about a week now. It's ok. Here's a few things to keep in mind: 1) Battery life- I've seen no evidence of any battery life. The unit appears to shut off if the screen is closed and the cigarette adapter is not plugged in. Again, this is just my experience. 2) SD Card- The unit does not come with an SD card, but they can be acquired for $10-15 USD. The SD card fit into the right side of the unit. My experience has been that the SD card pushes against some sort of spring without really securing or clicking into place. I've closed the SD card door, only to have it come flying out from the unit. This has happened several times and there doesn't seem to be a remedy. 3) Instructions- The instructions make mention of an "OK" button. This button is not labelled at all, but is to the right of the power button.

Summary: It gets the job done on a budget, but it's a tad clunky.

title: From 5 Stars to 2
text:
I just gave the camera 5 stars. I then went outside and turned the car on. The camera did not turn on. I brought back inside and it turns on when connected to the computer only.

I then looked at all the videos and found put THE FOCUSWENT OUT. Most of my videos are blurry now.

I guess $14 was too good to be true.
-------------------------

I love this dash cam. For $14. It took a little bit of sweat to set up, but after watching a yourtube video, I figured it out. The battery does not last very long, maybe an hour if you're lucky. So you have to have it plugged into the car for use.

I hate the wire dangling and have to figure out a way to fix that. The video during the daytime is clear, as is the audio. Watching the recording on the screen at nighttime, it looks fuzzy and distorted. But I have not played it back on computer yet. I do have it set to record at night as well.

Suction cup is stable and holds onto window tightly.

Overall, you can't beat it for the price. So many features at rock bottom prices.

title: Great value, don't expect a super HD 4k, it does the job
text: Awesome for the money. Granted it's not super platinum 4k HD 360 degrees but for $10 it is a great value. It's purpose is to record the road so if I get in an accident where someone did something stupid, I'll have proof. In the day time the picture quality is decent enough to read license plates. At night not so much but you would still be able to see who was at fault if someone swerved in front of you or something. Thinking about running another line for the back window as well. Also love that I don't have to remember to turn it on every day.

title: Good camera, bad menu.
text:
When I first got this camera I worried that I'd made a bad choice. It felt flimsy, and I fully expected it to break quickly. Having said that, it's still going strong after a few months. The video quality (which is adjustable) is actually pretty good. The night vision isn't terrific but it does the job, and daytime quality is excellent.

The camera itself would get 4 or 5 stars, but I had to take off some for the terrible user interface. Once you know how to get around in it, it's workable, but initially it's very cumbersome.

title: they work great after several months of daily use
text: I have two of these, they work great after several months of daily use. The one mounted in my truck will need a source I can turn on and off because the outlet in the truck is always powered.  I've often left the cam plugged in, sometime all night but it didn't cause battery failure.

Motion detect recording is based on a tumbler, so it starts recording when the camera moves & stops when it becomes stable.  No night cam, that's a joke.  Full HD recording is also a joke; best picture is in regular mode with 640x480 image.  Instructions were in Chinese, but pretty simple to figure out playing in the menu screen.  Cheap China materials assembled by cheap China labor.  I do not recommend.

title: Worthless because it won't overwrite
text:
When this unit arrived, I was pleased because it looks identical to another unit that costs about $5 more.

But no. It is different.

The quality of the video appears to be the same but the audio on the unit I got was terrible.

But here's the deal breaker: It will not overwrite old video. So once your SD card fills up, you have to reformat the card.

A dash cam is something you should be able to set up, test, and the forget about. You shouldn't have to worry about the card filling up.

For spending just $5 more, you can get a dash cam that overwrites.

title: UPDATE: good enough cheap dashcam BUT interferes with GPS!
text:
[[VIDEOID:e2984a92d188d5c53650b5fdb9a4bca1]] For under $12 including shipping this is remarkable! Quality is nowhere even close to HD, so that should be removed from the misleading description, but for the price I wouldn't expect it to be. The camera comes on automatically when car is started and records continuously in 2 minute bursts. Includes a date/time stamp too. Mine appeared to have some sort of periodic glitch where every few seconds it recorded a grey bar for the bottom half of the screen but, on experimentation this appeared to be only when I was playing back directly from the SD card on my laptop, so it may be the SD card I used. When you consider this cost about the same as 2 starbilks happy-frappy-maccy-chino lattes, it is remarkable. Look at the video and see what you think ...

Update: Having used this now for a week I have one annoying thing to report - it interferes with my Garmin Nuvi GPS so that it cannot find the satellites easily and sometimes even drops them. I have my GPS attached to the center of the windshield and this dashcam just below. When i start the car they both activate as would be expected, but now my Garmin GPS has trouble locating the satellites. I thought it was just a glitch/coincidence but if I unplug the dashcam them it can find the satellites OK. Initially this seemed to only occur on start up, but today it lost the signal twice on my 10 mile drive to work. Simply unplugging the dashcam for about 15 seconds allowed the GPS to work again, but it's hardly ideal. It does make you wonder what sort of EMR this unit putting out though. and why it isn't shielded!

title: Poor Choice
text: While you can't expect much in a Dash Cam at this price you should expect the basic. Like being able to turn it off without having to take the battery out. When it ask  you to format your card you should expect it to format the card not just keep saying "waiting" for over 30 minutes. The menu was hard to navigate and the night picture did not exist. This is perhaps the most disappointing product I have purchased through Amazon. Returned for refund after trying to get it to work for several hours over the course of 2 days. The picture on the small screen was good and the suction cup holds firm and that is the only good things about this that I found. I do believe the one I received was defective but I am not willing to order another one like this. I will spend a little more next time hoping to get a better quality. I would not recommend this DVR.

title: INSTRUCTION MANUAL HERE!
text: [...].....This is one of the best things I've ever gotten from Amazon. I simply do not see how anyone can manufacture something like this, SHIP it, and STILL make money. Unreal. Do not let the other reviewers discourage you from buying this. I just bought this to put in my 2013 Mercedes- and I am impressed. VERY impressed. The first thing you notice is the size. It's extremely compact. Even on a small car, there's plenty of room. The menus are very intuitive, the picture is amazing- lots of options- and the angle is very wide. It will shoot the entire back wall of my garage, with the car pulled in, from about 10 feet away. So I'd say the angle is at least 120 degrees, if not more. Impressive. And when you plug it into the cigarette outlet, as long as the outlet follows the key (on/on, off/off), the little camera will beep and turn on off right along with it. Amazing. I put a 1 gig card in mine. And it works flawlessly. It will even record sound, if you want- I chose no- and you can also record a short memo, and something else I can't remember. Nice. And the included power cord is actually long enough to run the camera wire down along the A pillar without being seen. The yes, the included mount is PERFECT. Strong, light, and the angles are totally adjustable. I'm trying really hard to find a flaw- I can't. Ok, if you really want something bad, i guess the only bad thing is the display does not turn off when the screen is flipped shut. So you can see a tiny crack of light where the closure gap is. And that is minor. I am going to order 10 more of these and put them in every car/vehicle I have. Don't wait- buy one NOW and try it out. You will see....

title: Dash Cam itself works great, charger and USB cable that came with it don't work.
text:
I was stunned to turn on this dash cam and find so many options. First you have the four modes of video record, picture take, sound record, and video play back.

For most people the mode you'll use most often will be the video capture mode. This mode allows you to choose the video quality, IR LED on/off, loop record on/off, loop record time, sound recording on/off and motion sensor on/off. The most useful of these features is look record and motion sensor. It's pretty cool that the camera will record once it senses motion, theoretically you could leave it on this setting and never have to touch anything when you start driving. From what I can tell the camera also will not continue recording past the first loop until it senses motion again (when on the motion sense mode). The IR sensors on the camera do work, but they are kind of useless when using the camera as a dash cam... They aren't strong enough to see past the hood of your car, they do work however if you want to use the camera in a hallway or something. I haven't used the picture or audio recording features in depth but I can verify that they do work.

The suction cup that came with the device is very strong. Once you click on to your windshield correctly its very hard to remove and provides for a very steady recording. I am completely satisfied with this aspect of the product.

The two downfalls to this product (at least my product) are that neither the car charger it came with or the usb cable it came with work at all. I don't care about the USB cable since I have many of them lying around, but I did care about the car charger not working. I contacted Amazon and very quickly they gave me a partial refund to buy a replacement charger (I chose an AmazonBasics GPS charger since I knew my Garmin charger worked to charge the dash came). Since Amazon was so helpful and refunded me the money needed to replace the charger I am a happy camper once more.

As other reviewers have said, the video quality of this dash cam is nothing special. It says it can take 720p or 1080p but I don't think that is true at all. The quality is definitely good enough to prove fault in an accident but don't expect GoPro quality video...

Based on some of the other reviews I was stunned with what I received, everything on the device worked like a charm, and it has so many features, the device arrived with a screen protector on it, that was easily removed and it was packaged well in a surprisingly legitimate looking box with instructions in english (though they don't explain what any of the features actually do). I'm not sure if the shipped product varies greatly from shipment to shipment but I most certainly got a good quality item.

I first tested this camera with a Class 4 4GB card that worked perfectly (recording in 2 minute loops was continuous with no lag between clips) and was able to record 44 minutes of "720p" video. Once I was sure I got a working device I purchased a 16GB Class 10 card which is sure to be even better.

One final fun fact of this dash cam is that the battery used is the exact same battery used in some older Nokia phones the battery is the "BL-5C" [[ASIN:B0006HP7NC Nokia BL-5C Extended Li-Ion Battery]] and I am able to record about 35 minutes of "720p" video on a single charge.

I paid $22 for this dash cam $11 for a 16gb SD card and Amazon refunded me enough money to buy a new charger, I could not be happier. For the great price, this dashcam is perfect, it takes good enough quality to clearly see cars, buildings, roads and people, only text is really difficult to see. If you are looking for a dash cam to use "just in case" you have an accident, this is definitely a great low-cost option.

Hope it helps!
-J

title: Great for the price until it died after one week (just a few hours of usage)
text: Pretty great WHEN it worked.  Worked well for about a week and then as so many have reported it just died without explanation.  The picture is pretty darn decent and the sound can't be that great since the microphone is just inches from the windshield.  The night vision was OK for the car in front of you.  The price is great for what it does.  The menu is pretty easy to figure out and the recording features are pretty neat.  The cable is too long and very, very thin and snapped when I packed it up to return it for a refund.  I would use it quite a bit other than it just died one day, just a week after activating it.  If that common problem can be fixed then these items should be used in every car.

text:
I bought one of these for $20 at a flea market. Worked great for a while. Seemed like a great cheap piece of gear.

Then the heat got to it.

I left it mounted in the summer and eventually the unit failed, the battery swole, and I took it down for inspection. The MicroSD card is usable, but the directory with the video is not, and it does not appear that the recorder loops.

Even though it baked in the sun and broke, the unit will still power up when conencted to power and function, thoguh I have not fully tested it's other capabilities.

title: good deal for the price
text:
After getting past the basics of navigating the menu and settings, this seemingly toylike item does what it is advertised to do—which is to record up to 720HD video through the front windshield during a drive. This opens up other possibilities as to what a device like this could be used for, but that would be beyond this brief review.
First off, even though this dashcam is made of plastic, it does feel sturdy (not thin, bendable plastic). I thought the mostly-plastic suction cup mount would be frail, but it also does its job rather well and there are grippable tightening rings to position the dashcam at the driver’s desired angle and direction. Some “cons”:
• The power on/off and start/stop/select buttons on the back of the dashcam are totally exposed and quite sensitive. This is good when you’re driving and you can turn the dashcam on and off or start recording easily, but this makes it very difficult to store the dashcam with a charged battery since the power could be turned on with the slightest nudge of the “on” button. The manufacturers should think about adding a cap or cover over these buttons, or recessing the buttons to prevent the device from being turned on accidentally. Thankfully, the dashcam also works with the mini-USB plugged in (and the manufacturers have even included a 12V DC mini-USB car adapter cable), which also charges the battery. Speaking of the battery, it is a non-standard B5-CL 3.7V 800mah li-ion battery. Even searching Amazon, I did not find an exact match. An LG phone battery was the closest match I could find in terms of dimensions, but the positive and negative contacts are just slightly off.
• The IR LEDs on the front seem to work only for a short distance. In a darkened room, you can see the LEDs working on the dashcam screen when you hold your hand in front of the lens, but point the camera at the other side of the room, and it will still be dark on the screen.
• The image or recording cannot be flipped while viewing or recording. The tripod mount is on the top of the dashcam to allow for it to be used with the suction cup mount, and the built-in LCD screen flips down. Wouldn’t this dashcam be much more useful and versatile if it could be mounted on a regular tripod or monopod, giving the user more flexibility? (I suppose you could still record upside-down if necessary and rotate images in software.)
In operation, the dashcam records through its wide-angle lens in continuous segments of two, five or 15 minutes until recording is turned off, and the user must preselect the segment length before recording. So a 40-minute drive with five-minute segments will have eight recordings on the SD memory card at the end of the trip. It also records sound. On an 8GB card, expect over 4-1/2 hrs. of recording capacity at VGA resolution, over three hours at D1 resolution and over two hours at 720HD resolution. The lens is tiny (about camera phone size), so don’t expect overall great imagery, but the video is definitely usable and viewable.
You can play back on the flip-down LCD screen, or download from the memory card to view on a computer. There is even an A/V-out jack to view on a separate monitor. The LCD screen’s “270 degrees” of movement refers to the fact that it can pivot 90 degrees to the right, and also 180 degrees to the left, so that the screen can be viewed from the front of the dashcam.
This device does its job without being obtrusive. Even attached to the window mount in the middle of the front windshield, very little of the driver’s view is obstructed. Overall, a good deal for the price and for what it can do, though how it fares in the long run is still to be determined.

title: Works as advertised and does the job
text:
This unit is an incredible value. It comes with a good quality mount to attach to your windshield and if you plug it in to a switched outlet, it will turn and turn off with the car and you don't have to do anything. It has a built-in battery so you could take it from the car and use it as a camcorder, but you probably have a better one for taking movies already.

Image quality is good, but colors are not saturated and the two highest-resolution settings the camera offers are identical. Nonetheless, it delivers good quality which is quite satisfactory for recording the traffic around you- its intended purpose.

You don't need a big memory card to use in this device. When the card fills up, it automatically starts recycling. The oldest file gets erased and recording continues. I had an old 2gig card on hand and it works perfectly. Remember- the purpose of this thing is to record accidents and other idiots on the road. This will be in the last few minutes of the most recent recording- not something you recorded weeks ago.

A composite video cable is included (for old TV sets) as well as an HDMI cable (for newer ones). You can play back movies right on the device. It records at night using the light from your headlights. Forget about the 6 built-in LEDs- they're useful only for hand-held recording at very close range. Night recording is what it is, and it is usable.

For the price, this is an excellent device. Going through the menus will take a little practice. The "Enter" button is the red button on the back of the camera- not a button on the TFT screen. To reach the Tools menu, you must first press the Menu button, and then the Enter button before you select anything. Set it for 60 cycles (North America) or night images will have flicker.

The windshield mount is sturdy, but there's no quick release for the camera, so the camera with the mount must be removed to keep the camera out of sight and out of the weather. I would not have been happy at all if these had been more than $14.37 .. Hopefully, I'll get a working replacement for the dud and we'll go from there.. Just OK..

title: Dash Cam works great for the money!
text:
I actually purchased this on Ebay from someone in NJ because I didn't want to wait for it to come from China. I must have gotten lucky - it works great right out of the box and the menus were easy to understand, thanks to the long instructions written by someone below. However, the 3 MODES on mine are a little different. Mode 1 is video recording, Mode 2 (with blue A) is for still jpeg photos which you take by pressing the orange button, Mode 3 is for video playback. The video recordings are in .avi format and the screen has green date/time stamp.

Also, if you don't want to record talking/radio playing in the car, you have to go to MODE 1 (video) and then hit MENU, press the DOWN button until you get to RECORD and set it to NO. You're only turning off the recording of sound.

I bought a 32gb class 10 card and can get 12 hours on it. I purchased this so I can take it on my road trip across CO, WY, SD, and NE along the scenic byways, but I love having it recording just around town too!

What a deal for $20!

title: You get what you pay for, and sometimes not even that!
text:
I should have have listened to what other reviews said about the quality, especially for the price, but Amazon can surprise you sometimes. I got it in the mail yesterday and am on Amazon to get a refund and purchase a new unit. My unit wouldn't turn on most of the time, the screen has bubbles and scratches in it. I like the idea, just driving with the camera, because I couldn't get it to record made me feel safer from the cars around me so I will have proof when they do something stupid. I will just get another unit.
Oh and the instructions where translated into English LAST it mentions buttons that aren't even on the unit. So frustrating!

And wouldn't you know, when I had this crappy product in the box in my passenger seat waiting to be returned I was in an auto accident where it could have been a HUGE help to me. Thanks for nothing to the seller scamming people with this low quality junk.

title: Garbage.
text: Right out of the box the device made a high pitch whining noise, unfortunately this was also captured by the microphone which overwhelmed any audio with a deafeningly loud screech, defeating half the purpose of even having a dash cam.

title: Save your money.
text:
If there was any way to rate this as a .1 I would. I have owned several of these over the last three years. Every one of them without exception have quit, usually within a four month period. None of the retailers have offered or exchanged units,...which now I can say I'm glad with. I've read several of the comments and those that are happy with it,..great and good luck in getting yours to last over a few months. For those that still are looking to buy one, let me give you some advice,...go find others that are much better. Here are a few reasons why:
1) These contain a battery. OLD TECHNOLOGY. One of the reasons why these stop working is battery is frying during the summer months. These cameras DO NOT like heat,..of any sort. Even on a cold/cool day, mounted in windshield can generate lots of heat.
2) Have to set and re-set date and time each time unit is removed for a length of time. It's that way on most, so this isn't a strong neg point, just saying.
3) On older vehicles and SUV's, where the power ports are active (on) all the time, the unit does not stop recording or shut off when vehicle isn't running. I had 5 out of 5 that didn't so if you have one and it shut it self off, then congratulations.
4)Brackets are flimsy and several times, (clean) bracket failed to hold to front and back (clean) windshields.
5) Did I mention this already,...THESE DO NOT LIKE HEAT.

Newer technology has several units that use a capacitor instead of battery. Much heavier duty and will take heat and cold much better. Yes ,these units are about a 2.5x more, but from the lack of any longevity by this unit, then it's money well spent.

title: Four Stars

title: The night vision sucks, the video quality isn't the best
text: Can't beat it for the price. The night vision sucks, the video quality isn't the best. It does what I want it to do - record what's going on in the car. For that, it's great!

title: Good for what it cost
text:
This is an inexpensive dashcam, it works as intended. Yes, the manual is a bit hard to understand due to translation issues, but it wasn't that difficult to figure out. The picture is good enough to show who was at fault, which is all you really need unless you're actively trying to capture license plate numbers of every car you drive near.

The one problem I had is the fact that plugging the unit into a USB port automatically triggers the unit into a file-transfer mode, and it won't record. My car has a USB port that turns off when the car is off (unlike the cigarette lighter ports which are always on), soI ended up having to use the 110V plug with a USB adapter (which didn't trigger file-transfer mode). Would be nice if the file-transfer mode could be exited, and recording/charging would work via USB port.

text:

Its not a very expensive product (although it can become expensive in the end, I'll explain in a sec) b. there were some what positive experiences listed. However the item is and feels of the cheapest plastic around, long term it may not hold up. No real instructions to speak of, but not being a novice did not encounter a problem there.

Here's were the real problems begin. The item arrieved with some slight charge on the battery, so I was able to view, record, and play back some video. When I installed it in the car and connected the power to it the thing began to sizzle and spark and smoke almost instantly. I quickly disconected the unit and placed it outside the car. Had this happened when I was not in the car, after say going in to a store or the likes, this may have been the last time I drove that particular car. Total estimated time with the unit about 2hrs. The unit was fried after that and so are any chances of giving this item another try.

title: Returning it after a week.....
text:
Been in a few near-misses lately with crazy people pulling out and turning in front of me so decided to protect myself and get a dash cam so I could show Judge Judy or Judge Millian how awful these people are at driving. This one caught my eye due to the amazingly low price. I ended up getting the 1080p version with 16GB card included for $30. Right off the bat, the quality of the video was very disappointing at 1080p. Images aren't very sharp and it looks like a close up video where you can see the pixels. Also, there is a loud buzzing noise during playback which gets extremely annoying.

The final straw was when the "No SD Cad" light keeps blinking even though the 16GB card is still in there. I even tried to format the card in my laptop but it wouldn't.

I guess the old saying applies here: "You get what you paid for"

title: It's very good, for the price.
text:
Low price, decent quality. Bought Nov 2015. Need to remember this is a low level cheaper setup, but even then it is still a good setup. Mine has 4 video quality options including 1080, 720 and two lower quality. The lower quality options is grainy but decent. 720 is better to the point where you can read most license plates while stopped, and 1080 is some kind of upconverted 720 as it gets really pixelated and much lower framerate. Nighttime view is weak, cannot see much beyond the hood or lit up by street lights. Mine seems to have more of a zoomed forward look with no panorama nor "wide angle" to it, a simple normal neighborhood 4 way stop and cannot see the vehicles stopped on the side roads. Sound quality from the built in mic is sensitive at close range but poor sound quality for what it does pick up, but we buy these for the simple cheap video recorders.
For this price level though, it is still a good buy.
UPDATE: This had been in the car for nearly 2 years before it finally died. The last few months it would get stuck on the "boot up" screen, I would have to remove power and remove the battery for a few minutes, then hook it all back up and it would work fine for a few days before locking up again. Finally a few weeks ago it just died. Just short of 2 years for a $10 camera, cannot complain too much about that. Good for the daytime, or close encounters at night, otherwise night vision sucks and video quality is mediocre.

title: Four Stars
text: Works great for a simple dash cam. Does not record in super high def quality. Good vision even at night. I set mine to the highest setting with a 16 gb sd card. It will loop over old files as you run out of space allowing it to constantly record. Keep this in mind if you have video you wish to save. Depending on the quality and size of storage will determine how long til it loops over old data.

title: Good HD video quality (not widescreen)
text: I bought the 720p w/out card, and upgraded to the 16 gb card for more storage. After a considerable amount of time navigating through the Menu, you'll have the HD settings and Time Stamp figured out, and you'll be ready to mount which is an easy suction cup, and set screw. The Camera automatically starts recording everytime it's turned on (red light blinks), and continually records, in ten minute segments, as you'll notice on playback.  It doesn't jiggle or move at all, and the battery is adequate to not need the car adapter cord. When you're done driving, and want to see your trip, just plug in the appropriate cord to your PC and the videos will start playin back in HD, consecutively. I delete what I don't need, and let the rest store. Copying to a File is easy enough, and I charge mine w/the USB cord to PC. This is fine product which dosn't cost much which may save you from future car accident fault claims, as the resolution is so high you can even read the license plates in HD record settings. The little flip down viewfinder is so neat, it even swivels, LOL  I feel like James Bond.

title: low price, good features, mediocre video quality
text: Turns on automatically with power, works upside down and adjusts picture for it, has settings to record and erase in time sections so you could just leave a 8 gb SD card in it and effectively have access to video 2 hours back as needed. Visibility degrades at night but still good enough to record overall situation if that will be called for. Video angle is narrow and quality is fuzzy, it's clear enough to make out the general situation that occurred but you won't be reading license plates nor identifying faces. For less than 20 bucks, it's an ok deal as a starter dash cam. Also the mount that came with it has horrible suction to the windshield and fell off numerous times, I replaced with a dedicated Arkon cam mount for around 10 bucks. Doing it all over again, I would buy a different model.

title: nice idea but not a unit that you can count on.
text: Randall Vogel  This last purchase was bad. I have had a few of these cameras one from ebay and about 5 from amazon so far. I believe these units are a good idea, but it is a gamble on getting a good one. Amazon return policy helps. I recently encountered a guy driving a white Honda going down a one way street. We had some words about the almost head-on collision all recorded on this device. The white Honda was being parked in full front view of this working camera. Since the audio records quite good, I was able to express myself. That same evening the cops show up asking about the Honda. I was able to show the video to the cops of the car thief. We use to hang Christmas lights on our house. Now we hang cameras. Same in the cars. Good luck

title: Fantastic deal
text: Love this thing. It produces a great movie. Easy to operate and install. Have not been able to get sound on it, but that is not a problem for me as it eliminates the road noise and conversations in the vehicle.

title: Works exactly how I wanted it to work.
text: I must say for $15.90 this vehicle DVR is well worth the price!!! The setup was easy, the mount stays stuck to the windshield and won't fall off with vibration or heat. At first I set it at 1280x960 pixels and set it to record on motion, audio on, and overwrite memory to keep it recording if memory runs out. At first I encountered the problem that this unit freezes at the highest pixel resolution, so I set it down to 640x480 pixels. Since then, this vehicle DVR works EXACTLY how I wanted it to work. Video is good at 640x480 pixels. Having it run on battery is kind of useless since you'll never know when it shuts down because of a dead battery. So I just leave it plugged into my 12 volt plug. When I turn on my car, it powers this DVR to turn ON and there is nothing else I need to do. The DVR powers on, I start driving, and the DVR will record 2 minute clips on every motion it detects. When I park and turn off the vehicle, it cuts off the 12 volt power and I either manually turn off the DVR, or most of the time I forget to turn it off and let it run on battery  until it dies,,,but that won't affect it since it can turn back on once I start the vehicle. During daylight hours, while driving, I'll check up on the screen and usually always see it recording. Sometimes I may be driving slow on a straight road and it won't record if no vehicles are in front, but as soon as I drive close to a vehicle, motion is triggered and it starts recording. It's just a plug and play device. For the past 2 weeks I've just allowed this DVR to do it's job, then about 4 days into using it, a vehicle cut me off in front of me while driving on the freeway (no accident occurred so no big deal). When I pulled over, I checked out the option to view recordings, and sure enough, it caught the moment when that person on the BMW cut me off. No it did not get the license plate numbers, but personally,,, all I am worried about is catching an accident. Sometimes on a redlight, during the daytime, this DVR can catch license plate numbers if there is no sun glare, this DVR has even caught license plate numbers at NIGHT on a red light if there is no glare from my headlights. Overall I am happy with this vehicle DVR and would buy a 2nd one if needed. I give it 5 stars because of its good performance for the cheap price, but it DOES NOT look cheap when mounted,,. Now on the negative side: If you work as a Private Investigator and need to capture detailed events, while driving, then I do not recommend this DVR because the it won't capture much at night, and it won't capture much at a distance during the day. It is good enough to capture road rage incidents in good lighting, (if not too far away) and the audio will help out if an incident is captured at night. If you just need a cheap vehicle DVR to record accidents while driving, then I highly recommend this one. You can use the record button to push on a moment you just want to capture evidence for your records.

title: Decent daytime, not the best at night
text:
[[VIDEOID:mo3H32F76G8DWXH]]I mounted this camera in the front window of my Police Interceptor. It takes decent daytime video, kinda crappy sound and not really good night video. In addition, it does not have an HD option. I've tried several different sizes of memory cards up to 8 GB and have never had an option to record in HD. I've included three video clips for you to examine. The first one is daytime with no sound. A Hummer cuts me off as we're getting off the highway, the second one is daytime with sound as I stretch the Interceptor's legs. Road noise plays a big factor in why I never use sound with this camera. The third video is night driving, in the rain with the sound off. As you can see, the camera doesn't do well at night with vehicles..at all.
Hope this helps!

title: Knock Off Camera
text:
Details here -[...]

Original vs Fake Models

Given the popularity of this camera, there are dozens of fake models available for sale. There are numerous ways to tell the difference between original DVR-027 models and fake models.

The original records the time on the top center of the screen with black numbers on a white background. Fakes use green numbers and write them to the side.

The original uses the H.264 codec. Fakes use the mjpeg codec

The original records at: 640×480, 848×480, 1280×720. Fakes records at 720×480 instead of 848×480. Fakes may offer 800×600 or 1280×720, but will record at 640×480 (resolution is interpolated).

The original records in AVI format. Fakes record in MOV format.

The original viewing angle is 120 °. Fakes viewing angle ~ 40-60 °.

The original has an HDMI output. Fakes do not have an HDMI output (for example, it is replaced with a sticker). Some of the fakes have an HDMI port, but it is not connected to the board

The original has a removable battery. Fakes do not have removable batteries.

Original comes in a blue box. Fake comes in a white box.

A good rule of thumb is that if the camera is selling for under $50, it is a fake.

title: TxMutant
text: I received the product in a timely matter, I bought a 16G memory card and it begins recording as soon as you turn on the car, the price was great and I'm planning to buy another set for my wife's car. title: A decent deal for the money(cheap)
text:
After seeing how popular things these dashboard cameras are in Russia, I started looking into how much they cost. I was elated to discover there were el cheapo Chinese versions right here on amazon(seriously, if you can't find it on amazon, it very well may not exist).

When it arrived, I immediately ripped into the packaging and started playing with it. Much to my dismay, it would boot and then sit there on the splash screen :(. I had remembered reading the reviews on here and somebody had mentioned a reset button, so I immediately began jamming coffee stirrers in the 2 little orifices... no dice. I dismantled it only to learn that my version has no reset button. After some button pushing, I discovered that if you hold the menu button(or 'manu' button as it's described in the "instruction manual") while pressing the power button, it will reset the CPU.

At this point I began trying to navigate the menu structure, which is not very intuitive, and it prompts you to press buttons that don't exist. I finally got it set up the way I thought I wanted and I stuck it to the windshield in my truck. One you get everything adjusted and tightened, the mount is pretty solid.

After a drive around the block, I popped the SD card into my laptop and easily found the AVI files that it had generated. I chose one, started watching it, and quickly learned that the only thing High Definition about this camera is the dimension of the recording, not the quality. No matter, I'm only using it document cell site access roads in the Poconos, and what I get out of it will be good enough for what I need... at the moment.

In the future, I will probably be spending a little more money on a nicer unit that shoots in full HD, but for now, this will do just fine.

title: China!
text: Ordered three of these.  Two of the three arrived inoperable.  Sent them back.  To China.  Weeks later, two replacements arrive.  One is DOA.  The other worked.  For a few weeks.  Then it failed.  Products need to come with warning labels.  MADE IN CHINA should be a warning to everyone to expect mediocre products with an astronomical failure rate.  The sad thing is that by charging perhaps $10 more a reliable product could be produced.  These  dashcams have been an utter, frustrating failure.  Even when they did work, extracting files was close to impossible.  No video cord is supplied.  So other than simply review a video on the built in screen, extracting that video for other purposes was nearly impossible.  And that's before they all quite working.

title: Low resolution, not very intuitive controls.

title: Does the job and cheap insurance.
text:
The DVR is cheap but was easy to connect up. I inserted a 16gig card in, plugged the unit in, and once I figured out how to set the configuration I was set. The DVR turns on and off just as advertised. The video is slightly blury but more than clear enough to use in an insurance case when some idiot cuts in front of you. Some mention the display doesn't shut off. There is a setting that will shut it off by selecting a time of how long it should remain on. I set it for the minimum (I think 1 minute) and it does shut off for me. Besides, the screen folds up and can't be seen anyway. I also found the mount fairly solid. The only thing so far that I don't like are the instructions - they are pretty bad, but if you have any technical sense at all, the configuration menu, controls, and how to adjust and lock the mount are all pretty logical. If this simple and cheap DVR lasts 6 months and I have to buy another every 6 months, isn't it worth less than $50.00 a year to have video proof of fault in an accident?

10/28/12 Update - Well the video display screen on the unit is now displaying nothing but white. This means I can't do any re-configuring at all. I have checked the SD card and the unit is still recording, turn on and off with the ignition. I'm going to continue using it until it dies but will also keep an eye out for a higher quaility unit. Considering it's doing what I want it to do and I like what it does I don't see it as a waste of money. It was a good test to see if I like it, and I do. Some people have mentioned that the video is choppy at higher resolution. I haven't found that to be the DVR itself but if the user tries to view the video with their SD card plugged into a USB adapter in a USB 1.1 port instead of a USB 2.0 or 3.0, yes, the video is choppy, but this is the port, not the actual recording. Because this unit is cheap and the display didn't last very long, I won't be purchasing another from this vendor or even this model of DVR.

09/20/2013 Update - I should have posted this sometime back but forgot. The blank screen issue was resolved by unplugging the power and removing the battery for a few days. The unit lost all its settings when I finally got around to powering it back up. That was okay though because the screen returned. I reprogrammed the unit and it has been working perfectly ever since. There appears to be a software glitch not a hardware failure that caused the screen to go blank. Nothing that can't be worked around. When the screen was blank, the unit continued to record like it was supposed to.

title: Setup is in Russian, fixed that, but still doesnt work!
text:

Third, colleague tries changing language to English and keeps getting camera error message, over and over. Start, restart, retry...error.

I try to give a product the benefit of the doubt and assume user error or a hypercritical consumer, but I've done enough to try to make it work, this one's fault goes right to the company. Yes its cheap, but what good is that when its not useable and then you have to go through the trouble of returning it. Now lets hope I actually get a refund.

title: Good for the price.
text:
This dashcam seems to work as good as advertised (and reviewed on YouTube), and for $15 I'm not expecting high-end results. The LCD screen is not of high resolution, but it's good enough to see what you need to see. The 10 foot car lighter plug wire is long enough (in my car) to wrap around the passenger side of the windshield for an unobstructed view of the road.
Fortunately, the IR lights (which don't seem to be bright enough to illuminate anything more than a few feet in front) can be turned off through the menu, saving battery life and avoid camera overheating (which ruined a different IR camera I once had).

I may have gotten an old stock unit because the battery won't hold a charge. Fortunately I found a replacement BL-5C battery and charger on Amazon for just a few bucks (worth it for me). However, this isn't a big inconvenience since the travel adapter is included. along with a USB cord. I'm pretty sure this is a "cheap knockoff," but I don't mind since the price is very affordable.

Think of it this way; if you get involved in an accident, having a dashcam may avoid you being blamed if it's the other driver's fault. You will have detailed video proof. Just take a peek at a few Russian dashcam videos to see what I mean.

Update: After "testing" the dashcam on a short trip to the grocery store, I observed the results on my laptop. Even though the menu settings were for the highest definition possible, the video playback seemed very grainy and choppy. This was on an overcast day late in the afternoon, so that may have something to do with it. I'll continue to test this dashcam in bright daylight and in night conditions.
Again, for the price I wasn't expecting a lot, but it does work well.

text: I just received this camera yesterday. I also bought a 16 gb memory card for it. Installed the battery and after a minute figured out how to configure it using the menu. For the price it is fairly well constructed. The mount is excellent. It has a 270 degree lense which captures a wide field of view. I placed it on my windshield easily enough. Using the power cord to power the device makes it turn on and record when I start the car. There is very little vibration coming through the mount to distort the video. I use the 640x480 size because it will be the most stable and smallest file size. Basically it does exactly what I expected it to do and the price cannot be beat. I previously had purchased a mount so I could use my Flip video recorder but that was a hassle. This camera is installed and runs automatically so I don't have to fool with it anymore. It is cheap insurance to document what happens in front of your car. I will be buying another one for my wifes car. I recommend this camera for the quality, price and ease of use.

title: Worth the money
text:
[[VIDEOID:1efec5fceb524ff6df91ff822c35d33b]] I'm on day 8 of this camera and really couldn't be happier with it for the price. It's not 1080 or even 720, the best resolution is the VGA setting which is only just "good" quality when used during daylight hours. The night vision is poor but if there was an incident I believe the camera would capture enough evidence to hold up in court or with an insurance company.

Here's my impressions:

1. The camera housing is cheaply made
2. The mount is cheap but the locking suction cup works very well. As some of the other reviewers mentioned get the camera mount set up once, don't figit with the mount repeatedly or the poor quality plastic will strip out and fail. Get it right once and just leave it.
3. I was worried about large gaps between clips. I am using a sandisk 16G Ultra class 10 card. I formated it in the camera and am doing 5 minute clips. There is a little less then 1 second gap betwean clips.
4. IR LED's work but dont do any good while driving. I just disabled them in the menu.
5. Even during daylight hours you wont be able to read license plates or street signs (you can make out stop signs.) So if you're looking for a cam that can get that detailed you might want to consider another option.
6. The power cord was long enough to run under the dash, up the window pillar and under the headliner so I could discretely mount the camer in front of my rear view mirror. I think it's about 10 feet long.
7. Video playback can be done on the camera or you can pop out the sd card and copy the videos to your PC. No need to use a third party app to convert the files like some other dash cams.
8. Audio is kind of a bit off. It captures everything well but it makes voices have a higher pitch then normal.

Overall I'm pleased with this camera and it does what I need it to for the price. I went ahead ordered another one yesterday for my wifes car after testing this one out for a few days.

My only worry now is how long it will last. I've read some people have had theirs fail after a couple weeks or months.

title: Good enough
text: Surprisingly good little camera but DO NOT leave it in a hot car. It ended up all warped and coming apart (still works though!). If you're not looking for the best quality, this will work for you. You can easily go through the files on your PC in 1,3 and 5 minute intervals. Records sound well and when reviewing you can easily read license plates if you ever have the need.

title: Great Bargain for Safety
text:
It's much more convenient than more expensive similar cameras. Just pop in memory card, plug into port (or cigarette lighter) pop on the window and go. My only complaint is that it won't always retain the date and time.

The FIRST day, it recorded an incident of stalking, which is part of the reason I needed it. I never drive without it and feel much safer.

title: Great little item!
text:
I noticed there were some who said this thing didn't work at all, or would freeze up after not much time of use. In the instructions it states that they're aware of this happening and that just like a computer, it can hang up so there is a reset button on it, the type you need a paper clip to press.

Having said that, I've only recently begun using this and was very excited to get it going. I went to Best Buy to get my SD card and in the parking lot I attached it to my windshield and routed the 12V cigarette lighter plug wire along the trim and tucked it to give it as neat of an appearance as I could; took me about 10 minutes and I was ready to go. Just as advertised, this unit will start and stop with the key switch as long as it's plugged in. The mount that comes with it is a cheap plastic mount, but I have to say that it feels sturdy for a cheap mount and upon testing the suction cup on several areas, it operates much better than I expected.

The only negative I can give this product is the ability to record at night. It has the IR diodes up front but it is essentially useless at night unless there is decent light.

Given that I only paid 16.99 (and as of now the price has come down to 15.49) I have to say it was well worth it. The peace of mind that I have knowing that if some jerk is in the wrong, or attempts to pull some kind of scam, I will have video evidence to maintain my innocence.

title: As you will see from this video upload...
text:
This is the whole reason I bought this camera for myself! While I haven't gotten the time stamp issue corrected, this video will be turned over to the insurance company of the person in the vehicle in front of me. This happened just yesterday evening! I actually forgot for a few minutes that I had the dashcam running! I think for less than $20 bucks I have more than gotten my money's worth. I have edited out the sound, because of the F-bomb that flew out of my mouth at the time of the accident! But sound is very legible, I could hear my radio playing in the background, and myself at the time of the accident. I hope this convinces someone to buy this if you are on the fence. Had this lady not gotten on front of me right before that intersection, this may have well been me, which is why I purchased it!! Both drivers were ok, btw.

Update 6/24/15: I have had this camera for nearly two years. I had a few glitches with it, such as not powering on properly, or going blank. I just pop the battery out for about 20 seconds, then replace it, and continue just fine. I never had any further problems, it worked fine. I recorded a couple of more accidents, that fortunately did not involve ME! The video was copied and turned over to the respective parties. I placed this in my wife's car over this weekend, and she went to work with it. Yesterday, she left it attached to the windshield in 97° outside temps ... the entire camera melted under the extreme heat conditions and now needs to be replaced. After owning this for nearly 2 years, and capturing 3 car accidents, I will not hesitate to buy this again. Well worth the money, as inexpensive as it is.

text: This little vehicle DVR has worked flawlessly. Very easy to set up and operate. On one side is the slot for an SD card and on the opposite side the outlet to plug in the included 12v plug for power. It will start recording automatically. When you shut you're vehicle off the DVR turns off automatically. You can also set the resolution and the time and date. It shows you a live image while its recording and by pressing the play button it will show you what it recorded. It adjusts up & down and left to right. For less than the price of two movie tickets you can't go wrong.

title: Works but has problems...
text:
This particular design of dash cams has several issues:

The SD card slot is on the side. The card does not click into place. Is held in place by the flimsy cover.
The one I received gives me 'Card Error' half a dozen times before it will work again each time I put the card back after reviewing video.

I did not pay attention that this model does not have the 12V input port, so USB is the only choice and connects via the mini USB port on the camera which is flimsy and will fail if you remove the cable too many times.
The provided USB cable is uselessly short. I had to cut it in half and add speaker wire to reach a wall outlet and had to come up with my own wall power adapter with USB out.
I cannot start or stop the recording when the power via USB is connected, so have to start/stop recording from battery power. As soon as the battery dies that will be the end of my line with this model.

I have two other dash cams, which do not have the IRs on the front, and have USB as well as 12V power inputs and the SD card slot is located on the back and the card clicks into place. They have been working non stop for over eight months and I haven't had any issues with reinserting the cards into them. Recommend to get that model. Price is about the same.

I use these for home security and get about 10 hours of recording on a 32GB SD card.

title: Guinea pig camera test, and this animal needs to be put DOWN.
text:
[[VIDEOID:484edde19eb6b5ebe52da54fffcd2bfb]] There are obviously a number of different units that have the same casing as this one. The lenses can be VERY different, and mine is perhaps a 50mm lens equivalent on a camera, not at ALL 120 degree angle. Even my standard iPhone 5S has a much wider (and 100x clearer) image than this. Also the lens is pretty crappy (uploading pics and video) and the resolution quality is even more horrid. Granted it is a crap shoot buying this as it seems the manufacturer has probably 6 or even more different places that assemble these. The menus are different, image quality and frame rate are (as I've compared mine with others and mine is the far cheaper version). The unit was set onto FHD 1080p, but two painful realities: It only recorded in 720p (half the size), and the image quality was SO BAD, that I could barely read license plate on vehicles in front of me.

Thinking that perhaps the VGA setting might yield a wider image, I attempted that setting, however there was zero change in field of recording view. One can take still images, but they are absolutely no better, and the size is so paltry, what's the point? (I will add images from this and comparing iPhone image too). You're really gambling with the parent company that designed these. My suggestion? Look at the good vs bad reviews. If the good numbers outweigh the bad, that's your chance of getting a winner. However, if (like this camera) the reviews are far more worse than better (34pct of 1-star reviews vs 24pct of 5-star postings as of mine), you'll more likely get a unit that you won't be pleased with. I'd like to just throw mine on a trash heap, but I'll just return it this week.

I will attempt to upload the uncompressed images and clips, but they already look bad now, and I wonder how they will look when Amazon compresses them? Look at the bright yellow sign near the start of the clip, and how impossible it is to read what it says.

title: The low price excuses a lot
text:
I bought this from Amazing Tech Depot. It's one of the few times I received something like this in a ziploc bag (with the DVR in a bubble wrap). Construction is cheap, and although the instructions described an A/V cable, there isn't one in the package. I wasn't planning on connecting this directly to a TV, so I didn't follow up on that.

What's included is the DVR, the lithium ion battery, the suction cup mount, a piece of instruction leaflet (English, Chinese and Russian), the car power adapter (very long cord - can be routed to keep it out of the way) and a mini USB cable. You need to open one of the flaps on the side to plug in the USB power cable. The other flap on the opposite side covers the SD card slot.

The screen is protected by a sheet of plastic. Removing it was a pain, but take your time so that you don't damage the LCD. The LCD is useful for helping aim the camera, and for settings, but unusable in bright sunlight even inside the car. I went through the menu settings. They're pretty much self explanatory, which is good because the instruction leaflet was no help. You need to supply a full sized SD card. I used a 32 GB card without any problem.

There is a 1920x1080 setting for video. When I chose that, it recorded in 1280x720 (NOT 1080p), but at slightly above 30 fps. At the 1280x720 setting, it recorded at just slightly above 29.97 fps.

Encoding format is motion JPEG. Video quality is mediocre. Don't count on being able to read license plates, but you can definitely tell what you're seeing. IR, as most people pointed out, is useless, and you can leave it off.

Using it is simple. Leave it plugged in. When the car turns on, it powers up the unit which starts recording. When you turn the car off, the unit records for another few seconds, then powers off. Files are 2 mins in length, configurable for longer lengths. Default is to erase older files when the card is full.

At just a bit over $20, it's a good DVR to play around with. Probably good enough for insurance purposes, though I'm not sure if it can be used as evidence in court. My guess is that it would probably be good enough to prove your innocence (or at least cast reasonable doubt), but not enough to get someone else convicted. At this price, it is cheap enough to try out, and buy a better unit if you decide this is something you'd like to have.

title: Which version did you get???
text: Evidently what we get when ordering this is the possibility of a variety of different models. I read of satisfactory settings and looping options. Mine came with what would appear to be 1, 2, and 5 minute options but doesn't loop. When I start it up that is how long it will record until it turns itself OFF. If I turn that feature "off" then it will keep recording until it is full without stopping- and no looping- and when it is full it must be manually erased to start recording again. What a pain. If you live anywhere that your car sits in the sun and gets hot forget recording on the way home. Even making sure to pull it out of the window and putting it under the dash the hot car is enough that it won't run until halfway home. The quality of the recording is good and for the price it is ok. But evidently good luck on which "version" you get and if you have all the settings and if it will loop or not. So if you don't mind learning to manually work with it all the time... Otherwise I am going to look into a better one that is less frustrating.

The video card is easily removed and played on the computer, in 3 minute increments.

Highly recommended for the price, if you are looking for a cheaper solution.
