title: Hard to read license plates; great for general use.
text:
[[VIDEOID:716d9ef08bdaa5bcc82b84ca981686c0]] For the money, you can't beat this. Russian drivers may have it bad, but US drivers also are plagued with liars and scammers. I recently moved next door to the great state of California, home of some of the worst drivers in the US, here in Reno, NV. My camera has captured many, many people with California plates driving rather questionably, and a few Nevada natives driving recklessly. I plan on making a channel with the fun things I capture on video.

So onto the camera. I have a [[ASIN:B001ECQVTM Transcend 16 GB Class 6 SDHC Flash Memory Card TS16GSDHC6E]] in this thing. I find it records longer using 480P than the 720P setting. And as you can see in the video, there isn't that much of a difference. The first sequence is 480p and the second sequence is 720p.

As you can see, the video looks a little washed out. I haven't found in-camera settings to adjust this yet. It may be because the IR lights are on.

I don't have any recent night time driving video, but the IR lights work okay. They don't illuminate much more than what your headlights do. You're better off just keeping them turned off to use less power. The date and time functions work nicely and imprint on the video. It keeps time well. The internal battery lasts quite a while.

This camera has earned the nickname "Disco-Magic" from my fiance due to the sound it plays when it turns off and on. The sound it plays when it turns on sounds like some sparkly magic sound. The sound it plays when it turns off sounds like disco music. Hence, Disco-Magic. I've had this unit for several months now and it hasn't failed me yet.

And check out the beautiful scenery in the video on my daily commute!

title: Product has failed me
text:
For $22.00, you would say to yourself that it is too good to be true. That is indeed the case. (cons same as what others reported)

- When it did work, video was not great, reasonable on 640 mode.
- Instructions are of no value, but with menu button experimentation, you'll see how it works.
- 2/5/10 min loop does not work. (only once where i saw it loop at 2min)
- "HD" does not work. Might as well leave it in 640 mode to save disk space.
- 90% of the time, playback is very choppy. (also reported by reviewer "Manx")
- Recording corrupts the SD card. (this is the cause of choppy playback.) Takes 30 min to copy a 50MB file from SD card to laptop. Have to reformat under windows to get the card to work again. (fyi: card works fine with my Sony camera and copies very fast between Sony camera and laptop)
- Locks up on many occasions. Had to remove battery/power.
- IR does not seem to have any effect. Recorded during nite, but playback showed dark video. (headlights helped more)
- Bright / sunny day and driving into sun causes recorded video to be "foggy/snow blizzard". - maybe direct sunlight too much for weak lens
- Product appeared used when I got it.

Overall, product not reliable and does not work as advertised. I wouldn't mind it with 640 mode, since objective is to get proof of a accident, but the broken 2/5/10 looping and choppy playback are unacceptable. Spend the extra money and get something that is reliable.

title: I really like it! (NOW UPDATED, 1 year later)
text:
This product us well worth the 30 or 40 bucks you pay for it. If you want HD picture, GPS, & G-forge readings there are plenty of OTHER options but they will be hundreds. I see this camera as something that will provide non-bias evidence if ever needed to defend myself.

It IS low resolution, but not close to a deal breaker. It reminds me of the quality of digital video cameras 5 or so years back as far as picture quality is concerned.

The on-board LCD really should only be used for aiming the camera to the car's center. Other than that the LCD is very low quality. Once you remove the video from the card, it looks mush better than on the LCD. I am able to make out clearly the license plates in front of me for one car length, out of that it is too pixelated, but still shows a good view of what is going on. There is also a digital zoom if you need to get a little closer, albeit lower resolution, to your subject while driving.

You CAN turn off sound which I thought helped and saved space on the SD card. The IR should also be turned off due to at night it reflects off the window back to the camera. It can be turned on again if you need to take the camera out to record outside damage without a light source.

Night vision (IR Off) is lacking. You would still be able to use it in court to show how the other cars moved, but you couldn't use it to ID people or plates.

Battery lasts a couple hours but I just keep mine plugged in because the charging cable they sent is LONG. It wrapped from the review mirror (Where my camera is), around the frame of the windshield, down the door, under the carpet, under the chair, and into the center console (2004 Toyota Camry).

Mount is EXCELLENT, the most solid part of the package; never moves aim or loses suction.

Case of camera is medium-grade plastic and seems to hold together well, not too bad by any means.

Overall: I will be getting another for the second car. Happy with purchase.

1 YEAR UPDATE:
The camera is still running just as it did when I first set it up. The only thing that broke was the most solid part of the item... the mount. The suction ring came off of the mount so I could not attach it to the window. It has a standard camera mount screw so finding a replacement was not hard. My overall opinion of the product has not changed: It is a GREAT camera for the amount you have to pay! Video is not great, but it will hold up in court if you needed it (Which is why most of you are getting it anyways). It was HARD to set up but once that is done, it works forever. I will be buying more and am happy I got the first one.

title: Ok for $20 - Updated 10/5/13
text:
Update 10/5/2013

Did some more research and finally realized this is a knockoff of the real DVR207. So I bought a real one off eBay for $55 shipped free from HK and it's WAY better. So how to tell if it's genuine?

1. Genuine box is blue not white. When unit is on the indicator lights are blue not red.
2. Cigarette lighter adapter is straight not angled. Jack is mini-round not mini-usb.
3. Genuine unit has light sensor on top which gives you WAY better night video.
4. Genuine unit has HDMI and fake has an empty space next to usb.

So I have the fake $20 unit in my car and the night video is terrible and not wide angle. My wife has the genuine in her car.

Good:
Easy to install. Suction cup works great. Camera works pretty reliably and records every trip.

Bad:
Recording in VGA mode yields the best picture quality. Video quality at higher resolutions is actually worse.
Night vision - only works if you are right behind a vehicle and your headlight lit up the backside. Driving on street of Los Angeles it records pretty much nothing.

Overall:
This unit seems to be a knockoff of the DVR270 which looks exactly the same, but seems to have different menu settings when I checked the video reviews on Utube. Night vision does not work for dash cams even for more expensive models because the windshield blocks the IR LED's (so I have been told by several techies). My conclusion - ok for $20 bucks.

It is also funny how most of the sellers of this unit, including this one here, don't have a model name/number, they just call it "2.5 inch portable LED DVR" and variations on the theme.

title: Recording Resolution is only 640x480 pixels!
text:
Amazon's description states, "Recording resolution:1280x960 / 720x480 / 640x480 pixels". THIS IS NOT TRUE!
The "capture" resolution is 640x480 no matter if the "standard" or "fine" setting is used. However, the "Video" monitoring output may be set to 1280x960 / 720x480 / 640x480 pixels. This allows for full screen viewing on a HDTV screen.
The captured MJPEG avi will always be 640x480 resolution regardless. MJPEG compression is also not very agressive and will result in large video files of 25 MB per minute of recorded video.and will require a 16GB SD card be used for up to 10 hours of video.
The lens also is not much of a wide-angle lens and delivers poor coverage of the roadway.

title: Huge Value, Works Great!
text: 15 bucks?!? Are you kidding me?!?  This thing works great. Doesn't pick up sound very well, which means I can still sing along with the radio without embarrassing myself. My plan was to try this one to see if there was any value to having a dash cam and then upgrade to a better one, but this one works so well that I'll continue to use it until it conks out someday.

title: Not bad for the price.
text:
I got this installed flush under my rear view mirror in my 2012 Chevy Volt. I was able to tuck the wire away and route it around and into my center console to plug it in. You do not see any wires.
If you are satisfied with fuzzy video, similar to pro home surveillance systems, than this is for you. I gave it 4 stars for the price and the fact that it does the job of a car cam very well. Video quality is not good, but comparative to other security cams. Reviewing video on the small screen looks quite well, but just like cell phones, when you put it up on a big screen it is bad.
This will do the job of recording an accident or someone giving your car a door knick, or proof that you did not pass a red light, it was yellow, or audio from an officer or border agent violating your rights.
Besides that, it is just cool to have a car cam and it is care free. It turns on itself when you start the car and shuts off 20 minutes after shutting off the car. I got it recording to a 32 GB SD card. So I can get days of video, plus I use motion activated to save even more room.
Do not let the 5, 10, and 20 minute cycle periods fool you. These are nothing more than chapters to make reviewing easier. It will record to the full extent of your memory card. I know this is not explained well in the description.
Only thing I worry about is someone thinking this is an expensive device and break in, not knowing it is around $22.

title: Works as stated
text:
And for the price, it is indeed a bargain. Now that I have had it for a couple of weeks, it just runs and I mostly forget about it.
Now I'm looking at getting something a tad more advanced- one with a GPS recorder in it for instance.
I'm currently using this with an 8 Gb SD card. I suggest that you get at least a 16 Gb card. The 8 Gb card fills up and "turns over" too quickly, (about 2 hours) even though I have the interval set to 5 minutes, and set a much lower picture (non HD) definition.
I'd give this 5 stars for the price, except for the somewhat large base that holds it to the windshield.
Ahh.. maybe I'll eventually bring it into the house and use it as a birdcam, looking out at my hummingbird feeder!

title: Keyless ignition systems beware!
text:
This is not a bad unit. Though I do have an issue with it. My Buick LaCrosse uses a keyless ignition system (just need the keyfob on you and press the start button) and this unit emit so much EMF (Electro-Magnetic Frequency) that it disrupts the signal from my keyfob, so the car does not always recognize that the keyfob is in proximity of the car. I often recieved errors that my key was not present, and my car wouldn't always turn off all the way. I took it to the dealership, and this was the cause.
Would I use this in another car that didn't have the keyless technology my Buick has? Absolutely.

title: simply excellent .... ESPECIALLY for the price.
text:
Unbelievable for fifteen dollars!!
at the same time that I ordered this one, I also ordered three other dash cams.
the others cost $140, $105, and $50.
Do you know what I found? this one works BETTER than all three of the others.
Sure, the others have a bit better build quality and a couple of features that this one doesn't have;
but if they were ALL the same price, I would choose this one.
partly because the others each had quality control issues and had intermittent problems because of that.
This one is rugged, works every time, simple to operate, and is just not nearly the investment that the others were.
If you need a very professional & well-built dash cam, you likely have to spend $300.
But for an introductory one .... and to play around with and get used to having a dash cam in your window, this one is just excellent.
what can you loose !!!

title: Good for the price
text: It's a cheap way to record your driving. It doesn't see license plates clearly but there's sound so you can read the plate & it will be recorded. I bought it as accident insurance. If someone abruptly cuts into your lane & you hit them, you're automatically at fault because you failed to stop. The offending driver will lie and say they were in front of you all along but you were driving too fast/ tailgating/ etc... I haven't had an incident where I could test this (thankfully). It seems reasonable to assume that if you tell the officer you have a dash camera that will show the driver swerve into your lane leaving you no room to respond, it will be evidence against the other driver. Once the driver is informed of your evidence, they may admit their action to avoid police action against them. I think your insurance company would like that sort of evidence too. It also shows traffic lights. If you're pulled over for running a red light when it was yellow, the video will show the light color as you passed through the intersection. The night vision isn't good. You get a general view of the road. It's not a security camera. If a person is in the range of the camera, you can see them. If it's a car, you won't get a plate#. If you're hit by junk flying out of a truck, you can read off the plate#. You must use the power cord. The battery doesn't last more than about 20 min. The directions aren't good. You have to play with it to set the date, etc... The default settings are fine for video recording. You can take still pics but I don't see any reason for that. I was able to view the test drive when I dropped my car off with my mechanic. It looks like a radar detector so no one pays it any attention.

text: Read a lot of negative feedbacks on this product, but I thought for the low price I would take a chance. Nothing but good results so far. Could fall apart tomorrow but I feel I have got my moneys worth.

title: Seriously Adequate and a Great Value
text:
News Update:
* The Hi-Rez video works with a Lexar Platinum II SDHC UHS-1 16 GB card. That's a class 10 card. My class 4 would not shoot in hi-rez. I can now make out license plates at medium/close distances.
* The OK button is on the main unit, not with the other menu buttons.
* Files are AVI format and will open in the free Quicktime viewer on my Mac. They can be converted from there.
* Hi-Rez settings run about 38MB a minute. That's about 20 minutes a Gigabyte. That's about 5.3 hours before rollover.
* There is no time gap when it starts the new video (confirmed in hi-rez setting)
* I'm now exceptionally pleased with the unit given the price.

The other reviewer who wrote the Cliff Notes Instructions really tipped me over the edge; it obviously works for him. I think the toughest thing to realize is that the OK button is not with the other menu buttons; it's on the main unit instead. Once you get that, it's pretty easy to navigate the menus. I was surprised that it included a cell-phone-like battery for the price. You will need to buy a card but I had one laying around that I used (but it wasn't fast enough for the hi-rez setting).

It's ready to roll and the factory default is the least resolution setting. The date/time will need to be set also. However, to use it, you can just stick it on the window and plug it in and you're up and running fully protected. I like the little flip down screen too. One enhancement I'd like to see is a cross hairs that extends all the way across because it would make it a little easier to line it up perfectly with the horizon. Otherwise, the little reticle works good.

I checked it really carefully and the videos transition without any gaps. Sound is not great but you can make out words, hear turn signals clicking, and hear most road sounds. I'd say the audio is somewhat poor resolution but that's not really a major concern. It also rolls over automatically. One thing that I'm not sure about still is how to mark a video so it isn't overwritten? I don't think it has this feature.

Video at night was just OK but not great in the low rez setting.

The real point is that at this price, you really have no excuse to wait if you're a first timer. Even if you graduate to a better one that's got HD and high resolution sound, this one could still be great to have for the rear window or even monitoring the cars interior (think teenaged drivers or fleet vehicles).

Bottom Line: Don't wait any longer. For $23.95 including shipping, there's no reason not to get one.

Addendum:
I had my first event three days after I got it! A tire came rolling at me on the freeway and I dodged it (the poor guy behind me got nailed though). I feel for the buyers who got units with problems; I've been lucky so far. I would still recommend it for first timers.

title: Really good camera. It works.
text:
I use this camera for driving and as a dashboard cam. Before I get into this review, let me say what I flat out like about this camera:

1) The video goes in a loop once the memory card is full. So I have a 16GB card, and this records about 3-5 hours of video on it. Once that 3-5 hours is used, it goes back to the start and starts recording from the oldest point. You can still see the most recently recorded video whenever you want.. I use it on my car. This is the main feature I love since I don't have to do anything and I don't have to worry about the memory card getting full and me having to delete it or potentially not record when I need it to. There is a setting on the setup to make it so that when the card gets full, it doesn't overwrite the oldest point to record again. I have no need for that and want it to record in a loop.

2) I can plug it into my power supply and when I unplug it the camera turns off. Also when you plug it in, it automatically starts recording without touching or pressing anything. The only time you need to press the record button is the initial point. This makes getting in and out of the car a breeze. So I plug it in when I drive, then I unplug it when I get home. Super easy and nothing need to be messed with. When I'm at a store I can still have it plugged in and record in case.

3) Good quality videos. I live in a city so at night it's bright enough to see everything in front of me. Not super clear but good enough to see at least what needs to be seen which is right in front of your car as well as any sort of signs and lights.

Now for things I don't like:

1) Ultra cheap plastic piece of junk. I mean literally a piece of junk plastic is what this is. It comes with a mount and I broke it one day just by touching it. As such, the way it's hanged on my car is by a bungee cord wrapped around the rear view mirror. Not pretty but it works. This can be a pro as well since if someone breaks into your car, you only lose a cheap camera that can easily be replaced.

2) You can't replay the video on the camera itself (or at least not that I can figure out). You have to remove the card and play it on a computer. I found this to be a major issue especially if you need to see the video right away for whatever reason.

3) Videos are segmented to 3 minutes. So even if the card is capable of storing 90 minutes, each video file is 3 minutes in length. So if something happened, chances are it's spread across in files. You'd have to use a video software of some type to combine the videos into one continuous video.

4) A couple of times the camera went all crazy. I mean it froze and either didn't turn off when I unplugged it or I would plug it in and it would freeze. I would have to unplug everything and take out the battery. This only happened about three times for me. It's very rare for it to happen.

5) I have no idea on the battery life of this thing. So I can't really comment on that. However, for my purpose, I only need it powered while I'm in the car.

I have five of these cameras each with 16gb cards. I had it for about a year or so now and I love it and use it everyday. To date, it hasn't failed me yet other than the cheap plastic mount breaking.

Now for story time. One day while driving to the store for lunch, I was waiting for a left turn. The light turned green and I turned left as well as the person across the street turned left since we both had the green light. Unknowing to the driver across me, the person next to me went forward as well but had the red light. The two cars collided and with a loud bang. Knowing I had video evidence of me having green light, and the forward light was red, I decided to talk to the officer at the scene of the accident. Not really for being a "good samaritan" but more like I wanted to test if these videos would hold any merit. The police officer on scene told me both people said they had the green light, and I explained I had a dash video that might show that I had the green light, and the light was red. He agreed to watch the video and we got in my car and tried to look at it. We found that you couldn't play it back on the camera itself. So I told him I was going back to my office and that I could email him the video. He agreed and he gave me his card.

I went back to my office and got the video off the memory stick and emailed it to the officer. The video was clear as day. It showed the car next to me clearly, and showed that I had the green light, and the forward light was red. It also clearly showed all cars involved. Even though it didn't show the actual accident, you can clearly make out each car moments before the accident and exactly who had the red light or green light. I explained to the officer this and he saw the video. He loved it and said he would show the judge the video and would charge the woman who ran the red light. He said I might have to show up to court to explain that I had the video. He also said I had to turn in the original file to him and I agreed. All said and done, the person pleaded guilty to running the red light merely from the fact that the video was there and I didn't even need to show up.

In conclusion, YES this camera system does work. While I didn't experience an actual accident, I indirectly helped someone else from being falsely accused of running or not running a light. Since nobody else was there to help or be a witness, this video did just that for them.

I can definitely say that while this camera is poorly constructed, it does work. I live in a area that has four seasons and it can get ice cold at night during winter months. Since I only had this camera through one winter, it still works. It even stayed in the car in extreme heat during the summer time. I shall see if this thing can last for two years which I'm sure it will. I rarely touch it and just plug and unplug it as I get in the car

text:

It makes a good surveillance camera while in the parking lot. It can be set to motion detect recording and has a back-up battery that allows it to record, even when the truck is off. The video has a time and date stamp on it allowing for better records of events.
I have no complaints with the camera.

title: Waste of time
text:
Purchased first unit, recorded a short video and the sound was nothing but clicks and buzzing. No audio to speak of, just noise. I contacted Amazon to ship it back, and they informed me that they do not handle returns for this seller but instead contacted them. The seller in turn contacted me and sent me a new unit free of charge to replace the defective first one, which I threw away. The second unit arrived and it has the same defect as the first one... no audio, just clicks and buzzing noises.
As others have stated, even if the audio worked the video is not worth the money. I could see no difference between fine and standard mode. I considered keeping it just for teh video capability, but it is not even worth that. Am returning for a refund, I will spend the extra money and pray that I will get something better.

title: Good Cam for the Price, but bad performance!
text:
First I would like to say although this is a cheap price; the camera itself should not come looking like it was used. The camera came with plastic hanging out from the LCD screen and some type of sticky stuff all over it. Then to top that off, everything that was wrapped in plastic; it was not factory done. It had that look like a refurbished unit. I've dealt with wholesale companies to know that these type of cameras don't come like that. This was a used and damaged camera that they tried to fix and resell. If I wanted something used I would have selected that. I for got to add, the battery for this unit will not hold a charge.

Pros

1. Great for day time only
2. Motion Detection
3. Camera starts up when car starts up

Cons

1. HD features don't work
2. IR Features don't work
3. Battery no good, will not hold a charge
4. Night Vision is poor
5. Manual was not helpful - had to come back to reviews to find out how to set the camera to English Menu (I don't know Chinese)

I gave this cam three stars because it work best in the day time and even then you might have to adjust the picture for clarity.

title: Plug it in and drive. Love the auto cycle loop.
text:
Hard to find anything this nice for so cheap. It does what it needs to do, which is turn on when the car starts and record. Stops recording when you shut off the car. If nothing is worth keeping on the card, then you just let it loop back to the beginning of the SD card and it starts all over again. A 16 GB card last about 8 and a half hrs of recording time for me. Getting it set up was a little tricky since the instructions were poorly written in sloppy English but anyone with an average IQ can figure it out :) Remember ---the OK(set) button is the little button next to the power button. Odd place to be. Should be next to the menu button. Took me a while to get used to it.

Best to set it OFF motion detect since that will cause it to record only when it sees motion. Kept on getting 5 seconds of recording intervals while I was driving(it sensed poorly!)

I love using it so I am buying two more for my two other cars. Great for recording accidents or traffic violations. The only hassle I have with it is to remember to unplug the camera from the power outlet so my car battery is not used when I leave the car. It probably drains it very little but I still would rather not drain it for no reason.

Same sorta thing from the car retail shops was over $300 so I thought this was well worth the money.

title: Here are the instructions you will need, UPDATED
text:
Excellent place to start with a dashboard (or maybe home security) video camera and DVR. Cheap and reasonably good. Just to be clear, the 270 degrees refers to turning the camera around by hand in the mount; the field of view is 120 degrees. The instructions were so bad that I have regenerated them below.
UPDATE: In response to readers, I'm using the default settings, And am getting about 80 1-minute videos with audio, about 50MB each and they are automatically overwriting the oldest on a 4GB chip. I have not yet filled a 32GB chip (24 hrs)!

LAST UPDATE: l am informed that the menu on items purchased after Dec 3, 2013 has changed, so these instructions may not be useful for people who have purchased such units. Did I mention that these might make dandy motion- activated home security devices?

Dowson Dashboard Video/DVR Operating Instructions
These instructions are based on the actual menu settings of a device delivered in mid-February, 2013. The included instructions did not match.

Switching Modes
1) Press ON/OFF: (on the back of the DVR this is the international O+I superposed).
2) Default mode is Video Recording; press "OK" (which is a round spot on the back of the DVR which lights up) to begin recording. Press it again to stop recording and save file.
3) Press MODE to switch successively between: Video recording (red cam icon), Audio Recording (blue A), Playback (left arrow icon), in circular fashion.
4) Press to turn OFF

Function Keys
ON/OFF
OK- confirm mode selected
Keys below screen, in left to right order:
MENU - choose a menu for settings, detailed below, and also leave a menu
DOWN - go down a menu, or 4/3/2/1 x digital zoom while recording
UP - go up a menu, or 1/2/3/4 x digital zoom while recording
MODE - mode switching video record / audio record / playback

Menu Settings

Video / System Settings
Press ON, press OK, press MENU, press OK, then UP or Down as needed
Video................Output Settings
1. Size..............640x480, 720x980, 1280x720, 1280x960
2. EV................+1/3, +0.0, -1/3, -2/3, -1.0
3. White Bal.........Auto, Daylight, Cloudy, Tungsten, Fluorescent
4. Time Stamp........Off, Date Only, Date & Time
5. Video Time........3, 4, 5, 10, 15 minutes (per file)
6. Motion Det........Off, On (when On saves 2 min files during motion)
7. Record............Off, On
8. Night Mode........Off, On
After each selection press OK to confirm, and press MENU to leave one menu item for another and then again to exit

Video with Audio Settings
Press ON, press OK, press Mode, press MENU, press OK, then UP or Down as needed
Capture.................Setup
1. Size:................12, 8, 5, 3, 2, 1.3 M, or 640x480 (0.3 M)
2. Quality..............Fine / Standard / Economy
3. Scene Mode...........Auto, Sport, Night
4. EV...................+1/3, +0.0, -1/3, -2/3, -1.0 (Exposure luminance adjustment)
5. White Bal............Auto, Daylight, Cloudy, Tungsten, Fluorescent
6. ISO..................Auto, 100, 200
7. Color................Standard, Vivid, Sepia, Monochrome
8. Saturation...........High, Normal, Low
9. Sharpness............Hard, Normal, Soft
10. Time Stamp..........Off, Date Only, Date & Time
11. Burst...............On, Off
After each selection press OK to confirm, and press MENU to leave one menu item for another and then again to exit

Playback Settings
Press ON, press OK, press Mode, press Mode again, press MENU, press OK, then UP or Down as needed
Play....................Setup
1. Delete...............Single, All, Select (came up as Execute)
2. Volume...............1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8
Press MENU again to get the following:
1. Format...............Cancel, Execute (came up Next Menu)
2. Beep.................On, Off
3. Language.............English, Francais, Deutsch, Italiano, Espanol, +6 others
4. Auto Off.............1 min, 3 min, 5 min, Off
5. Sys Reset............Cancel, Reset (came up Next Menu)
6. Light Freq...........60 Hz, 50 Hz
7. TV Output............NTSC, PAL
8. Data Input...........Off, Set
9. USB..................PC Cam, Disk Drive
10. Screen Set..........Always On, 1 min, 3 min
After each selection press OK to confirm, and press MENU to leave one menu item for another and then again to exit

The rest of the operating instructions provided make some sense, except Loop and Slideshow commands, which may be on another hidden menu. If I find them, I will update.

title: For the money, it's a decent device
text:
People who criticize this for not doing a stellar job just isn't using common sense. For goodness sake look at how much you're paying for it. There are far better DVRs out there but you have to multiply what you payed for with this by a factor of 20. Don't buy a Hyundai and complain that it doesn't work anything like a Bentley.

Anyways, I've only had the device for less than a day and all I can say is that it's "ok". The video is pretty poor for night driving, which is what I mainly use it for. I'm sure if I fiddled with the settings a little more it can improve. I was surprised to find that it comes with a battery. That would be helpful just in case the power source gets cut and you may have a corrupt video file that's unusable.

The screen is also helpful to correctly position the camera. I've seen others complain about the viewing angle but I find it acceptable. I can see about half way in each lane from the hood of my car. To me that's fine. Again considering how much this device cost.

It was also nice that it comes with an a/c charger. Although I would probably keep this in my car 99.5% of the time.

I've seen others complain about the poorly written manual. The menu system on this device is pretty self explanatory. Anyone with experience of portable electronics the past 20 years should get this in about 5 minutes. It's easy. The record button is what you would use to make a selection. Up/Down... well up down! Menu button allows you to alter device and recording settings. Mode allows you to switch between camera, video camera and picture/video viewer.

One thing about the device is that it's very cheaply made. But what do you expect for the same price you pay for a movie ticket and a small popcorn and soda? I've yet to test it in daylight. I will do so later and update this review.

What I really like about it is the device starts recording right away as soon as power is sent thru the cigarette lighter. It also has a blinking light so you know that its recording without having to keep the screen open. With the mount and the screen open, it covers a good part of your windshield so be prepared to be cited by a cop, depending where you live. I had to mount it to the right of my rear view mirror to not obstruct my view with the screen open. Also, since most new cars have a dot matrix shade above the windshield, I had to mount it lower since the suction device will not work on the dot matrix surface.

Really, as long as the device works, for what you pay for... it's really outstanding. You want better low light shooting, smaller form factor, better resolution, a better device overall? PAY UP!

----------update--------------
Like I expected, the night time shooting is pretty bad. All you can see are blurry lights of other cars. The focus isn't as good.

Day time performance was decent as well. You can see the street and cars clearly even though you may not be able to read their plates. All that matters is that it will capture the moment someone (knock on wood) crashes into you.

Another negative I found is that the USB performance of transferring files thru the camera is it's painfully slow. I have a feeling it's USB 1.0 That's right! So you're better off pulling out the memory card and using a media reader connected to a computer instead of going through the unit.

I have tested the first unit and will test the other one tomorrow. When everything works fine, I will place them in both cars.

Bottom line: For the money, they're not too bad.

title: Dash Cam
text:
I read in some of the reviews where the sound wasn't good. My sound was very good, clear and good quality. The pictures come out good although as some stated it is hard to see the license plates unless very close to the vehicle in front. It probably could be enhanced if needed. The price was very reasonable. I used it as a regular cam walking around the house and narrating as I went. It works well for that as well.
My car does not supply power to the cigarette lighter automatically with the key or turn the power off when the key is switched off, so I just plug it in when beginning a drive and try to remember to unplug the cam when ending the drive. It will continue to record if you forget to unplug it. I have a long video of people walking by while in the parking lot at Walmart.
Nevertheless, the cam is a good product and well worth the price. I recommend it.

title: I'm hard to please.
text:
Okay, now that I have become an expert in this camera's system I will leave my true thoughts. The Motion detector works great. Nice and sensitive. It will just keep going. One thing to note is that once the feature is turned on. Nothing seems to work until the device is restarted. I'm sure there is a timer. I left it outside for a short while. It gets a great pictures. Let's you adjust the line frequency. Tons of menu options. This device is fun to play with. You can use it just about anywhere. Super long cord on the DC vehicle adapter. You could have plenty of extension to run it under your dash or wherever. The package was put together nicely and everything looked brand new and properly sealed. Very impressed. I almost left a negative review because I did not realize that the IR Led function is turned on using one quick press of the power button. Viola! It's also flawless the night vision I love it. This thing goes above and beyond a car dash cam and I wish the peephole DVR we ordered had as many options and as good of picture quality and motion detection that this $15 dollar device has.

The only draw back I can see thus far is having no option in the menu to choose any option other than 10 minutes for the recording intervals. The motion detection recorded 10:02 before quitting and then picked up something else about 4 minutes before I picked it back up and brought it inside. If you park your car anywhere there isn't going to be motion all the time you could spot vandals with this thing. My peephole DVR takes the same batteries (from old samsung or simillar flip phones) so I have a few of the and O am going to order some more. Love this device, love the person who programmed the OS and the idea is awesome. Better than a cheap radar detector.

One more thing about this camera. It has a GIANT original SD card. I had to use an adapter for the 32GB Micro SD card I had on hand. Which shows about 38 minutes of video on the lowest resolution setting available 640x480 but surprising shows options all the way to 1280x960. Thanks to the designer! And seller!

title: It's fun, just don't expect anything spectacular

Not the best quality but would pick up people's faces if needed and would work as a accident cam. It doesn't see license plates in front of you. Not sure if the lens turned to adjust focus. Didn't try.

At night it was almost worthless. It did pick up lane markers so it would show what lane you were traveling in if that was important to your accident, but in general it is poor at night.

I'll be trying another cam that costs a little bit more but also comes has optional wide angle lenses you can buy. I was really just looking for a mobile digital recorder device I could put in the trunk, run camera wires to that. Good cameras are cheap, its the recorder that set them apart. The mobile surveillance type recorders are about $250 and I was thinking you could use a couple rear view backing up cameras wired to it.

title: Did some research the second time around. (Update Feb 14th 2014)
text:
I read almost all the reviews on Amazon. I had not done any other research at the time, but decided to take a chance and purchase. I recived the unit. It takes video that looks OK, but would not record audio at all. There is a marking in the plastic for an HDMI port but the hole is not cut out. The display screen has a mark on it that was there when i bought it and will not come off. The battery door is not a door and is not removable like in one Amazon reviewers video here. I need audio because if i was in an accident the camera may not be able to make out the plate and i would have to call it out to the camera if i was able.

So before i bought a new one to replace this one i did as much research as i could. I did not know this at first but it turns out that these cameras are really Standard Definition versions (even though the box claims otherwise) of what is called a DVR-027. They look the same from the outside, but have some noticeable differences.

You will see even in Amazon reviews here that the date stamp numbers are green or yellow to the left or right. a real HD DVR-027 has its date stamp top center and is stamped Black on a white background. The quality looks better. it has real HD there is only an HDMI port and no A/V out. This one on Amazon is not horrible for the price. Real DVR-027s go for about 60 dollars. If you are in a bit of a hurry and don't mind the not as good video quality this camera is OK, but if you are really concerned about making sure that the camera will have your back in case something does happen i would suggest doing as much research as you can use Google and YouTube and pick up a real in HD DVR-027

Valentine's Day 2014 Update

It has been over a year since my purchase of this device as well as my real DVR-027.
DashCamera technology has made great progress since then. At this point in time after over a year of research my honest advice would be to not buy this or any other camera cheaper then what is called a G1W witch can be found on Amazon here [[ASIN:B00FONBG1A G1W 1080P DashCam]]/[[ASIN:B00HMNFWYW G1W-H 1080P DashCam Wider View and all black casing]]

Like in the past with the DVR-027 you need to be careful of SD versions of the G1W. Make sure to get one with the Novatek 96650 chip and NOT the Novatek 96620 chip.

I keep reading people saying things like does an okay job for 20 dollars or don't mind the low quality of these cameras, but lets take a second and think about it. for only a little bit more money isn't it worth the peace of mind that higher quality video and a more reliable camera bring? A better day time video. A better night time video. A better chance to catch the plate of or features of a car who hit you and run off or bumped your car while it was parked.

I would want every driver to do the research. Visit places like DashCamTalk read what other drivers who use different models are saying and decide on a good quality camera that fits your needs.

Weather you drive a Corvette or a Camry your car, family, and yourself should always be protected, and a good camera will have your back day and night the next time someone tries to brake check you because they are in a bad mood. It happens all over USA, UK, AUS, and every other country. If you really need to be motivated to buy a decent camera spend an hour on YouTube and watch all the bad driving from places like Portland Oregon, Napa Valley California, and Lexington South Carolina

title: not sure yet....might be ok
text:
So....after much trying to figure this thing out....I couldn't get anything to work correctly until I "formatted" the memory card with the unit's format option (this wasn't in the instructions)...now i can finally test it out to see if it provides any utility. My purpose for the device is to just record driving in case something happens, I'm not concerned with license plate info at this stage just being able to re-create an incident should one occur. I will update rating as I continue to use it. I selected fair due to the difficulty I had in figuring it out and the quality of the materials (as a note to quality - I'm ok with the construction due to price but to be fair it does feel cheaply constructed).

Another important thing to note from the instructions, it takes a few uses (full battery depletion followed by 12 hour charge to get full battery capacity). I'm not there yet so don't know if this is true. Right now full charge shows as 3/4.

Update after 3 uses: So, I've finally been able to use the camera (after formatting). so far I've discovered when I power the device off it doesn't actually power off. I purchased this to be a camera for recording driving in case of an incident. Used to get to work (work fine). Stopped recording when I got to work, turned power off. When I got back to my car 8 hours later the battery was dead. Apparently it didn't turn off (3 days in a row). Today I verified I had turned it off...next i will actually take battery out to see if that does the trick (not how it should work).

For the price paid this device so far does work well....and I call attention to the comment for the price paid. The quality is decent in HD. Have not tried in anything lower yet. Not good enough to read license plates or road signs but good enough to capture activity. microphone captures sounds really well too. Field of view is decent. Probably in the 130 range.

title: very cheap quality
text:
I ordered 2 of these when I placed my order just in case there was a problem with one of them. It's a good thing I did because the first one I opened didn't work properly. It wouldn't even let me in to the menu to set it up and it would not power off until the battery was dead.
The other camera works okay. I have had it in my truck for a few weeks now and I have it set to come on when the truck is started and power off when I turn the key off. This feature works sometimes and sometimes not. There have been many times when I have started the truck and the camera comes on but it freezes and does not record. There have been times when I turn the key off and the camera stays on. Overall when the camera does work it works fine.
Just the other night I was pulling in my driveway around midnight and I noticed a person on a bike hiding behind the shrubs between my and the neighbors house. After calling the police to report this I checked the camera and there was good definitive footage of the person which helped me make sure to give a great description of him.

title: A+ for the price! Bought a Transcend 16 GB ...
text:
A+ for the price! Bought a Transcend 16 GB class 10, 30 MB/S for the memory card. I just plugged it in and it works perfectly! Ideally, use 2 of these for front and back recording!

Update: Just bought 2 more after 9 months of successful use of initial purchase. I don't use the suction cup. I like attaching velcro or sticky tape to the dash cam, and then laying it flat like a radar detector on the dashboard.

title: Consider it a disposable dash cam
text:
This little camera was painful to get working due to the poor instructions and menu, but it was eventually set up to record medium quality video whenever the car was turned on, rotating through the files as the 16GB card filled. It worked well enough most of the time, occasionally requiring a battery pull to reset everything. (For $20, I expected nothing more) Then the plastic frame on the suction cup mount melted on a hot day, which is not really a surprise. Then the screen stopped working. I probably messed up my settings by randomly pressing buttons and power cycling it, pulling the battery, plugging and removing everything that moved. Nothing seemed to help. When power is applied, the two red lighted buttons on the back light up, but nothing else appears to happen. No video is recorded. I can't find a reset button anywhere.

But as a proof of concept test of my using a dash-cam, it was a success! It actually recorded decent video of a crash that happened right in front of me. (No injuries, fortunately!) Too bad it only lasted three and a half months.

I will be buying more dash-cams, but most definitely NOT this one!

title: Best $20 I've spent!  Great deal!!  Stop thinking about it and Just buy it!
text:
[[VIDEOID:70275b59a0e77e9b7e2b7606495c2adb]] Well, I was in the market for a dash cam to record accident scenes plus just catching idiot drivers in action. Well I saw this one and thought, $20?? No possible way this can be anything remotely decent but was willing to bet $20 to find out. Let me just say this thing isn't going to give you HD video. Not even close. But it's clear enough! The slot labelled for HDMI cable isn't even close to big enough for HDMI. I'm not sure what they are trying to pull over on the consumer but it's not HDMI. But that's ok with me because I take the SD card out and watch them on my computer. The sound is much better than another one I tried on here that looks identical to this one too. If you want a decent very inexpensive dash cam, this is it! I still can't believe it's so cheap! Just make sure you order from this link and not the others that look identical because I ordered some of those to put in our fire truck and rescue truck to record emergency calls and the viewing angle on those are only half as wide and this one and the sound is horrible. Like a busted speaker. BUY IT! YOU WILL LOVE IT!

Edit: 6/29/13 I'm adding a video clip from my cam to show you the quality you will get. Like I said it isn't HD but it's good enough for me. Well worth $20!

title: Waste of time
text: I had high hopes for this camera.  It did arrive on time and was packaged well.  The looks and feel of it were good and I did like the size.  From there the experience changed.  The instructions were kinda lame but with all the online reviews and videos I was able to get it to function sometime.  First I charged the battery and formatted a 16gb memory card using the camera so as to have the correct format.  During this whole process it froze up a few times but being new to the functions, I thought it may just be me doing something wrong.  I was able to take a few short (5- 30 sec.) clips in the house using the battery but that was about it.  Decided to install it in the car to give it a fair chance.  Ran the power cable around the windshield and mounted it just behind the mirror.  Started the car and it came on and started recording then stopped and froze up.  Removed the battery, reset the settings and repeated the process but started driving.  Everything seemed to be working this time but then 2 blocks down the street, froze again.  When I say froze, that is what I mean.  The picture still displays but the recording stops and it will not respond to any buttons.  The only thing you can do is remove the battery to get it to clear and then all your presets are erased and must be reinstalled if you want date, time, video mode, duration, etc. etc..  I removed it and returned it as soon as I got back home.  I did view the video and it was ok but very short.  Total waste of my time and after reading similar experiences with this model I figured why waste any more time on it.

title: the quality is not good. First
text:
Well, for about $17 you can't expect a lot, and they are delivering quite a bit for such a low price. However, the quality is not good.

First, the unit appeared to be used. The plastic packaging did not have that "crisp" look, and there were fingerprint smudges on some items. Even the battery looked a bit used.
The first problem I found was a big black "blob" on the image. It must be inside the lens or a damaged sensor. There also seems to be some focus problem, because the edges are out of focus while the center is fairly in focus.
Then, when I reviewed the recordings, the sound would drop out sometimes. And the mount rattled a bit.

Glad I tested it out with just a temporary wired connection first (the wire just hanging down). If I'm going to go through all the work of installing the wiring along the edge of the window, I'm going to spend the money (about $75) for the next level up.

Its hardly worth returning, but with that ugly blob on the screen I may as well ship it back.

If you want to be cheap and get something very basic, this may work. But reading other people's reviews, you may need to return it once or twice to get one that works.

title: Works as advertised
text: Read the mixed reviews, but for the price I took the leap.  Out of the box, there was a thin line across the LCD screen, but I figured I was not going to be looking at the screen except for aiming the camera.  I got some sticky velcro at CVS and stuck it to my dashboard (the large suction clamp was hard to put into a spot that didn't obscure a lot of the windscreen view).  Now it is low profile right above my lighter outlet, aimed at the front of the car.  It is upside down, but the upside down images are clear enough, and if needed, I can flip the videos right side up.  With the lighter power cord, the camera starts up when the car starts, records everything just fine, and shuts off when I turn the car off.  You can also turn it on to run from the battery, and set it to activate if it detects motion.  I'm running an 8GB class 4 SD card that I got for $6 in it with no problems.  I'm planning on getting another one for our second car.

To be short - it does pack a lot for this price, but if you expect HD videos, meaning ones that can let you make a plate number for example, then this is definitely not the product for you. I did expect it though, since the product description details that it produces HD videos. It is clearly not a high quality product, hence the price, so I was not expecting superb plastic quality or a good LCD. I did expect it to deliver on the video resolution side, though.

One note: I bought my camera last week, but received one which has a firmware that dates to October 2012. While I understand that newer firmware versions have been released since, I doubt if they tackle this basic performance matter, which probably has to do with the sensor and lens. Anyway, they are not available for me to try..

title: Excellent for the price.  Had a "Card Error" problem when I would hit a bump, but solved it.
text: I would get a "Card Error" when I would hit a bump.  That would cause the recording to stop, and not restart.  Removing the battery cleared the "Error", and wedging a piece of the SD Card envelope under the card, cured it, no more jiggle, no more "Error".  Get the recommended Class 10 SD card, that way you don't loose any video frames while the  "File Save" is automatically executing.

This morning, when i started my car, smoke began coming out of the unit and I detected a burning smell. When i unplugged the unit, it was extremely hot and smelled terrible. I just threw it out. Wasn't worth the time and effort to return/replace it, as it was over 6 months old.
I enjoyed it while it lasted.

text: Works great. I put a 32GB SDHC card in it and it holds hours of driving. The biggest pain is taking it down every time I park so that it doesn't get stolen. Gotta remember to wipe the telltale suction cup mark off the windshield each time too. The instructions that come with it were obviously written by someone with limited english proficiency. You are going to have to play with it a bit to figure out the menu. I did that indoors after charging the internal battery. Once I got the knack of it, then I put it in the car.

title: Needs a more sturdy mount
text: Nice idea and price point.  The mount broke sitting in the summer sun. It cracked and doesn’t hold the camera up.

title: descent unit.
text: Works fine. Night vision is not very good. It is not a high priced unit. For the price I can not complain.

title: Well worth the price!
text: This cam is fun and simple! You can't go wrong for  the price. Bought 2 and use them everyday.

title: Not Worth purchasing
text: Not worth purchasing at all.  No matter how many memory cards I put inside the DVR was not finding it and as it turns on a smell of burning comes out. I had no choice but to return this defective item and maybe look for something that is worth buying.

title: A must for your car.
text: This is an update on this newer model. You get a wider view with this newer model. On VGA mode I only got less then 2 hours on a 32gb Class 10 memory card. That is 1 hour less then the older model. The audio is unuseable to hear. It is all distorted.. The Operating Manual does not say anything about the Audio Interface jack on the side of camera. I could not get the camera to recharge the battery, I had to used another charger. I did get a good picture , a little bit of jumping. You can use the playback mode on the camera but you get a much better picture if you playback on the computer. Overall the camera not that bad, only if the audio work and if it would recharge the battery I would give it more stars.

title: The best camera that almost zero money can buy
text: There appears to be no 15min recording option, the longest is 10min (and the time they record isn't as long as they say: the 2 min recording option saves for ~90 seconds).  The menus can be tricky, especially in Chinese (I own two, one came set up in English, the other in Chinese).  And there are several menu settings/options that are not explained in the paper instruction manual.  Finally, the camera seems to move up and down when the car is stopped, then is more steady when the car is in motion.  But it is seriously cheap and it works.

title: Bad bad camera

There is a warm battery smell coming from it. The only good thing about it is that the windshield mount works great. Spent over $20 on a piece of junk.

title: FIRST ONE WAS JUNK - Trying a second one to see if it was the dash cam or the quality control?
text: Cautious 3 star - last one I bought from Amazon was a zero star but gave it 2 to make my point it was junk. I spent 26 bucks with the SD card. It lasted 13 days and went blank on me. Now, maybe it was just a bad one so I bought another one. Will rate this one in 2 weeks. I will be honest. The last one was a disaster and lost faith in Amazon quality control. Battery was DOA on arrival. the menu button were sticking; the settings wouldn't save and I had the use of it for less than 2 weeks. Not a lot of money but still, one would think this item would last at least 3 to 6 months.. It did not last 2 weeks. Be careful if you buy this item. JUNK... trying a second one because I NEED a dash cam and maybe I will be lucky and this one works as designed. Fingers crossed and I WILL rate this one too.

It took me a couple days of trial and error to get it to do exactly what I wanted.(I wanted the ability to have video proof in case of an accident)  Now its simple plug in power push 1 button and the recording begins.  Really its a 16 dollar video camera what would or could anyone expect for less than that. Go with a 16 or 32 gig sd card, I have a 16 which is good for about 2 hours of recording, perfect for my daily commute. Another point, if this item gets stolen, unlike the major hit losing a high end recorder all you lose is 30 bucks and a window..

I guess the ole saying "You get what you pay for" is true. I would not recommend this camera.

title: mine spoke Chinese, hard to program, green and pink static makes recording useless.  However, the second one works great.
text:
Two years later and is still working!

1. Came with settings in Chinese. FINALLY was able to change it to English thanks to other reviewers who provided instructions. Mine must be different from theirs although I was able to change into English by hit and miss. Otherwise performs as described. Screen is tiny but you really don't need to watch it while driving so no problem. Suction adheres well. Great price.

2. Took the SIM card out and put it in my computer. Picture is good except for one little thing. THERE ARE GREEN AND PINK STATIC LINES FLUTTERING ALL OVER THE SCREEN which makes it hard to see what is happening on screen. Perhaps one of the other reviewers or the manufactorer knows what to do. I don't.
UPDATE. Returned the unit. Got a free new one the next day. Love Amazon's return policy and it's soooooeasy. New one works great

3. Had this thing for about three days. First day (after I FINALLY got it set up) it seem to work fine. However when I view the pictures on my computer it had those green and pink lines all over the screen. Then it would or wouldn't record depending upon it's mood I suppose. Also, my buttons don't match the descriptions in the Instruction Manual. On the screen it says to OK Enter. I can't find an OK button.
The Instruction Manual says I have a HDMI Slot. No I don't. Also my unit does not have a Blue Indicator light to indicate whether it is working or not. Red light never goes off. The more I try to use this unit the less I like it.

I bought two. I'm going to go and set it up and see if it has the same problems.

4. Took the 2nd one out. Quickly programed it to speak english. Works like a charm. No green and pink sluttering lines. Very pleased with it so far. Still actual unit seems to be somewhat different from the one described in the Instructions booklet but oh well.

title: Not a real dash camera.
text: I have only purchased a couple of items I needed to return to Amazon and this is was one of them. Purchased this item because there were several reviews that were good however the one I received the battery would not charge after leaving it plugged into a USB charger overnight. Displays a “Low Battery” then shuts down. It did work while plugged into the USB charger and I inserted a SDHC Flash Memory Card and it did function. The next day I plugged in the supplied automobile 12VDC adapter and cable and it blew a fuse in my vehicles electrical system. All I could do was laugh as I boxed it up to send back to Amazon and they did refund the purchase price. Real dash cameras cost more than this toy one.

title: Five Stars
text: excellent price and product

title: Great to have in case you get into an accident. Doesn't have amazing quality, but for $12, you can't expect impeccable 4k.
text:
For the price, this camera is halfway decent. For some reason, it seems like the video quality was really good when I initially got it, but has significantly degraded afterwards. I made sure the resolution was the same as before, and that the camera lens was clean. Even on the highest resolution setting, it's difficult to read the license plate number of the car in front of you unless it's pretty bright outside. But, this camera probably isn't used for CSI investigations into license plate numbers, and they can probably "enhance" the stills slightly if they really needed to.

I got this camera as a safety measure in case I ever got into an accident or something bad happened - it would provide solid evidence as an alibi of what happened that could be presented to a police officer, in the event that you get into a crash and the other person says it's your fault, and it's only your word against theirs.

I say - don't risk the chances. It's only 12 bucks. It plugs into the cigarette lighter. It's not rocket science (though the menu system is a bit weird but after playing around with it for a bit it makes sense), and it's a good backup tool.

title: Meh
text: This camera comes with russian menus as default.  I had to muddle through until I could change them to English.  The videos it produces are ok for the price, even at night.  Drawback is that the screen went completely white after about a week.  the camera still records well enough you just don't know exactly where it is pointed until you download the videos from it.  I would suggest you go with a different model.

The instructions are not the best, but I was able to figure out how to save and delete videos.  Granted, your memory card will cost more than the camera, but for the money it is a great buy.

text: Good value for the money. Witnessed several accidents with it running and was able to assist local law enforcement with their case against aggressive drivers. Also captured a few close calls with wildlife and one unfortunate collision.

title: Clear picture, crisp sound, works great ... if you're Russian.
text:
Arrived well-packed, new condition, all parts present. And quick - the 3rd day!
Battery mostly charged out-of-box - ~2 hours to full charge.
Nice, bright display - not wide angle but what you see on 'YouTube' crash compilations only with better color.
Popped in a 16GB card and В гостях мы идем! (Away we go!)
Say whut? That's right: Меню на русском языке (the menu is in Russian!).
Well, what about the manual? Это на плохом английском языке - не скажет вам, как изменить дисплей на английский. (It's in bad English - doesn't tell you how to change display to English.)
So I got a nice picture but no way to change resolution, length of scene, etc.
Actually, all I have is a nice picture.
Unless I figure something out in the next day or two, назад она идет (back it goes).
Too bad, в противном случае мне очень нравится (otherwise I really like it).
If I find English I'll update this, probably to 4 stars.
UPDATE
I had rated this at ONE star because of the language issue. The seller responded to my comments - told me to set the menu to English and all would be well.
Only problem: Seller did not tell me HOW to find the English option (it's probably listed somewhere, but in Cyrillic letters).
So I use it as a dashcam. It seems to be working just fine and if I ever need the video, it will probably be worthwhile to pay a Russian to dig it out for me.
But the picture is clear, the mount is sturdy, the unit is attractive and it seems to be doing what I wanted it to do.
So-o-o I give it four stars. Five if you read Russian. Six if you can change mine.

title: Not the worst, but not even close to good
text:
This cam seems to be the going cheap model on the market right now as you will see listed for numerous prices and they are maybe worth the lowest you find depending on the condition of what you get. The camera does work and is, as others have said, good for evidence should you involved in a collision, and likewise the recording isn't bad should you need in case of a law enforcement interaction, but that's where it stops.

Pros:
-GREAT price compared to other similar items on the market.
-Automatic on and off once you get set up you can forget it
-Constant recording and overwriting of old videos once SD card is full.
-Window suction cup is amazing. Other makers of window mounting suction cups could learn a thing or two from these guys. I've never had one that sticks as well as this. When adjusting I almost couldn't get it back off with the pressure clip open!!! Amazing. I could believe being in a collision and this thing not letting go.
-Interface and directions aren't great but pretty straight forward

Cons:
-Constructions is VERY cheap.
-When mine arrived the camera lens was pushed into the device at an angle, but fortunately I was easily able to pop it back out so it was usable.
-Overall design is lacking decent functionality in that the doors for the SD card are not easy to open at all. The IR leds are a bit of a joke as they don't aid whatsoever with night vision, so hopefully if you have an incident at night, you are in a well lit area.
-640x480 is the only actual resolution, the others are not accurate and software based. Really Amazon should hold their vendors to accuracy in their descriptions as this is misleading.

title: Five Stars
text: Really nice

title: Get the quality you pay for
text:
I like this camera for general use on the roads as well as; additional home security. You will NOT get clear tag numbers and forget about night vision. For the money it does as I had expected it to. I installed a 16GB memory card and played with the settings a little bit. It works well on the laptop as far as vision but again the tag numbers aren't as clear. For home security I back my vehicle in my driveway where I've installed motion activated lights myself. It sees any vehicles clearly and even human faces (my own and blind tests with friends visiting). I'm not so concerned with this being my primary home security camera as I already have 8 Hi res and night vision cameras at home but was just curious. I notified my insurance company of installation but they did would not reduce my insurance rates due to our state's voyeurism laws (SC residents must have party notifications/permissions to use audio or video devices during recordings). The mount is somewhat secure and doesn't rattle too much but the "screw in mount" for the camera does have a little bit of free play but not enough to jar the videos during driving. The only time video rattle became an annoyance was during an off roading excursion I'd taken but nearly any camera that does not have a suspension style mount will have the same problem.

Pro: It captures real time movements of vehicles in front of you and what is going on within it's field of view. CHEAP!

Cons: Night vision is useless, cannot get clear tag identifications.

title: Shipped with Chinese Menu's
text:
This is the second one I have bought. This one shipped with the menu's set in Chinese. Using my knowledge of how my other one works along with the instruction manual, I figured out how to set it to English, but I don't know if you could figure it out if this was you first one. To change the language, press and hold the power button for 3 seconds until the screen comes on. Press the Menu button, press the Menu button, press the Record button (on main unit, blue dot, next to power button), press the Up/Down buttons to move the cursor to English, and press the record button. Now the unit should be in English and you can adjust the other menus.

My truck does not have a cigarette lighter that turns off when the ignition goes off. This is how we have the one set up in the other car, it records the whole time the ignition is on. On my truck, I have it set to record only on motion. My experience with the other one is that there is not enough "motion" at night to enable recording. I will report back when I have had a chance to use it at night.

My first impression during the day is that while driving down a country road with only bean fields on either side, there was not enough motion to keep it recording, despite traveling at 60 mph. On the one hand, that might be good, because there really was nothing to record. However, not sure how fast it would turn on if something were to pop out. I will report back when I get a chance to use this in the city and at night.

I would have given this 5 stars if it shipped in English.

title: Great basic auto DVR!
text:
I have been looking at these devices for a few years. I was about to buy this from one of the online ordering operation in the Asia market. Then I found this item for about the same price on Amazon.

I've tested it and it works as advertised! All the usual options for operation. Even tried the motion detection mode and worked just fine.

I could downrate it for the awkward adjustments on the mount, but for the price I can't do that. It works!

It came with the language set to Korean or Japanese or Chinese (I can't tell the difference), but after using the manual I change the language to English. A minor problem and doesn't reflect badly on the product since I was able to change it.

title: Great starter dash cam!
text: I was hesitant on buying such a cheap camera... but boy does it get the job done. I drive a lot and I wanted something to protect me in case someone hit me. All you need is an outlet and an SD card and your good to go. I never hardwired it yet so every time I get it my car I just plug it in and it'll start recording. Once I stop driving I unplug it and it'll automatically turn off within one minute(you can change the settings to leave it on longer). The night vision is not the best but what do you expect for this price range, you can still see what's going on. It's very comforting to ride around in a car with a dash cam and for 25 bucks thats well worth the comfort to me.
Disclaimer: Fords usually have radios that dont get the kinda quality reception that GM's radios get. That being the case, this thing causes radio interference in some Ford vehicles (esp. older ones). I researched it and its b/c its a knock off of a higher quality camera that has none of the problems the cheaper ones do. Also, it only records in one minute segments in motion detection mode. Problem being is it takes a second or two to switch files between minutes. So you miss 1/60 or 1/30 of total time switching. This is not acceptable to me so I use it on constant record and set the file size to 10 minutes. Just the price u pay for 25 dollar price tag.

title: Hard to be upset for such a great price.
text:
I mean, for this price, how could I get upset? Everything but the memory is included in the package. The camera works just as expected, picture quality is adjustable but sacrifices storage space as expected. I've viewed video from night and day drives and it shows up phenomenally! I even captured my entire encounter with a stranded drunk driver who needed a jump which turned into me giving him a lift to a local bar. Audio quality is perfect for picking up any and every sound you need to hear, and the image is great! I can't complain getting all this in this very inexpensive package.

I've had it for a year or two now and here are some of the cons I've noticed. When you first set everything up the whole menu and everything is in Chinese or something so you have to click and guess how to change it to English, I got lucky! Also over time the battery (much like a phone battery) doesn't hold charge very well anymore mostly because it's best to always keep it plugged in anyway which seems to be constantly charging the battery... bad setup. It does turn on/off automatically but if you don't have outlets in your car that activate with startup/shut down of the car then you have to manually hold down the button and listen for a beep to say it's off. Lately it's been taking a long time to confirm it is on. Also it has dropped off the windshield once and every since then the screen doesn't stay in the fully up position, it's always slightly open, really annoying at night because you can see the light of the screen in the opening and with my top down, it's really noticeable at a distance. Another big downfall for me is that in order to mount it to the top of a windshield hanging down maximizing inconspicuousness and being out of the way of anything else including visibility (which is impossible considering how much space it takes up with all the linkages) you can only screw it down by about one thread which poses a threat of falling down all the time. If you bought it and tried mounting it this way you'll see exactly what I'm saying but the camera itself mounts onto a coarse thread and there's a locking nut above that to keep it tight. Great for other positions but certainly without that locking nut I would not be able to mount this in my car unless I block some of my vision. Not an option considering my car has such limited windshield as it is. Also if you leave it on for too long, like several days, it will get jammed up and stops recording causing you to have to disconnect all power from the unit to get it to function properly again.

Like I said, for the price, this is all very easy to look past, I've had it for about 2 years I think and it still does the job very well. I've caught some funny stuff on this thing and idiot drivers more than anything. Thankfully no accidents, but I know it's there just in case. Gonna upgrade to a $100 unit now that I've got the feel for owning such a thing and love it! If you're wondering if you should spend your money on it, YES! You will not consider this a waste of money I promise you that (granted you get one that's not a dud) unless you had a higher end model and are considering this. This is for beginners, first-timers, just trying it out. You'll love it if you're just checking out the idea of having a dash-cam. Great quality video and audio (on a computer, playback on the device sucks but does work)

title: Why the "segments"?
text:
I purchased several of these from amazon recently and so far have tested three in vehicles during daylight hours using 16GB SanDisk memory cards. All three have worked fine so far. I can only echo what so many others have written about deciphering the "Engrish" instructions.

One thing that I don't get, and which I'd love to have clarified by another purchaser, is what's the purpose of recording in short bursts or segments of a few minutes each? I have set my cameras to record continuously until I end the recording, i.e. from the moment I begin driving until I arrive at my destination. Why in the world would anyone want to record 5/10/20 minute segments of the trip? I don't get it, but there may be a good reason for doing so that makes sense which I'm not seeing.
