title: Completely useless
text:
The listing for this product puts 5 completely different products in one. I can only assume they do this so the reviews for the better quality items boost the average rating of the poorer quality items. In either case:

This review is for the "2.5-inch" camer

First the physical review:
- The mount the camera comes actually is pretty decent. It has a good quality suction cup, and it allows a pretty decent range of articulation. It would be nice if it were a bit smaller (to take up less windshield real estate), and the clamps do tend to loosen over time (allowing the camera to move), but in general I'm pretty happy with the mount.
- The screen is all but useless. In daylight it's much too dim to see, and at night the video is too dark to see anything. On top of that, mine had some type of quality-control stamp right on the screen itself.
- The charger has a decent length cord, but it requires you to open a "door" on the camera to plug it in - making it look very "untidy" on your windshield. This door could probably be ripped off, but a usb cord with a 90* plug would be needed to avoid having the cable sticking a few inches out from the unit.

As for the video quality:
- It does have a 720p mode... and while it may be 720p video, it's of such poor quality that you could never read a license plate number or anything from the video.
- The video seems to particularly struggle with capturing movement (it blurs movement)... which is particularly annoying in a camera that is mounted to a moving vehicle

As for the functionality:
- Here is where the camera is all but useless. It "crashes" frequently (about 1 in every 3 trips), which then requires a hard-reset (remove battery & unplug usb), and also corrupts the memory card. This also resets all the settings to the defaults - so if you plan on using this as a "set it and forget it".... forget it. It takes about 3 minutes to reset all the settings each time, so if you really want to use it, you'll need to spend about 3 minutes prior to any trip setting up the camera.
- The default video length is 20 seconds, but it takes about 10 seconds for it to write the file... so you only catch about 2/3rds of the action anyways. You can configure this to up to 15 minutes/video (highly recommended), but it doesn't save this setting through "crashes", so you have to reset it every trip.
- The default quality is 240i/PAL. You'll want to change it to 720p/NTSC, but again you need to set this after every "crash"
- The time/date is useless since it resets every trip to 1/1/2011
- The charger back-draws power from the unit's onboard battery, so if you unplug the charger but leave it plugged into the camera, it will drain the camera's battery. You need to unplug the charger from both the cigarette lighter and the usb port on the camera every trip.

In a week of using the camera before returning it, I used it for about 400 minutes of driving over a total of 20 trips. All told I ended up with about 20 minutes of decent usable video, or about 5% of what I should've gotten. If you're hoping to catch something interesting on camera, you better hope it happens in that 5% of the time it's working.

title: 2.5 HD Dash Video Cam - 270 whirl
text: I purchased this cam at Amazon and standard shipping was free. (That's always a plus)! I received this item & it was packaged excellent & was able to plug it into my car and use it right away. You will need to either run it in your vehicle or plug it into the computer with the cable that comes with it to charge the battery. Some have suggested that the menu is not an easy one but I didn't have any problems with it at all. Mine also came set to English. I am very impressed with the daytime picture. Exactly what I would expect and it is easy to set up and attach to the windshield of my car. I'm not real crazy about the way you have to unscrew it when you stop somewhere and need to take it off to take it with you. Just a bit ackward but a more expensive cam may have a release button. I'm not really complaining, I can live with it. The night video, after it gets really dark is nothing to brag about. If you are in a city setting, or in a well lit area it makes a little difference but on a country road you can barely see beyond the hood of your car. However, let me put it this way, I don't do a lot of nighttime driving and even so if something happened you would probably be seeing enough to record what happened. If you do a lot of night driving you might want to look around & ck to see if more money means better night recording. The first day I used it I recorded 2 different cars pull into traffic and barely miss other cars right in front of me. It has a picture mode also, not great pictures but would suffice if needed to take pictures of something. It doesn't come with a SD/MMC card, & it does state that, but you can pick them up pretty reasonable if you don't have any. I use 2 so that I can have a spare if I want to save something on the first one until I get to my computer to take it off. If you film something you want to save you can take it from the card to your computer. It is not a heavy piece of equip. & it's easy to carry with you when you leave the vehicle. You don't get much as far as an instruction booklet but I found it was enough. While driving it is not a distraction. I would certainly recommend this little cam to anyone who drives. I'm glad I chose this one & would buy it again.

title: Can't beat the price!
text:
The GOOD...
The price... can't beat it for under $20. Sure, it likely isn't HD and it isn't as wide a view as a higher priced model. Just remember you get what you pay for. I wanted something to throw in my company vehicle to record in a 10min loop in case something happened. It does that just fine. I love the way it starts recording automatically when it is plugged in and shuts down when unplugged. I'm very happy with this item!
The BAD....
My unit arrived with a battery that would not hold a charge. So, every time it powered down it lost the date/time. This was very annoying. I'm an electronics's guy so I had a similar battery laying around that was good and I soldered it in permanently instead of tying to buy one that fit perfect. Now it works super.
I haven't even bothered to use the night vision LED's. I would assume they would be good for only a short distance and likely glare off the windshield. At night it does pick up the headlights so it does work to some extent at night... again, good enough for me.
I used mine set to 10 min files. So, every 10 min it creates a new file. Eventually the memory fills up and it starts overwriting the oldest file. This is not an issue, just know that if you have something happen and you stop recording to save it, be sure to get into the files and PROTECT the file you want to keep so it does not get overwritten.
Another annoying aspect is the mount... to use in multiple cars I made a second mount but it still has to be unscrewed when moving vehicle to vehicle. It could be moved with the mount but then it would need adjusting each time. The only thing I would look for in an upgraded or different model is to get one with a snap in mount/cradle. Again, for the price... not a problem. I might just buy another!

text: a contradiction?  Not really. The record indicator light was supposed to flicker when in use and recording, this record indicator stayed on solid all the time, and was red, not blue as the manual stated.  So, you see, it did work, but did not work.  I was on a trip and by the time I figured out it was not me (I left the small manual, a sheet of paper, at home) but the device my return window to Amazon had expired.  Hey, so, $20, a lunch for two at McDonalds, right?  If this thing had worked as it was meant to it would have been a great buy, no, it would have been a super buy.  I hope others have had better luck.  It is still usable, I just have to know that it will be on all the time when plugged in and will die if unplugged.  The sound recording is very reasonable so you have to be careful how you are talking when this thing is on, it is like a mini spy in the cabin -- there is a place on the menu to turn the sound off, however.

title: Worth Every Penny
text:
Worth every penny. I purchased this over three years ago. On a recommendation by a co-worker who lost an insurance claim, I decided to buy a cheap dash cam just in case. I installed this unit into the fuse panel to come on whenever the car is started and it shuts off when the key is removed. Over the years I have collected clips of some of the worst drivers around. Now I don't just have to say "you won't believe what this driver did today", I can actually show people.

Well this past week the dash cam earned it's keep. I was side swiped by a commercial van changing lanes. Neither one of us received a ticket. I then received a letter from the other driver's insurance company that they may be making a claim against me. I called the adjuster, mentioned I had a dash cam showing the incident, and the other driver at fault. After their review of the video, they today made an offer to pay for my vehicle. If I didn't have this camera, I would have a totaled car on my hands. I am glad I spent the small sum of money to buy this camera. It has paid for itself.

title: I like it!
text: For $15 bucks, I wasn't expecting much, but the video quality is reasonably clear and the audio is very clear. My cigarette lighter isn't switched with the key, so I have to turn it on and off manually, but that isn't a big deal, and certainly isn't the product's fault. The unit was pretty easy to set up even with the fairly poor instruction sheet. The video is certainly clear enough to read license plates and to distinguish the color of traffic lights, for example. For the price point, how could you possibly go wrong? My first experience with in-car video was an $1800 system in a police car back in 1998. Surprisingly, the video quality of this little unit is about the same as that system. Obviously, this isn't meant for professional use, but it just goes to show the amazing advances in technology. My only reason for having this product is to avoid the "he said, she said" if I am involved in a traffic crash. It will certainly be great for that, and would certainly pay for itself a thousand times over if it prevented a false claim of liability.

title: It is actually 1080p - I must have received the latest model
text:
I just got mine on 9/28/15. The menu is in Mandarin. But, do not dismay. Tap menu button twice and select the second item and press REC button.
Select your favorite language and press REC again. The REC is the one next to the on/off button. Are you with me so far? Now, the device does
not come with a SD card. You have to drive to the nearest Best Buy and get one. I recommend 16G. But 4G will also do. Here is the best part:
The instruction booklet is written in 2nd grade English, so between the booklet, the info on Amazon written by your fellow purchasers and the menu
on the device, it is a three dimensional puzzle that you have to solve to get it working. But, once you do, it is just beautiful. Good luck.

text:
I bought three of this model for work cars after reading many reviews on different dash cameras. I found the day footage and night footage of lit areas to be good. Night footage from darker areas or no headlights is grainy, but you can still see and make out images when reviewing.

The bad part of the product is that all three BL-5C batteries hold no charge and fail within a few minutes. I tried what the manufacturer suggested (full charge and drain at least three times) but no improvement. I wrote Amazon and received a credit which I used to by new OEM Nokia batteries http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B002EJ94BQ/ref=oh_details_o02_s00_i00?ie=UTF8&psc=1

Another problem has been that the one camera keeps falling off of the suction cup assembly on the windshield. I tried Crazy Glue, but it continued to fall off. Amazon customer service again helped me out by giving me free shipping when I ordered three better mounts that the camera secures too and are higher quality workmanship. http://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B007E4PUT6/ref=oh_details_o00_s00_i00?ie=UTF8&psc=1

Also--the battery was out of its plastic envelope. When I opened the shipping box. The Lithium-ion battery was just flopping around inside the box. title: The infrared LED's are cool, but realistically at night
text: I used this device for a couple of months, but had issues with it always resetting the time/date. I finally just stopped trying to separate the vid's into days of the week, etc. when downloading to computer. The infrared LED's are cool, but realistically at night, they reflect off the inside of the windshield causing issues with the video. Otherwise, its great to use around the house in total darkness. The main issue that I had w/ this unit, however, is the battery/battery compartment. Granted I need shocks in my SUV, but the battery would jostle loose - which likely is the cause for the date/time reset. There were times i thought it was recording when it wasn't and others when I though it wasn't and it was. For the cost, it was a fun toy to try but would go w/ a unit that doesn't require a lot of upkeep and has  a few more features...

title: When working they are fine. The two I received did not work as ...

I bought these units to replace one that died after a ~ year. When working they are fine. The two I received did not work as described on the data sheet and nor did the data sheet match the unit. They would not power up when the USB external power cord was attached. They would nor shut down without removing the battery. The power switch did nothing.
Having used the units before I know how to program them and how they should work. These two were a different experience.
The 12 volt to 5 volt power cords can beflaky in that a capacitor failed and it was easier to make the needed inverter than get a replacement.

text:

However, I loved the thing for the price and it worked better than some of our State Troopers dash cams! The GOOD VERSION has a wide field of view extending out to YOUR peripheral FROM THE WINDSHIELD!! Meaning everything you see looking straight ahead, IT SEES - WIDEEeee angle!
According to my records, I bought this one on 3/26/13 and eventually found out it was a Chinese knock off of XYUN (Chinese mfg) and was NOT the same. Lo res, poor recording quality and crappy field of view. As a matter of fact a traffic accident happened in the next lane right at my front fender and it never saw a thing!
THEN I bought the RIGHT ONE [XYUN] on 12/9/13 and been lovin' it [again] ever since.

It sounds like electrical interference from the car engine but it happens even when the car is off and the recorder is running on its own battery - not hooked to the aux plug-in. It sounds like there is a motor in the recorder running the tape. But this thing is digital - no motor, no tape.

Take the battery out, charge the battery, trying to power it on with/without the charger plugged in, etc... Nope. It's literally dead. title: Cheap, good quality during the day, useless at night
text:
[[VIDEOID:ce8bb8f45e93749e926a3057045412df]] I see this as a personal investment that pays dividends every time I turn it on.

The $12 price was very welcoming. I was surprised to look at my first recording and it was actually really clear. The value here is very remarkable. I installed a 32gb sd card. I also purchased a braided USB cable instead of using the cigarette lighter charger that it came with.

My only complain is the fact that the instruction that came with it was lacking in great detail.

Overall, I am satisfied. I got my money's worth.

title: You couldn't pay me to take one for free...
text:
The camera comes packaged well. That's the good news. There are two ways to record video. One is to use external power through the 12V-5V cigarette-lighter to mini-USB cable. The camera should power on with the car, start recording, and stop when the car shuts off. What really happens is the camera powers on, but does not start recording. Pressing the REC button gets a beep, but no recording.

Manual mode means while on car or battery (which came fully charged) power press the REC button. Beep but no recording.

Switching modes to Picture mode allowed me to take some pictures by pressing the same REC button. No matter what, video would not record. Naturally there was no video playback (as no video was recorded) but picture playback worked.

The menus are in a foreign language. I don't know which one. While I navigated all the submenus I was unable to return it to English. (Typically in a language menu, each language is displayed in ITS OWN language. That way if you can read nothing else, you'll read "English" if you're an English speaker). This language menu had all the options in the foreign language. I selected each of them in turn and some options turned into English but the menu itself remained unreadable.)

I tried it at night since I just got it this evening, and I can assure you that it is of no use in the night. The picture was totally dark except the occasional oncoming headlight or reflective tacks on the road markers.

I know, if you've read this far, you're wondering WHY DID I NOT JUST READ THE MANUAL??? Well, you see, the primary side of the multifolded sheet of paper had Chinese instructions. The other side had instructions in Chinese Engrish. I did attempt to translate Engrish into English, but it was truly confusing, missing lots of information, and of no value.

To summarize:
THE GOOD: The packaging is great at keeping the package safe, and easy to open. The battery came fully charged.

THE BAD: Everything else

I'd give it zero stars if I could.

E

title: DEAD on Arrival
text: Item powers up briefly but video screen remains black, then goes dead. Function buttons don't work either. Other reviews here also mention receiving non-working units. Poor quality. Cannot recommend this item. Any time you have people complaining about receiving non-working units, it's time to pull the item from inventory. I called Amazon Customer Service for return authorization. Sat in queue waiting for a representative and was promptly hung up on. I called back and this time got to speak with a nice young lady who was extremely difficult to understand - thick foreign accent. This made an already poor customer experience even worse. We struggled thru the call, she issued a return label and life goes on. At least the return policy is decent. You get what you pay for and this item isn't worth all the hassle.

title: Cheap peace of mind.

title: Good for the price
text:
I saw an ad on TV for an identical-looking dash cam for more than twice the price. I’m rating this 5 stars because it is a good deal. I have been testing for 2 days and I am very impressed. The image stabilization is excellent. It will record in 1, 3, 5 or 10 minute increments. I set it for 10 and when that it up, it automatically starts another .avi file segment. The picture quality is good, not really hi-def. There are 3 size settings - VGA works fine and does not use as much space as the higher settings. The other two higher settings are wide screen. There is also a camera mode that will snap pictures. And a voice-record mode which I don’t use. You view the files in playback mode on the flip-down 2.5” LCD. You can delete one or all. The secure suction cup window mount is easy to apply and remove. I opted to turn off audio recording as my old car is noisy and I just get a droning sound. I have not yet tried night driving where the IR LED lights kick in.

Power options: a re-chargeable Li-ion battery that can be charged by the cigarette lighter type car charger or by computer with the USB cable. All included. You don’t need to buy anything extra for your power requirements. The On/Off power switch has a red light that goes off when charging in complete.

The Instruction Manual has a lot to be desired – a poor English translation. Some points: there is no HDMI slot. The recording time is really 1/3/5/10, not 2/5/15. And it does not mention that the “REC/SNAP” button works as “OK” in the menus.

I got the Transcend 32G 300x High Speed SD card and have not yet filled it up. Whatever card you get, be sure it is class 10 or better. Apparently when there is no more room, it deletes the oldest and continues – cycle recording.

Try playing the .avi files on your computer media player at 2x speed or higher – it’s fun!

Bottom line: if you are looking for a low-cost dash cam, this is it.

title: You get what you pay for....but I still LOVE it!
text:
Hey, I get why people are rating this device low. But let's consider this....it is a $15 dash-cam!

My experience: Looking at the box, you can tell this is a generic device...heck, even the title says it! After mounting and plugging in, I was blown away that a $15 device would come with the mounting hardware (which in my opinion trumps most suction-cup mounts I have ever bought!). The battery is pretty much useless. It may last for 10 minutes after a full charge. Big deal though, if I need the camera on, I'll leave the car running. If you want a device that will mount and work, get this. If you are a connoisseur of HD dash cams and are going to be a snob about the nit-picky details....spend $100+ on another device.

PROs: Features (auto motion recording, video intervals of 1 minute, 5 minutes, 10 minutes, etc, night vision (even though it isn't all that great)
CONs: The display could be another inch or so. Battery Life.

title: SO FAR,, SO GOOD
text: I figured the most I'd lose is $22, why not!  My dvr came neatly wrapped, clearly brand new, no damage, no missing parts!  Easily installed, easily set up, very nice video for a cheap dash cam!  I'm pleased with its interior sound recording, and the exterior video!  The night video is pretty good for close up action, not awful!  Its funny listening to yourself sing, or cuss at other drivers, followed by "I caught that on tape, jerk".  It's also cool to go through the car wash w it rolling!  It's scope of the lanes in front of you expands to five lanes easily, it only shoots immediately in front and just off to the front corners of the vehicle BUT it catches everything in front well!

title: Yes it died seems to be very poor quality
text:
I liked it a lot at first. It died. It is junk. It seems ALL of the dash cams under $300.00 have the same problems according to reviews. I put a used VCR under the seat of my car, ran a small outdoor camera to it, mounted the camera on my dash, plugged everything into a power invertor, and now I finally have a REAL dash cam that works perfect every single time. All I have to do is press record on the VCR remote after I start the car and I am recording high quality video that I know will be there when I need it. I think I may move the VCR to the trunk eventually. When the VCR gets to the end of the tape it rewinds automatically, but I can hear it rewinding so I know to start the VCR record again.
If you can buy a high resolution digital camcorder for $29.00 you would think they could make and sell a better quality dash cam that did not cost hundreds of dollars.

title: Great bang for the buck
text:
Great daytime camera - so-so quality at night. I ordered 3 of these and 2 appear to be a newer model and 1 looks like an older returned item - definitely the newer models are better than the older. Hooks up with cigarette lighter cord - however it is 5v power, not 12v, so don't do what I did - I hard wired the unit and had to go back and put in a 12v-5v converter after burning up one unit (thankfully it was the older one!). The plug they include converts your car's 12v to 5v.
Overall the unit does a pretty good job and for the price it's honestly tough to beat. I "wish" it had a wider viewing angle and better night vision, but for less than $20 I really can't complain.
The newer models are good about automatically turning on and off when power applied (if your cigarette lighter plug is constant 12v instead of "key on" or accessory power 12v you'll have to unplug the unit when parked or it will record while parked - which is not necessarily bad unless it drains your battery).
I have not figured out how to get it to automatically erase older footage - when the memory card fills up I have had to manually delete older files. The instructions are obviously translated from another language and not well written.
I have not had any issues with the suction cup holding to the window though I have only had these for a little over a week.

title: What a letdown.
text:
I was excited to get this Dash Cam for such a great price, and I read good reviews about it online. Now, I don't know if it was the seller or the product which made it such a hassle.

It came nicely wrapped, and I was excited to use it. I get it all set up in my car, and it turns on; but constantly says "card error". I did the package off amazon where i can buy the "Transcend 32 gb" sd card, so I know it was new. But I tried other SD cards, and nothing worked! It just kept saying card error. I got the Transcend SD card to finally not show "Card error", but when I tried to record, it refused, as if the memory card was full.

I brought it in with me that night, because I didn't want the heat from my car to ruin it. I tried turning it on the next day (while having the car charger hooked up to it) and it wouldn't even turn on. I tried it inside my place, and still, would not turn on (even though it had been charging all night)!

I am sending it back. Don't waste your money- maybe mine was defective, but it wasn't worth the money, or effort.

title: Device worked for a few hours, then froze.Totally unresponsive.
text: Device worked for a few hours, then froze. Totally unresponsive. Had to remove battery to reset. When it happened again the next day, I returned it. Poor instructions, but I was satisfied with the picture and sound quality, if the camera hadn't been defective.

title: Four Stars

title: Four Stars
text: Works great, No problems, clear picture have had over a year now and worked better then the high dollar one I bought for the rear of vehicle.

title: Three Stars
text: Not bad.

title: Surprisingly good for the price.
text: I thought I wanted a smaller one with no display, but the display is useful for setting up the options, so I am glad that it has it. I am satisfied with the size - smaller than I expected, and no longer am looking for an even smaller one. I wanted one with GPS logging, but now I think logging speed will be more of a liability than an asset. On mine at least, the audio sometimes blips out at times. It is not really 1280 resolution - realize this records at a lower quality than an iPhone set to 640x480 mode. Also it may not be a 120 degree field of view as claimed, though I cannot easily measure that. I am giving it four stars because it is surprisingly good for the price, but I am returning it because I would rather spend $70 and get an actual HD one with a wider-angle lens. My suggestion - buy it if you want to stick to $24 as it does work. But I am excited enough about the concept of a car DVR that I am going to kick in another $40 and do it better.

title: Two Stars

title: Inexpensive Dash Camera records well
text:
I like the dash camera. It will record a clear video. It is a little jerky but that was expected.
I was able to set the date and time after I took the user manual to a copy machine and enlarged it by 200%. For the low cost I am satisfied with the camera.

title: Can't beat it for the price
text:
Works as advertised. Picture is not HD, which is fine by me. The picture is clear enough that if I ever need it as evidence, it would work just fine (I use it for recording the traffic around me because people love cutting me off or pulling out in front of an Amp'd colored jeep). Night time recording, it isn't optimal, but it does a good enough job.

I've used it to show mountain passes and jeep runs to friends that live far away from me.

Like I said, its not HD. The picture is good enough and considering the cost, it's a really good camera.

Why didn't I give it four stars. The mounting suction cup that came with it doesn't work. I may have received a bad one. The camera is light enough that painters tape holds it to the dash just fine, even wheeling in some really rough areas, the camera never moved.

FYI...if you have issues with the memory card, make sure that it clips into place. Don't just open the door and set the card in, you have to push it all the way in. You'll understand when you add the card.

title: Four Stars
text: It's a nice dash cam.

title: A good product for its price
text:
What I need is something to record the video while driving with relative good quality, but I'm not willing to spend hundreds of dollars for it. This is the second one I bought, I got the first one while travelling in China two years ago and it has been working great, the video quality is good while watching it on my computer. So when I saw it on Amazon I just bought another one for my wife's car, so far I haven't had the need to present it as evidence to any one, watched it a few times just for fun on the computer and it looked very good.
Do I really need GPS enabled camcorder with a lot of fancy features? not really, because I don't find a need for it.

title: You get what you papay for!
text: Works intermittently and substandard quality.  I do not recommend.

title: I wanted to like it - but the quality just wasn't there.
text:
I ordered two of these. My first clue that something was wrong was when I realized that I'd been shipped two different models - in the same exact box with the same exact packaging. Both looked almost identical until I started using them.

One of them swiveled and appeared to be the right model.
The other did not swivel and had a different set of resolution options in the video recording menu.

So basically it seems that I got one of the model I ordered and one of a slightly lower model.

The lower model had some sort of markings on the screen, almost as if someone took a red sharpie to it. The battery was already installed. I think this actually might have been someone's return. The battery would not hold a charge. Ironically, the lower model's video image quality was pretty decent.

The higher model looked brand new. Unfortunately after reviewing the video, it turned out to be blurry and almost unusable. I'm sure it's a lense/focus issue.

While I generally have good experiences with "cheap chinese" products, this is a situation where the defects/issues make the product unusable for what I need them for. As such I am returning them and will just spend the money on higher quality items.

title: it's battery doesn't last 10 seconds and it's videos are poor quality.
text:
Please do not buy this dash camera.

This camera frequently fails to turn on, it's battery doesn't last 10 seconds and it's videos are poor quality.

title: It worked good for a while but now
text: It worked good for a while but now ..... I think it has some software issues. Its nto reliable , I always have to look.. is it recording ? or is it full again ? Even though I have it on loop recording a lot of times it gets stuck and wont record. I turn on my car ( and camera) I start heading down the road and in a few minutes it displays memory full. I haven't been able to get rid of it unless I take it in the house hook it up to pc and delete all files. It will work until memory gets full again. To make it longer between having to delete files , I put setting down to 640x 480 ( i think ) down from 1080. The frame rate is pretty slow at 720 and 1080 i'm guessing like 15-20 fps so its far from being fluid video. But my biggest gripe is not being reliable and me having to keep display open so I can see when it stops recording and time for delete again. :(

title: Camera seemed to function, but files it created were corrupt

title: CAUTION. Brutally honest review.
text:
Well. Lets start by first saying that for the $15 I paid for it, it does a lot.
Of course thats very little. Ive had the thing for a little over an hour as of right now, and ill give you my thoughts.
VERY cheap quality. The whole thing would break into a million pieces if it is dropped.
I dont know what is being recorded, but the "1080PHD" is certainly no better than the VGA. From my tests, a 4 minute video on the highest quality setting takes up 800 MB. And a 1 minute video on vga takes up 90 MB. The video quality I get is certainly only 240P quality, though in either setting. I dont know how in the world the video takes up so much space, but it does.
Helpful Hint! Up is down, and Down is up. Press the record button while in the menu in order to make a selection.
The "motion detection" is a hoax. No such functionality.
Anyway, its exactly what you pay for. Everything from the cheap quality, to the 90's hip-hop tune you get when it powers on. Ill try it some more, but honestly just go buy a 30 or 60 dollar camera instead. This camera is more of a joke than it is useful.

title: What a great product

title: Like it a lot

I can also prove that I make complete stops at all stop signs and red lights.  If my drive is uneventful I put the card in my camera and erase everything in a couple of seconds then put it back in the camera for next use.  Great suction cup also.

title: A great starter Model
text:
This was my first model that I purchased. I first became interested in Car DVRs when the meteor exploded over Russia. But did not buy one until recently, when I sprang for the $20 bucks to purchase one.
I tried it out. I experimented with a mounting system that does not involved the enclosed suction cup, but hangs just below my rear view mirror. (I removed the suction cup and fastened the top with a cable tie to the arm of rear view mirror). And I snaked the wire around to my passenger side cigarette charger.
After several weeks, I was versed enough and bought a another one. The DVR207 is a better model. I would encourage you to spring for the extra bucks and get the model with the HDMI port.
In the future I'm sure this camera will have true HD, but you can educate yourself with the lesser 780p and 480p models until that time.
Oh, and a 32GB SDHC is the perfect for these cams.

title: A Dash Cam for $15? Yes, and it works!

Oh yes, the instructions are inscrutable so do a quick search for videos on You Tube; there's dozen of helpful videos. In spite of how cheaply made this gizmo is, it works and at $15 it is clearly a steal.

text: FIRST I want to remind folks that the rating is for the product NOT the seller. I give the seller 5 STARS for their QUALITY CUSTOMER SERVICE! The first DVR had a battery that would not charge. The seller PROMPTLY REPLACED IT with in days. The video recording is pretty good considering that it only cost 20 bucks. Date/time stamp does not stay current.  Instruction sheet is not easy to decipher.  The only good thing is I didn't lose a lot of money on it.

title: Clunky user interface and operating instructions, but that's OK
text:
Update October 30, 2016. I'm downgrading a star. The clock (video / file timestamp) stopped working, always started at same time / date: January 1, 2011 11:00AM. So I got another one. It developed similar problem, clock starts at random times. Otherwise, holding up OK. I do put a shade over it (on my dashboard) when parking in the sun (when I remember), that may help it surviving.

Pretty nice little package for the price! Works fine for me, does exactly what it is supposed to.

Note: Thanks Amazon user Nick C for posting PDF link for much better manual than what's included:
[...]

The user interface is clunky and not very intuitive, but with 6 buttons that can be expected.

The good thing is if all you want is a dash cam, you don't really need to use the buttons. Just plug it in your car, when you start up it starts recording, when you turn it off it stops. If you want to see the videos, use the included USB cable and plug it in your PC, default is it looks like flash drive (it's also supposed to support PC camera mode, I didn't try that).

If you want to use it as a manually controlled video camera, still camera, audio recorder, and playback for all those, you'll have to get used to the user interface.

I suggest use USB card optimized for video, e.g. Transcend 16GB Class 10 SDHC Flash Memory Card (TS16GSDHC10E). In 640 mode (good enough), it seems to use around 100MB / minute, so 16GB should be good for around 1600 minute (about 26 hours). Probably 4GB is sufficent, depending how much video do you want to store. It stores the videos as fixed length (or less when you turn off before duration expired), default is 2 minutes, I prefer longer duration, selected 5 minutes. I find the saved clips are seamless, there is no gap between them at all. When the disk fills up it starts rolling over the oldest clips with newest ones by default (there is setting to disable), and I haven't gotten that far yet.

You should do some setup before using it. For example, set the time and date. That's not too hard, and you only have to do it once.

Note: Removing the battery or formatting the card resets some of the setup, such as time and date.

Here are some usage notes, and step-by-step operating examples:

"HD DVR" as of April 2015
2.5" TFT LCD screen
supports up to 32GB SD/MMC card

Basic Operation
Setup (one time, see below)
When 12V power turns on, recording starts
When 12V power turns off, recording stops
To retrieve videos, plug into PC, appears as USB drive (also camera device)

Extended Operation
Can record and play back video, camera, and audio
By manipulating the buttons (operations aren't very intuitive)

Case Buttons:
Power (lights with power) Button
*Power input overrides (Power button has no effect when USB power is connected)
*Can not turn off in recording mode
OK (Record / Snapshot) (lights with charging) Button
Starts / Stops recording in record mode
Take a picture in picture mode
Selects item in menu mode

Display Buttons:
Menu - enter Menu Mode, or back out of current menu
Down - select item, also used for digital zoom out in some modes
Up - select item, also used for digital zoom in in some modes
Mode - select between operating modes, in some menus make an activation

To enter Main Setup
Turn on Unit
Press OK button to stop recording
Press Menu button
(Camera icon is highlighted)
Up/Down buttons to navigate to item
Rec/Snap button to select item

Once item is selected
Up/Down buttons to navigate to choice
OK button to set choice

To enter Secondary Setup
Turn on Unit
Press OK button to stop recording
Press Menu button
(Camera icon is highlighted)
Press Mode button to highlight Toolkit icon
(Toolkit icon is highlighted)
Up/Down buttons to navigate to item
OK button to select item
Up/Down buttons to navigate to sub-item
OK button to select item

Once item is selected
Up/Down buttons to navigate to choice
Rec/Snap button to set choice
Sounds menu only, use Mode button to sequence through available choices

To enter Camera Setup
Press Mode button to enter Camera mode (upper left corner Camera icon)
Press Menu button
Work the settings same way as other menus

Exiting out of any Menu item
Press Menu button to back up

Suggested setup:

Plug into DC adapter to turn on and enter recording mode
Press OK button to stop recording
** Reset All **
Press Menu button to enter menu mode (Video Camera icon)
Press Mode button to enter Toolkit mode (Tool Kit icon)
Press Down button to reach "Reset All..." selection
Press OK button to reset all, Observe "OK?" dialog
Press OK button again to activate Reset, observe "waiting" dialog for a few seconds
Press Menu button to re-enter operating mode
** Format **
Press Menu button to enter Menu mode (Video Camera icon)
Press Mode button to enter Toolkit mode (Tool Kit icon)
Press Down button to reach "Format..." selection
Press OK button to reset all, Observe "OK?" dialog
Press OK button again to activate Format, observe "waiting" dialog for a few seconds
Press Menu button to re-enter operating Mode
** Toolkit Setup, adjustments to defaults **
Press Menu button to enter Menu mode (Video Camera icon)
Press Mode button to enter Toolkit mode (Tool Kit icon)
Change Volume to 3, leave other sounds at default
Change Power Frequency to 60 (USA standard)
Leave Power Save at default 1 minute (only applies to battery operation)
Leave Panel Protect at default off (only applies to battery operation)(got lockup when set on)
Set Date and Time to current (Up/Down changes field values, Mode button sequences fields, OK button exits dialog)
Leave Language at default English
Set TV Out to NTSC (USA standard)
Leave Startup image at default System
Note Version AS-2013-04-27c
Leave IRLED at default ON (automatically turns on in low light conditions)
Press Menu button to exit all dialogs
** Recording Setup, adjustments to defaults **
Press Menu button to enter menu mode (Video Camera icon)
Set Movie Size to 640x480
Leave Date Stamp at default ON
Leave Motion Detect at default OFF (this setting only applies to battery operation)
Leave Loop Rec at default ON
Set Loop Time to 5 minutes (how long each video clip is)
Leave Continue at default off (how long to keep running when power goes off)
Leave Video Sound at default ON
Press Menu button to return to operating mode

Other Features
When connected to PC, Up/Down cycles mode as appears to PC, MDSC/PC-CAM/Recording (?)

title: Amazing for the price!!!
text:
I have moved from Hawaii to Portland and the driving here is so different. I've nearly gotten clipped quite a few times and people run red lights more often (or maybe I'm just noticing it more). Of course intersections are about twice to three times bigger, so it could be cars trying to beat the "yellow" light /shrug?

Anyhoo, I've been watching youtube vids of insurance scammers and what not and been looking for an HD cam for a reasonable cost. So far this has been amazing. I haven't had to use footage from it yet, but it records audio + 720p with no issues.

The menu is kinda strange to navigate but once I set it up, I haven't had to touch it again. I had an 8GB SD card in the cam at first but realized that it wasn't enough storage and got a 32GB SD card. I want to say it records 3-4 days of driving and holds it reasonably well.

The 8GB SD card is ok as long as you pull it the same day anything occurs. If you have a smaller SD card in the cam you may want to have a back up card of the same size handy, if you want to keep footage. I'm sure if I turned off audio, it would save on space but I really wanted the audio in case someone starts yelling at me for any reason (I also have a 5 year old daughter that is often in the car with me, so it's for her protection too to have the audio).

If this ever breaks, I will buy it again!!! If this is discontinued I will cry. Thanks for the awesome product and if we get a second car, I will be getting one of these for that car too!!

**Update: Husband knocked the first one off the window by loading a dining chair in the front seat (we were moving). I ordered another and the menu has improved and was much easier to set up than the first time. The picture is a clearer as well and catches more detail. Very glad I re-ordered!!

title: Cheap but works for a while
text:
If you want to try the world of dash camming (is that a proper term?) this isn't a bad way to go, it's cheap and it works.

However on the one I got the suction cup mount just would NOT hold the camera to the windshield for more than a few seconds no matter what I did. A heavy duty replacement mount from eBay solved that problem.

More annoying is the menus, and the fact that the thing will forget the date and time pretty regularly and for no apparent reason.

Plus the thing is CHEAP, cheap to buy and cheaply made.

For a disposable camera to play with a bit it's fine. If you really want to become a YouTube star with cool road videos pass on this and find a better camera.

title: Has too many limitations but its a good dash cam.
text: I like these cameras. I do foster care and there are times I need evidence of what is going on in my car or yard. the batteries in both of these cameras are worthless. the best charge I can get out of them will run the cam for 5 min. I was hoping to be able to hook it up to my dvd player in my truck to be able to use it to back up to trailers and record behind the car and see it on the truck video display. I was also wanting to put it on my drone and fly it around but with the short battery life it is almost impossible. Also I was hoping to be able to record more than 12 hours at a time on a 32 gig sd card but it won't. Had an incident happen once at night where I saw a fish jumping in the road. no one believed me but I remembered the cam that runs 24/7 in my truck and pulled up the video and sure enough it was during so high water and it jumped out of a rain gutter in the side of the road and in a couple hops it was back in the drain. without light it is too dark. the IR is worthless.

title: Great Protection

Also if you get a policeman trying to say you said something you did not, you have the proof in court, It records very well even if your out side your car, just leave your acc on in your car. at last the red light cameras, these are great if you did not run the red light , or if it was a 1 secound yellow, any ways for the price it well protect you when you are driving.

title: Viewing angle is about 30 deg.-there is a zoom
text:
This is my 4th one. I like this considering the price which perform basic continuous recording. It seems every time the inside of this product changes a little (seller or maanufactured by XKX this time). This time the viewing angle is so narrow, it is virtually useless. I compared with other units I have which all has about 90 degree, although they are described as having 120 deg. viewing angle. 90 deg. is ok but 30 deg viewing angle can not be useful. Also, the regular car charger is not included with this order but I got USB cable with cigarette lighter socket adaptor, and the length of cord is very short, about 5 ft.

Update-I was playing with the other unit that has 90 deg. viewing angle; and found out, by accident, the the middle two button below the screen is actually zoom in and out button. Try pressing two middle buttons while it is recording. It may work when recording is stopped, I don't know. But, the older unit have definitely wider view angle even with zoom out adjustment. I would have made it to 5 start if it came with regular car adapter with long cord. Really short USB cord was a deal breaker for me.

title: Software is not stable.

title: For the money, excellent buy
text:
I had to review about 20 of these guys before deciding. Most of these cheap units have many problems but I must say this one has done an excellent job. It comes with a very long 12v adapter cord, which allows you to 'bury' it around your dash trim for a cleaner look. The camera quality, which I know everyone wants to know, its acceptable for the job. To see the 'bigger picture', NOT to see license plate numbers at a distance or finite details.

The packaging came nice and neat, all cords were there, I got a 32 gb SD card so I can have enough room to record 10/min at a time. Playback is quick and easy. The unit is very light. The suction cup is 10x better than my Garmin Nuvi ($150+ unit mind you). The mount allows some nice flexibility to rotate or 'pivot'/angel the cam if you have a funky windshield.

The only issue I had was the rotating of the camera from left to right on the mount. It has a strange 'screw washer' that you have to align just right with the camera for it to face forward. If the screw is on too tight, by the time you screw the camera on top, the threshold of it stopping makes it cock-eyed so you have to partially unscrew little by little to get the line up just right.

The sound quality of playback is poor, but you can make words during conversations and such in the car. I paid for a dash cam, not an HD camcorder, right?

The battery on the unit is great, the motion detector works like a charm.

Nightvision is borderline acceptable. But if I was at a light, I can make out the color and type of vehicle with easy, anything further than 20 meters would be impossible.

title: The price says it all
text: I ordered this product with low expectations, I mean who wouldn't for $15. The product comes in its box along with a car charger cable for it and a battery which you will end up placing inside of the dash cam. This camera does not record in HD at ALL! It says that it does, but it doesn't. This dash cam records in standard definition which is okay with me. As long as I can have proof of my innocence in a crash ill be happy. Another flaw about this product is that the battery only lasts about 10 minutes on a full charge, it is complete crap. That being said, the dash cam must always be plugged into a power source when you are using it. This dash cam's default language is set to Chinese when you get it, but I did some research online and 10 minutes later I found out how to switch it to English. The instructions to do this should come with the product but it doesn't. A couple good things about this is that it actually does work, with all flaws put to the side, I guess the camera does what it's suppose to do, record. The Dash Cam also has a very easy navigation menu and live playback on the screen and seems to have a firm build. So if you care more about getting video and less about battery life then this product is just for you.

title: Fair value for the money
text: For the price this isn't a bad deal.  The video isn't real clear and sharp like you would expect from a high-definition camcorder, but it's really cheap and it records a clear enough image that you can demonstrate whether you hit someone or they hit you, which is basically the idea of a car DVR.  It worked fine for a few years, then the battery failed.  I haven't replaced it yet, but I still think it's a good idea to have a DVR recording the road when you drive.  Good evidence is good insurance.

title: Good for what it is!
text:
I definitely like this camera. I went into this understanding that there may be some issues, where most of them come directly from China. Honestly it is really quite good for what it is. Works well during the day, not well at all at night.
The microphone also wasn't working on mine at all... I actually opened it up and took a look around, it appears there is a micro-resistor missing on the mic circuit. I may attempt jumping the connection if I get bored some day, will post results. Otherwise, this thing is really simply designed inside. Was able to poke around, without breaking anything, so I'd definitely think that says something as far as build quality. Considering how "cheesy" this thing looks at first glance. Given though that some components are quite cheap, and so is the plastic. Quite little sacrifice to make something that can retail so inexpensive though!

Another note... It's also quite strange, like a quantum observation effect or something, lol, because I've never seen it happen. Though sometimes when I leave the car and come back the LCD screen shifts colors quite randomly. As in, green is now pink, pink is now green. Again, heh, I haven't ever actually seen it change. It's only if I leave and come back it seems. >_<

Others are correct, this ONLY charges from 12v connection. Don't try to plug in to computer and leave it there thinking that it's charging. Won't happen. It does work via USB for data transfer or as a webcam but it will not charge that way, in fact it uses batteries when in that mode.

It has its pros, it has its cons. Would still recommend though! ^_^

title: Get what you pay for
text: Purchased this after someone backed into me at a green light. Worked ok for a couple weeks, but then stopped holding a charge.

title: Works well, but be prepared to make some adjustments
text: The sound is not great, but functional, but the video is reliable and usable. The IR lights have very little range and can cause a glare effect on the video at night, its best to turn them off. I use a 32GB SD class 10 with this camera. The mount is sturdy enough, and has only come off with extreme changes in temperature. The power cable is very long, making it a breeze to route behind dash or body panels. The camera is power trough the USB port so it is not as clean as other designs. The only problem I have experienced is that the camera lost focus when the seasons changed, the fix was to open the camera, remove the camera lens assembly and adjust the focus as you would a manual focus webcam, this can be challenging, as the focus was set at the factory using instant glue, but with a pair of pliers I was able to break the bond and make my adjustments. If you have to adjust the focus, this will void your warranty, but at the price, its not even worth returning, just make sure you disconnect the ribbon cable carefully, break the glue bond, reconnect the ribbon cable, set to webcam and make your adjustments at a reasonable distance, and wear some gloves, as the sheet metal that holds the actual CMOS is sharp.

title: I bought 2

The battery is only for the ability to move the camera from location to another to keep the date and/or time.
The camera will not turn off while its plugged in to 12v.
You can stop and/or start recording while connected to 12v.
The odd thing is, on the screen, when it reads PAUSE, it really is recording, you can tell by watching the counter in the upper right hand corner, and once you touch PAUSE, the PAUSE will disappear and the camera will stop recording. I would think with the PAUSE displayed, it would be in the PAUSE mode. I bought 2, one for each vehicle.
The windshield mount is very tight and does not move even if going down a rough road.
Good luck

!!!REVIEW UPDATE!!!
I meant everything I wrote before but both of these have FAILED within just weeks of each other. Basically they worked for about 9 months. One failed to power on one day even after I removed the battery and tried to use the others power cord to see if that was the problem. Nope, it just stopped working. title: Just Buy It!
text:
Like you, I have read good reviews, bad reviews, and mixed reviews on this camera. One helpful insight here - sort the reviews by "newest first". Manufacturers often change and frequently improve their products, so older reviews may not be accurate. Here's my story;

I took the plunge and bought 2 of these right off the bat, one for personal vehicle and one for work truck. I also bought 32 Gb memory cards for each. Upon arrival, one unit seemed brand new and the other looked like someone had returned it. Awesome! After spending a whopping 15 minutes setting up the date/time and recording settings (they both arrived with partially charged batteries) I was ready to go. The "used" unit did have a vertical line on the screen (yes, I removed the protector), but you know - if I am staring at this tiny screen while I am driving (so I can see on the screen what is ahead of me?) I probably need more than a dash cam! The vertical line has no affect on anything. Now here's where it gets complicated - I plugged the units into their respective power plugs, inserted the SD cards, and stuck the suction cup to the windshield. Yup, that's it - done!

The suction cups hold well wherever you put them.The mount is awesome, not huge, and allows for many angles. The cord is very long and tucks away easily. Both lighter plugs work flawlessly. Recording started immediately, creates a new file every 15 minutes as desired, and loops back over the oldest file once the SD card is full. I removed the cards to see what I was actually recording and was actually impressed with the quality of the video. No, you can't read license plates at a distance - but then again my eyes can't either so why would I expect a camera to be able to? The video quality is more than ample, trust me. Night time recording is not great, but again - if you know anything about security/surveillance cameras, none work as good in the dark as they do in daylight. Darkness is the bane of any camera.

Seriously, for $25 + a $20 SD card you really can't go wrong with these cameras. They do what they are supposed to do and they do it really well. I ordered a third for my Wife's vehicle, they're just that cool! Report a drunk driver? Give your card to the police. See an accident or hit and run happen in front of you? The proof is on the card. Someone hits you? Your insurance company would love to see the card! Leave it recording overnight and see who's stealing your newspaper or breaking in to neighborhood cars. The applications are endless!

title: A cheap value, but kinda worse than expected.
text:
Edit (4-8-14) I'm changing this to one star because I was recently almost hit by a car and this stupid DVR didn't catch it. It's set to capture 5 min long segments, but it only does 1 min at a time, then takes a full 6 seconds to start recording again. In that time it missed this near accident. Afterwards, I was able to catch up and tail the offending car very closely in clear daylight and this stupid DVR couldn't show the license plate with any clarity when I reviewed the video. It functions, but it's almost useless.

Ok, I've done the research on entry level DVRs from China and I know this was gonna be el cheapo, but the quality was worse than expected. I'm lucky that it works at all, but as others have stated, It's not really 720 hd, not wide angle lens, audio was horrible, battery won't hold a charge long, frame rate is inconsistent, and there's a few seconds of delay between recording cycles. But informed consumers already know all this and that you'd have to spend at least 3-4x to rectify most of these issues...

So yeah, it's an entry level DVR for $20. And in a legal contest crappy video evidence is probably a big leap from no video at all - unless it's a hit and run and you really need to see a license plate clearly.

title: Decent dash cam at a low price
text:
The only reason I decided to buy this camera was because it was under $15. I figured I couldn't go wrong at that price. After opening the packaging I was worried by how cheap it felt. It is made with very low quality plastic and you can certainly feel the cheapness to it. While it is cheap, I am not disappointed in the purchase at all. It captures audio and video just fine (may not be the best quality but I expected that). I tested all three video quality modes and decided to stick with the 640x480. I couldn't tell a difference in quality between the three; however, the 640x480 resolution captured the widest and tallest video. The two higher defs captured the same width, but the height was shorter. Also, you can record more video at the lower definition. I was a little worried that the timer showed only being able to record 1.5 hours in 640x480 quality with a 32gb SD card. It should be able to hold much more space, but I have yet to use it enough to see if it holds more or not. Other reviewers say they get over 9 hours which sounds more accurate, so might just be an inaccurate timer.

The car charger it comes with has a very long cable so you can tuck it up through the roof and around the side. The suction cup mount works great and is easy to install and remove. I really like the flip down screen. I only use it to set up the settings and then line up the camera for the best view. I don't drive with it down and it hides nicely behind my rear view mirror.

While the listing states it gets 120 degree site, I have to question that. When mounted underneath my rear view mirror, I cannot see the sides of my car by the bumper. If someone were to side swipe me, it may not capture that. It would show that I stayed in my lane so that may be enough evidence to prove your case.

Pros:
Auto records when vehicle starts
Auto shuts off when vehicle is turned off
Auto deletes older clips once memory card is full
Flip down screen lets you see exactly what it is recording
Easy to swivel and record police out the side window

Cons:
Cheap plastic (worried about melting in heat)
Only shows 1 hour 30 minutes available on 32gb SD card (in lowest definition - only 30 minutes in HD)
Not the best video/audio quality

Overall Impression:
8/10 for value (price to quality ratio). It records video and audio and was only $15. Can't beat that!
4/10 for overall quality. Plastic is very cheap and might melt in the sun, but again, it was only $15.
I have no regrets with this purchase and plan on continuing to use it. I have no need for a better dash cam at the moment but may upgrade one day.

title: Recommend for anyone who drives
text: I was hit twice before getting these. I tested them while my car was still in the shop. It was easy to set up and transfer. I used it in the rental car and moved to my car when I got my car from the shop. It was easy to install the power cable. The camera hides behind the rear view mirror, so it doesn't interfere with driving. It is also easy to use the drop down screen so you can position the camera to view the road and traffic lights.

title: This one is junk..  Don't buy !!

I already own a cam, but I've been trying to save a buck for a rear window cam. This cam's software sucks compare to the one I bought off of Ebay. [...] The one on Ebay actually has a HDMI input, and the software is far more advanced than these. Although they look just alike..They aren't for any means. The one I bought off of Ebay actually lets you record continuously .. It allows you to delete old recordings right on the camera instead of having to take the SD card to a computer to delete it. title: It does the job for the price
text: For under $20, this is a very functionable, and very handy dash video recorder.  Mine has worked trouble free for a year (video recording).  I've read some of the complaints about it being cheaply made---well, it is, but it works great.  You have to treat it with care so that it lasts a long time. Mine fell off the windshield, smashed the dash and hit the floor numerous times without breaking.  Some people have complained about it not staying on the windshield very well.  I used to have that problem until the light bulb went off inside my head and I realized the suction cup needed moisture to hold it up.  You can figure out how you want to moisten it yourself.  I have my way.  If your windshield is too hot or too cold, you have to wipe off the windshield and moisten the suction cup.  What comes with the recorder isn't cheaply made--it's something you deal with when it comes to any suction cup and temperatures. The battery isn't going to last forever, and like cellphones, will need to be plugged into the car charger while recording more often than not.  The car charger will also possibly last just a year. I bought a longer coiled usb port that plugged into my car charger and have no problems.  The extra security from having this recorder for the price gives me lots of confidence while driving.

title: Don't waste your money

title: IT does the job, but has issues and won't last.
text:
I bought one last June.
I love that it comes on and off with the power of the car so I don't have to fiddle with it getting in and out of the car.
I drive roughly an hour and a half each day. A 2gb card lets me store a days worth of my driving.

Issues..
The suction cup is poorly design. I had to clean the hell out of my window and the cup to get them to stay. The lever to add pressure to the suction cup does not do anything.
The device lasted about 9 months before the battery swelled and took the rest of the device with it.

Though it has the two problems I mentioned above, for the price of half a tank of gas... I bought another one to replace the last. What can I say? It's affordable. If I have to replace it every year, it'll take me 10 years before I could have bought a nicer camera.. Chances are a nicer camera won't last 10 years. So I think I'll end up ahead.

Update: The new one came in, though it looks the same, the buttons are lit up red instead of blue. The old charger/power I have the wires hidden all the way through the dash and ceiling of the car no longer works with this one. The one I just received has a mini USB connection. This is a little frustrating, as rerunning the power wire, makes a huge difference on rebuying every year. I'm going to leave the old power and put the new power in. Perhaps the third I buy will fit one or the other.

title: Not Bad For Under $20.00 !!
text:
Perspective, people. If you pay under $20 for a dashcam, do not compare picture quality or anything else to your iPhone. This is my first dashcam but even for the price, I must say it operates very well. The owners manual is a bit difficult to decipher, although it is in English, the person writing it does not have a very good grasp of the language.

The picture quality (on 2.5" display) is very good. Mine had a protective plastic film which I was hesitant to remove but the picture was even better after I did.

The night vision option appears to work well, more details and scenery show up after switching to night vision. From reading other reviews, I think this option is 'win or lose' depending on the seller. One reviewer stated that the "night vision option" only turned on the 6 LED's... mine appears to have the legitimate night vision.

My overall opinion of this camera is good - great for the price.

text: Nice video for the price. ..having a lot of fun with it!

title: Garbage and Lies
text:
Prime 2 day eligible, yet arrived in 4 days, this is becoming a habit.
Item arrived in a plastic bag...no box....good thing it wasn't a gift.
Video quality is garbage, but is good enough to document who ran a red light. Not HD as described, and night time IR is useless.
Audio quality is garbage, but who needs to hear my road rage. Most of the audio is noise from the camera.
The product description isn't even close to the actual product. And yet again, Amazon doesn't care or monitor deceitful item descriptions for items the list. Its an item that is so cheap, that people aren't going to want to bother returning it if it doesnt work, i knew this and took the gamble.
It records video and audio well enough to determine who may be at fault....during the day. At night. forget it.
If you are looking for quick cheap way to add a witness to your drive, as I was driving a company car, give it a try. I think it will work out ok for my needs.
Other than it being nothing like the description, the only issue I had is it will not turn off automatically like it should when power is cut. It stays on until the internal battery dies...which is about 3 minutes. At next start up, it turns on fine.
Its a camera for under $20...its what I expected and nothing more.

Disclaimer: I was charged full price for this item and was not asked for an "honest" review.

title: Video hiccups every few seconds. 1080p setting doesn't work.
text: It's okay for the price. The video seems to hiccup every few seconds which is annoying to watch, but it should still work well enough as evidence. You can forget about the 1080p quality setting. It comes switched to this by default, but it's actually WORSE quality (more pixelated) than the VGA 480p video, while taking up more space on the memory cards. I recommend everyone switch to 480p quality before they install this thing.

title: Do NOT buy it!
text:
Do NOT buy this dash camera. You will get for what you paid for!

I purchased this camera in April 2012, but did not test it right after I got it (lesson learned). The first feeling when I received it was it was made of some cheap plastic. The image quality when took out side of car even with 1280x960 setting was very poor with lots of noise. When installed with camera mount on the dash board or wind shield, this dash camera could NOT focus. The recorded videos were blurry with double images all the time, not to mention the worse quality when I tried to zoom in. When I found those issue, it was late for me to return it the the seller. I was then advised by Amazon to send the camera to the manufactory and they should be able to send me a new one as a replacement (still within the warranty period). I was WRONG. The seller does not have an ID with that manufactory. I was told by the owner of that manufactory that some Amazon sellers buy products from that manufactory and let that manufactory ship the products to the end-users directly. It took me about four months to find this and my faulty dash camera was already destroyed. This is a very painful experience.

title: It just works! Would buy for every car I have!
text: I use this mounted in my Tundra for a daily roundtrip commute of 1 hour. It's one of those things that while cheap (price wise) it really "just works". Once you do an initial setup, program the date, etc. you plug it in, the car turns on, activates the recorder and you're good to go. I literally never have to touch it and can pull out the memory card, put it in my computer and copy over video just like I would on a digital camera. The absolute best feature is that like a solid home video security system it will overwrite the oldest footage if it needs extra space. This is normally a period of about 30 days. If mine were to break for any reason, I would still buy this unit again because of how reliable it is. Kudos to the creators for keeping it very simple and to the point!

title: Effective but VERY cheap
text:
For starters, the description says "HD" but it isn't actually HD. Scaling up to HD resolutions results in a resize of the base resolution, so it doesn't do anything but increase file size. The camera has too narrow a field of view in my opinion. The night vision "works" but would be useless in a car. It doesn't record well in low light at all. Don't expect the camera to pick up anything on the road at night unless it is right in front of your car in the headlights.

The switch that turns off the screen when you close it broke on second use. It kills the battery quickly, so I just leave it plugged in all the time now.

The daytime video looks decent, but it is scarcely better than a VHS recording.

All in all, this camera is still great considering it is only 18 dollars. It leaves a lot to be desired, and I will probably end up spending four times as much and buying the camera that this camera was copied from. It is both in HD and has a 120 degree lens.

title: Decent picture
text:
I'm not going to go into pixels, grain, size, etc, etc. It works well enough to tell who you're looking at - that's what counts.

I had trouble with neighborhood kids messing in my yard on days off school and wanted some innocuous way to monitor them - at as little cost as possible. I researched other camera's and while there were cheaper cameras, storage of footage was an issue. You either had to leave your computer running all day to record footage, find an IP camera and store online (at an extra fee), or buy expensive DVR recording equipment. This solves the problem.

I bought this device and an SD card and Voila. The card (32GB) will record about 2 days worth of footage (so you do have to look over it regularly). I visually inspect my property when I get home. If it looks to have been disturbed, I check the footage. If not, I leave it running.

On the video, when plugged into a computer, the picture is absolutely fine for seeing anyone enter my property from the front - which is the only access point. It's good enough to make out their faces should any incident need reporting to the authorities.

Strangely enought, in spite of this being intended for use in a vehicle I haven't actually used it in one. From the footage I receive recording through my window at home, this will record adequately from within a vehicle should you ever need to use it's recordings in a legal case.

text: Mine only lasted about 2 weeks before everything started to fall apart / break. It's made of a very cheap plastic. The hinge that holds the screen to the camera broke off and the battery does not even last 10min on a full charge. For a $15 dash cam, it's not a bad deal if you're willing to duct tape the thing when it starts breaking apart. As for a replacement battery, no idea where to find them. Package arrived on time and in good condition. Would do business again.

title: Best 14.99 purchase i've made on amazon.
text: This small purchase just saved me so much time and money.  Last week a student at the university I work at backed into my vehicle while waiting to enter a parking deck.  Having the entire thing on camera forced her insurance to take full responsibility without having to wait for the police report and vehicle inspection to proceed.  It was probably one of the best 15 dollar purchases I ever made.  The video is a little blurry compared to a 60.00 camera my coworker just bought but i suspect I can fix the focus issue once i give it some attention.  Great product for the money.  Turns on when car turns off, turns off when car turns off.  I put a 32G SD card in and it records 3-4 days worth of 50 mile each way commuting.  The night vision seems pretty much useless since infrared doesn't work well passing through angled windshield.  This is not the best camera you can buy for sure, but price for value it is 5 stars

title: Cheap And Does The Job: Check, Works As Advertised: Not So Much
text:

Cons:
- The battery did not charge
- There was a sharpie mark across the screen
- If facing backwards, you cannot view the LCD screen.
- The estimated time shown on the screen is for HD vids only, does not matter what you have it set to.
- All the video modes are practically the same, no point in making larger files.
- The video files caused a constant error on my computer although I did re-encode with Handbrake into smaller mp4's
- The microphone would fade after a few minutes of recording.
- The video files do not overwrite after the card fills, Shows error and shuts off. Could be a setting I missed though

Pros:
- It does indeed work with a 32GB card, I used a GSkill

It works, I can cover myself in case of an accident, but I wouldn't really depend on this camera to do much else.

title: Cheap and it gets the job done
text:
I've been using this dash-cam for 6 months now and it has been very reliable. I was concerned with such a low price that I would be getting a low quality product that would give me all sorts of problems. However that has not been the case. While it's not the greatest quality of device, it is designed and built good enough to get the job done.

Notes:
* It's not actually HD. My best guess is that the video is captured at 320x240 and is stretched to 1280x720. If you're within one car distance of someone, you can make out their license plate, but any further and it just turns into a blur.

* The audio quality is awful. Don't expect to be hearing anything useful from it.

* The video is poorly compressed and will take up a lot of storage. I'd recommend a 16GB SD card. That should store around 4hrs of video.

* The UI is a bit tricky to navigate.

title: Only Used It For Two Minutes
text: I didn't even get to the settings menu,or even install it. Out of nowhere, while I was charging the battery through my laptop, it started popping the Welcome screen on and off. I searched the reviews here and learned about a reset button.. I tried a toothpick, a "can of air" stick, you name it.. Still not getting anywhere, couldn't even feel a reset button, getting frustrated and knowing if I take it apart I might void some kind of warranty.. I gave up and actually took it apart. I found NO reset button, it's a regular circuit board connected to two wires which connects to the battery port. What I had done though all my poking, was disconnect the blue wire from the circuit board. Once I did this, with the battery in and plugged into the USB the camera appeared, but froze 15 seconds later with me being unable to power it off and then on again.... I thought "Huh.." and wanted to solderer the blue wire back to the board again. After I did this, it went back to the original issue (popping welcome screen). Obviously, there is a short in the board somewhere. This device is an electronic nightmare. Don't buy it unless you have some extra cash to blow and love solving mysteries or take a 50% chance of it working for you. If I didn't want one of these so bad, this would have been my tech engineering dream project. It would be well worth my spent money if just one person shopping for a dash cam heeded my warning and just invested in something a little more "responsive"...

title: It was low quality to begin with & broke after 1 week
text:
UPDATE: from when I posted my original review . . .

I have now used it for about 3+ Weeks. I reduced my rating from a 3-star to a 1-star. After about 1 week of use, the screen started going all-white. It turned out it was still recording, but the screen was all white and I couldn't see what it was recording. The only way I knew it was recording was the faint blue LED was flashing. But then, after a few more days, it was starting to make awful clicking sounds and the blue LED was no longer flashing (so I knew it wasn't recording).

At that point, I had no idea what is was doing (if anything) and considered it broken beyond use.

My recommendation is now - do NOT buy this. It broke on me within 1 to 2 weeks.

ORIGINAL REVIEW . . .

The only reason I even give this a 3-star is because it was $20, and for $20, it pretty much delivers about $20 worth of value. I bought an $80 dash cam similar to this one about 6 months ago and it was a piece of junk and broke within a week or so after I got it. So rather than get ripped off $80 again, I decided to risk $20.

After using this for about 2 days, I'll summarize the pros and cons:

Pros -

(1) It was $20 (that's hard to beat).
(2) It worked.
(3) The windshield mount was solid and worked well.

Cons -

(1) The video quality is always VGA (640x480) regardless of what setting you select.
(2) Because it is VGA - you cannot read signs or license plate numbers.
(3) The microphone audio quality was highly distorted and unusable.
(4) The owner documentation was unhelpful - not worth the paper it was printed on.
(5) It took me some time to figure out the menu navigation and getting it configured, but eventually I got through it.
(6) There is a pastic protector on the screen that is a real pain to get off. I eventually had to use a "push pin" (the kind you use on a cork board) to get the plastic coating to lift off the screen.

For $20, I think I got what I paid for.

I would rather spend $50 to $75 and get a HD dashcam that had good audio and looked to be of good quality, but for $20, it will work for now.

The suction cup mount that's included is more than strong enough to hold it, and the power cable is plenty long enough to route around my trim panels and hide for a cleaner look. The bottom line is, it works pretty well - as others have stated, "HD" is to be taken with a grain of salt - their 1080P is actually 1280x720 - I could test the bit rate, but who cares? It gets the job done and will hopefully help sort out fault if I'm ever in or if it ever captures and accident.

I've attached a little video of me breaking out of the recent east coast blizzard.
