title: the Perfect Witness
text:
[[VIDEOID:26121a59e91cccb37c41e105de05497a]] I would have gave this three stars but the fact that I got to use the video from this for an accident led me to give an extra star.

The driver of the other car told police my car did not stop and went through the stop sign, we had the same story. Later I checked the camera to see what it recorded, It was at night but recorded enough to see who was at fault. I sent the video to the police, my insurance and his insurance. I received a call from his insurance saying he admitted fault and they are taking full responsibility!

The camera itself is made cheap but works. You need to be tech savvy to use it. But for $20 it is worth the price. This $20 camera just saved me lots of headaches and money by capturing the accident.

I will be buying another one for my other vehicle.

title: Inexpensively valuable
text:
Actually, I was looking for something for "Rodent Surveillance"... I thought I would give this thing a shot since it was cheaper than a round of drinks. The other reviews were very helpful, and although some of the reviewers had bad experiences, I thought, why not. Since ordering the camera, the price went up $4.33. Set up was pretty simple, once I figured out the menu sequence. I plugged it in via the 12v adapter that I already had, and set it on a small tripod aimed at a poison bait tray and peanut butter traps. Specs state it supports up to a 32gb card. I used an 8GB card. When full, the unit records over the earliest video taken, then proceeds to "fill" the card again. It recorded for about two and a half days straight, all the while not capturing video of any rodents. (Neither poison eaten nor peanut butter traps tripped). The IR night vision probably wouldn't suffice on a dashboard, but it was more than adequate to see what was happening around the bait tray. Hey, at least it was cheaper than a round of drinks...

Testing video quality on the dashboard of my vehicle, I mounted it on the windshield using the supplied suction cup mount, and ran a few errands. The manual says it will record in three different graphic configurations....QVGA, VGA and SXGA. This one did not capture video in the SXGA setting. (Just sound), Don't know why, but the quality difference of the video captured in the other two settings is minimal. . Don't get me wrong... If you are using this to capture vehicular traffic, the quality is more than adequate. My PC was able to see the .AVI files, no problem. I used an SD card reader, not the supplied USB cable. The video you see in the other reviews is spot on actually. The menu is a bit frustrating, and the manual is nearly useless. It's more for reference than it is a guide on how to use the product. ...But hey, this thing was cheaper than a round of drinks!!

Four stars... NO, Five stars because this thing will do what it's intended to do, AND seemingly keep rodents away !!

***Rodent statement not proven, it's merely coincidence that I haven't captured any video of rodents while this thing has been in use.

title: To clear up all the confusion about this product
text:
EDIT: After two months of the product working smoothly, my recorder just died the other day and no longer will turn on.

I wanted to write a review to clear up the extremely mixed reviews you get about this product. I'll write this review in sections, so it's easier to find what you're looking for.

Why I bought this dashcam:
I bought this camera because I didn't have much money to drop on a dashcam right now and I needed one quickly because I'm going on a trip in a couple days. I had looked up a bunch of different ones, but decided to go for this one due to it's price. I rated this 4-stars because for $20, it does a great job, but it could be better in video quality by just a little bit. I just received it today and will be updating this review later.

Video:
First and foremost, you get what you pay for. This dashcam is not in any way HD like it says. The video quality is fairly poor, but you can still make out the things around you fine. I'd say it's probably around 360p (no higher than that). If you want to be able to read signs and license plates, then stop right here and go look for another product, because there's no way it will happen with this one. It has a pretty large view of what's in front of you because of it's fisheye lens, but it doesn't cover your whole windshield.

Product and mount:
The plastic this camera is made out of is a pretty cheap and flimsy plastic, so you have to be careful with it, but as long as you don't manhandle it, it shouldn't break. The suction cup is very sturdy and doesn't seem like it will fall off.

Audio:
This camera does record audio and fairly well for the $20 that it costs. You can hear to the backseat (if the person isn't speaking too quietly) and the radio (if it's not down too low). It is a muffled audio, but it's better than nothing. I have yet to see if it can hear from outside with the windows down.

Manual:
A lot of people's reviews on this product have been complaining thoroughly about the manual. I cannot figure out what the problem is, though. There are four pages of English in the manual and you can understand them perfectly fine. It isn't in broken English at all. There are a few spelling errors in some spots, but they aren't repeated. Just typos (ex. Pwoer = power, manu = menu, dode = mode, sysetm = system). The manual covers all of the buttons, operation instructions, and many of the menu settings - but not all. There are a few settings on camera that are not listed or explained in the manual that I cannot figure out what they do, so I have just left them on their default settings.

Menu:
The menu is very straight forward and easy to navigate through. As long as you read the instructions, you should have no problem setting up your camera. The camera has the looping feature which allows you to record in 2, 5, or 10 minute intervals. Once the card gets filled, it then rerecords over the oldest file that isn't locked.

Modes:
There are four different modes on the camera. They are as follows: record, picture, audio, and playback (where you review your videos, pictures, audio). It is easy to cycle through these and delete or lock (if you do not want them looped over).

One annoying thing aside from the quality of the video is that whenever you go over a bump, the camera rattles because the mount is not completely attached to the suction cup, so when you play it back, you can hear the rattling noise. It doesn't affect the video at all, it's just what you hear and can get a little annoying if you're out over a bunch of little bumps.

I hope this review help clear up some of the extreme reviews on both sides. It is not at all a terrible product for it's price, but it's also not amazing.

If you are looking for a dashcam that will last you years and with good video and audio, look elsewhere and do not consider this one.

If you don't want to spend much, but would still like to record what's in front of you while driving and you aren't too nitpicky about the video quality, this camera will do just fine. If you get in an accident, this camera will be all the proof you need.

title: Trial and error instead of instructions.
text:
Car charger cord is 11 feet long. USB cord is 2.5 feet.
The menu was in Chinese. It took exactly an hour for me to get it switched to English.
Turn on camera.
1) Press Menu button twice.
2) Down button once.
3) Record button once.
4) Up to English.
5) Press Record again! I missed this several times.
The instructions are less than basic. I found, if it was plugged into USB, I couldn't use the menu. So, I'd take it back out to the car to recharge. It ran out of charge in less than 2 hours. The menu will work while in car charger. Also, it can be unplugged from cig. lighter and will continue recording when plugged back in. The motion sensor setting will be lost, however. I'm getting a little radio interference on AM, but not FM. I can replay video on the camera's monitor, but not on my Chrome Book, just sound. So, I loaded it to Youtube and it worked. Pictures will come up on Chrome. The on screen instructions are as misleading as the manual. You should press Record(it functions like ENTER), most times, to select a function.
It has 1,3,5,10 min. settings for video files. Takes me about 3X the time to load (and process) to YouTube. I can tell a slight difference in video quality settings on sunny days. No pixelation on higher settings, but takes up the same megabytes. Pretty good, like other reviewers' posted videos, but not enough to read car tags. The sound recorder is very low on 6(settings 0-6). There are 3 cam modes; camera, record and files. Each one has it's own menu(s).
It stopped recording after a few days. Pressing 'format' fixed it. It drops files and/or resets if left in the sun. Even on a 80* day, parked in the sun with windows cracked, it will drop files and reset to Chinese and 10 minute files. If I take it out of the hot window when parked, it keeps the files and settings. If I park it in the shade, it'll keep the files. Cam will work w/o battery, but you'll need to reset date & time after it's been unplugged.
It does work as a good deterrent for tailgaters. They come flying up on me, figure out there's a camera there and back way off. After being followed and verbally threatened again last month, the deterrence is worth the money I paid.
Used one month, so far. Ordered another battery bl-5c. The original is just barely enough. Camera works well as long as it's kept out of direct sun while parked. Battery died 8/30/2014 after sitting in partial shade for an hour on another 90 degree day with high humidity. The battery actually started emitting a high pitched hissing sound. I pulled it out to prevent a fire. Took it inside and cooled it off, it started working again. The battery is a definite hazard.
1/16/15-6 months, still working with the replacement 'gold', high amp. battery I bought on here. LOPURS-2450mah-Capacity-Business-Battery. I had to replace charger. It wasn't making a good contact at the camera.
Most IMPORTANT, if the camera doesn't have a replaceable battery, don't buy it. I've bought 4 different cameras(2 w/replaceable batteries, 2 w/o). Every one had a weak, almost useless battery.
9/12/15-Camera still works, but I've gone through 3 Cigarette lighter adapters, one was DOA. They have bad contact points, so I bought a cig. USB adapter(5 volt, 1000 mA) and a 10 foot USB to MINI USB cable with 'gold' contacts. Stays on now.

text: For the price you cant go wrong. Cheap insurance for your car incase of an accident! Definetly made a little on the cheaper side but for the price you can't complain!

title: Garbage
text: This thing started out on a pretty good note with me. It was doing exactly what I'd bought it to do, even though the files were incredibly huge. The picture quality was decent enough, it hung from the windshield nicely and it was pretty easy to navigate the settings. However, the battery would never hold a charge from day one, so it had to be plugged in using the included car charger. I mostly used it to record my commute to and from work. After a month, it would no longer record.

title: Great for the price range, will show proof of your vehicle. Better out there.
text:
This is a great product for what the price range is. I got 20 mins of driving video today. It's recommended that you use an "ultra sd card" I use 8gb and 20 mins of driving sucked about 2.3gbs. You don't need the manuel, it can be set up quite easy with the buttons. I give it a 3/5 because this is a cheap product, but does what it should, and that is record. Video is a bit white, I was driving in the sun setting hours (4:40ish) When you get it, comes in white box (china product easily can tell). You get the power charger for the car, which plugs into the usb port never use av hole, for some reason mine has AV/hole and I used another cable I had for that. IT WILL NOT RECORD USING THE AV/OUT FOR POWER. YOU MUST USE THE USB SLOT. Not done night driving, but seen others review on it, and its 2/5 maybe. Decent to see if you get hit by someone. I didn't make any stops at lights so I couldn't tell if it picks up LP's. You can tell the make and model of the car though when you drive by.

Bottom line, if you want a cheap insureance buy this, if you want more realible spend the $100 on one. I am happy with this one, will use it till it breaks then upgrade. Ignore the haters, some products come broken from china, just replace it with amazon, you will like it for the price as well.

The video quality is actually pretty good. It would be nice to have a wider field of view since it's supposed to be a dash cam. I had been using a $300 GoPro as a dash cam, so with this inexpensive camera I won't have to worry about it so much. Using a 4 GB SD card it will do about 45 minutes. 32 GB gives about 2 hours and 40 minutes (this time will be less if you get a version of this camera that actually does shoot in 720p).  I suppose the $45 version of this camera is HD. So you will get a decent camera for $17, but it will only to 640x480.

text: Ok, so I'm looking through the long list of these Dashcams. I come across this one for 15 bucks. Lol. Are you kidding? OK, I'll try it. I love it. It works great. So easy to operate. Comes with everything including a rechargeable battery, you just supply a sd card. The suction cup is sturdy and holds. I have had no problems. I am going to buy one for my elderly mother.

title: A good investment with some flaws.....
text:
Hi. Have bought several of these cameras for my business and personal use. ALL of them in this price range have several small
problems that can usually be overlooked for the price:

1. Should power up, once you get it set , when the car TURNS ON AND OFF. You'll know in ten minutes whether or not to return it.
2. The picture quality is decent, remember you're getting evidence to implicate someone in the event of an accident.
3. Use a bead of super glue around the edge of the suction cup on your dash and it holds, even with cold or heat, usually for months.
4. Don't expect studio quality video but buy a class 10, max capacity card for a better picture.
5. IMPORTANT: Take the card OUT weekly and reformat it, the memory does fill up and reduce it's effectiveness.
6. Follow these steps and buy two or three at once for the above reasons, still an evolving technology but good for the price.

title: The price and features of this camera continue to surprise me!
text: As some other reviewers have indicated, the english translation for the user manual leaves a lot to be desired, but you get the idea.  I haven't tried recording in HD.  The SD looks plenty good for what it want out of it and takes up a lot less space on the memory card.  My only "issue" was that, while it plugs into a 12v power socket, the device itself uses 5v so I couldn't wire it directly to the car.  The easiest way for me to get the 5v was to just use the power cord that came with it.  To have a clean installation without wires showing, this meant adding another cigarette lighter-type socket under the dash.  I discovered a handy gadget at the auto parts store called "Add-a-circuit" by Littlefuse.  It made the wiring easy.  Wired to a switched circuit, I've got a "set and forget" setup because it starts recording automatically when the power comes on, then shuts down about 10-15 seconds after the power goes off.

title: Fill up your gas tank instead of wasting your money on this thing.
text: Well you get what you pay for. Wish i could give it a negative rating. The image quality is horrible..as in: The lens viewing angle is not 120 Deg, more like 90 degrees. The picture is so blurry you cannot even make out licence plate information of cars directly parked in front of you. Forget reliability, this camera's screen started to go blank randomly a week after installation. Thereafter completely refusing to power on. It was cheap but I wasn't expecting total failure within a week.

title: Not as god as expected
text: [[VIDEOID:60195e598a8732dd3861efe7bf5cd050]] I have to say that this one works better than my previous one, but the previous one took a few months to start misbehaving (turning off on it's own, freezing, and recording quality dropped like a rock at the end).  After letting the previous one sit, it seems to work a lot better.  The new one operates correctly, but the video quality is not as good as the previous one was originally.  The previous one filled about 90% of my screen (2011 15" MacBook Pro). The new one has grainy video and fills the screen about 60% of the screen.  It really does not look like 1280x960.  The video dimensions seem to match the size of a transcoded, standard def, DVD.  Check the video I've uploaded.  The first part of the video is the new cam that you are looking to purchase (sorry about the Kleenex box.  A good reason not to have anything on your dash) and the other two are from my previous cam.  The video editing ended up enlarging the poorer quality video and shrinking the higher quality one, so some imagination is probably required.  The IR is OK, just make sure your window is clean or you will see ALL of the dirt as white dots.  I've used this in the city and in the country.  The city lights help a lot and you only see what your headlights illuminate in total darkness.  I have not carried it in my hand and walked around at night though (not interested in making another Blarewitch movie) The menu on this new one is not as user friendly as it could be and the instructions were not much help being poorly translated from another language.  I've noticed that the manual seems to be taken from other models (the referencing using numbers and a diagram stops in the middle of the instructions).  This would be OK for a back cam and I think I will buy a better one (one like my previous one for about $32) for a much better quality video.  I just hope these don't stop working right after the warranty is up like my previous one.  I would really like to see these made in the USA or somewhere other than China.  The quality is a crap shoot.

title: So so
text: It works

title: Did Not Turn On
text: I followed the instructions to a "T", and the unit did not turn on.  From the reviews I am reading, it looks like a hit or miss type item.  I am going to save my pennies, and invest in a better product. Arrived this morning, shipped back to Amazon this afternoon.

title: Review includes installation instructions
text:
Update 2/19/2016 I made changes to my prior update. And after being run off the road by a driver who came up behind me fast, went around me to the left, and then cut in between me and the car in front of me and off the exit, a maneuver that caused me to go onto the shoulder of the exit to avoid a crash, I've decided to put a camera in my rear window to compliment the recordings from the front windshield.

Update 2/6/16: This particular camera had been running in my vehicle for a year without any intervention. It turns itself on when I start the car (because it is plugged into a cigarette lighter that has power only when the key is on). I had occasion this month to remove the SD card to provide the recording of an incident to police. Picture quality from the SD card on a 19" computer monitor wasn't outstanding but was pretty good. But the stunning thing was the officer said my recording was about as good as the recordings from their squad cars on cameras that cost hundreds of dollars. The biggest difference is that this camera is more "wide angle" so distant objects are smaller (but you take in more of in front of your vehicle so it shows things coming from the side which would be good in the case of a crash from the side at an intersection). And to my surprise the sound (including my comments about the incident - so watch it!) was a lot better than I originally believed it was. And I discovered that based on my driving history (I drive about 1,000 miles a month, more than half at highway speeds) a 32 Gbyte card holds a month's worth of driving. I'm upping my rating from four to five stars with a caveat - I've purchased nine of these cameras, three were defective, and two I have not installed yet. At under $20 each it is not worth returning them - especially as I had sent the defective ones (unopened) to family members out of state so shipping costs were exceeding the cost of the cameras just to find they were defective. Condition seems to depend on the seller (based on when I forwarded them), and unfortunately I cannot associate defective cameras with particular seller(s) as I didn't keep records.

Note to reviewers that complain that this camera does not record long on the built in battery. It appears the battery is intended primarily to maintain stored information. On SOME of the cameras there is a choice of whether to power solely from an external source (which I elected when offered) or from the battery. Others don't seem to offer an option. I did by accident put one camera in battery mode and it recorded for about 40 minutes while I was in a restaurant - but whether that was the cause or whether I'd done something else, the wrap-around when the card was full didn't function. I have therefore (2/19/2016) executed a "reset" and reprogrammed the camera. Based on experience when doing the programming I chose the 5 minute segments. I still would not expect the camera to function for hours on the built-in battery. But with external power it works well and even keeps pretty accurate time over months.

And one more thought (which is why I've purchased nine cameras). With a 120 V to 12V cigarette plugged adapter this would make an extremely inexpensive security camera. Now to find time to install and try out this idea.

UPDATE 6/12/2016 Have only tried one camera from Elecmall. After three weeks it is working fine.

UPDATE 9/2/2015 First the good news. Driving through a town with 10K population I saw a town owned vehicle make a dangerous maneuver. I decided to write a complaint to the police department because it was so egregious and dangerous (there'd have been a head-on crash if I had not been alert). I wrote the letter and then attempted to copy the recording of the incident from my dash cam. Watching the dash cam I saw why the vehicle had done what it did and cannot fault the driver (hit my car or a child). Tore up the letter. Convinced me these things are useful. I purchased two dash cameras from FX Victoria in response to a reviewer recommending that vendor. The two dash cams from FX Victoria are still working perfectly and producing very clear images and time stamps.

I was so pleased with the dash cams that I ordered three more, but FX Victoria was out and Amazon placed my order with Beelike.

Now the bad news. Beelike must sell reconditioned or defective dash cams. First one was bad out of the box. Second one developed fuzzy green lines before the first time I tried playing back my SD card. I tried to order three more from FX - Victoria and Amazon is listing Elecmall as the seller. As another reviewer rating the dash cams a one-star said, apparently some sellers are selling knock offs or refurbs or simply bad units returned for a refund. Be suspicious of low prices. There are huge profits to be made by selling, even for a low price, stuff that should have gone in the trash bin. I'll update later on the quality from Elecmall (for $13.50 each).

Original review with installation instructions:

Seems to be a good device for the cost. Picture is pretty clear on the device screen but I suspect it will be pretty "grainy" on a large computer monitor. Mount is reasonably rigid and suction cup holds well. 120 degree field of view is a good compromise between being so broad you can't recognize anything 25 feet in front of the vehicle and being so narrow that nothing coming from the side is not recorded prior to impact.

Caveat – I have just installed and tested this device. I have at this point no long-term experience with it.
I spent hours setting up the device. The instructions are not as bad as with some Chinese products, but are clearly a translation. After one has gone through the installation process in great detail, the instructions make a lot of sense.
In hopes of saving others a lot of time setting up the device, I will share my insights to date.
Caveat – This review is written in American English in American English (Arabic) characters. I apologize, but I am not fluent enough in any other language to express the subtleties involved in other than English.
Caveat – This device is complex. Apparently there are several variations to the basic device available and the sellers do not make it clear which variant of the device they are selling/shipping. For example, the “Features” listed for the ones I purchased stated: “Recording resolution:1280x960 / 720x480 / 640x480 pixels.” I didn’t realize that the little box above the list of features which said “Only 720P” meant I was choosing a variant that only had a single recording resolution. (The little box is similar to the boxes which appear when the product is available in a variety of colors.)
Here is what I recommend when setting up the device.
1. Plug the power cable which comes in the box with the device into the USB connection on the device under the flip-open panel on the left side, and then plug the cable into a power source on your vehicle (a cigarette lighter "plug" most likely). Allow the camera “to charge” for at least an hour (one seller recommends 2 - 3 hours) before you do anything else. Disconnect the device from the external power source. [It is easier and just as effective to unplug the end of the power cable that is not connected to the device.]
2. There are two ways to “turn on” the device. On the back there is a red (on mine) button on the left and white (on mine) button on the right. The red button is the power On /Off. Press and hold the red button for 3 seconds. The device should power up. Allow the device operate for 30 seconds. If you are going to power the device from an external source (12 or 24 volts from a vehicle via the USB connection via the supplied cable and a “cigarette lighter” plug) press the red button again to power off the device. [I have not operated the device using the internal battery, so I’m not sure how one would proceed if one planned to do so.] If you are going to power the device from an external source (a vehicle most likely) there is no need to turn the device on and off ever again using the red button. If power is on continually at your cigarette lighter plug I'd recommend unplugging the cable from the lighter plug rather than using the red power On / Off button, but I believe either approach is viable. If the power is turned off at your cigarette lighter plug when you turn your ignition key off, then the device will power up and down "automatically" when you turn your vehicle on and off.
3. Plug the power cable into the vehicle. The device should power up in the video recording mode. Fold the device’s display window down so it “hangs” below the device.
NOTE – It is important to know that the device has THREE operating MODES and FOUR MENUS. Many of the criticisms in reviews appear to result from the user not realizing this.
[The “Main Menu” which is reached by pressing MENU twice when in any mode, provides for entering such things as Date and Time, Language, “Light Frequency (50 or 60 Hz), Image format, Voice recording on / off, and most importantly “System Reset” which I presume erases all entries and “restarts” the entire system. While my manual says to reset the system by pressing a 1mm shaft gently into the “Reset Hole” I cannot find such a hole on my variant.]
4. I found it necessary at the start of the process to press the white button “to get the device’s attention.” Until I did this the device didn’t respond to any other buttons except the red button. The white button is thereafter the “Select” button which one pushes to choose a selection highlighted on a menu. On my variant the white button is labeled REC and I will hereinafter refer to it by that designation.
5. Just to familiarize yourself with the operation, press MODE (the right most button on the display screen bottom edge) three times at two second intervals. You should see each of the three operating modes. The modes are Video recording; Still image recording; and Playback. On my variant of the device these displays for the modes are labeled “Video” “Capture” and “Play” on the screen. In the first two modes the image on the screen “moves” when the camera is moved, following what the camera lens is “seeing”. In the third mode, “Play”, the image is fixed. What you see on the screen when in "Play" mode is the first frame recorded for the time segment during which recording happened. The date and time will appear on the bottom of the screen indicating when that segment, or photo, was recorded if the user selected to display date or date and time. At this point it doesn’t matter much, you will learn about this attribute when you get the device configured as you want it. The date and time are how you find the segment you wish to view, so I STRONGLY recommend you elect to display date and time during set-up. In the "Play" mode you Up / Down to the desired segment to view, choosing by looking at the first frame and the associated date or date and time. Some users in reviews have complained that the screen is “frozen” and I suspect it is because they have the device in “Play” mode but have not initiated playback of the "chosen" segment.
NOTE – If the display is not in English (the other alternatives are four languages in non-Arabic characters) proceed as follows, otherwise skip to step #6 below.
a. When in any Mode with no menu present on the screen (if there is, press MENU to remove the menu from the screen), press MENU. Press MENU again.
Press “DOWN” once. You are on the Language select line of the fourth menu. Press the REC (white on my variant) button to select Language. Up / Down to English and press the REC button to select. (On my variant English is the language at the top of the list and the word English is in English. Press MENU to exit from menus and continue as described below. If the language displayed is Chinese after doing this, repeat this step and select in turn each of the other languages listed. As there are only four languages, you ought to get English sooner or later.
6. To get to the menu for any Mode, press MENU when you in the mode for which you wish to select the attributes you desire for that mode. The types of selections the user can make for that mode are listed. Up / Down to the items you wish to set. Press the REC button to make selections. It is beyond the scope of my review to explain further how to navigate in menus. To set the date and time use Up / Down to obtain the correct digits for the various entities and REC (white button) to lock in the digits for each category of entry when it is correct (e.g. press REC after the digits for hours is correct, for example. REC is pressed for each category of the Date and Time when they are correct.
7. Put the device in each of its three modes in turn and press MENU once. This will bring up the menu for that mode. Make your selections as to how you wish the device to operate. I STRONGLY recommend that you turn Motion Activation OFF if you are using this device as a drive cam. I would only use Motion Activation if I were using the device as a security camera. I STRONGLY recommend recording in five minute segments.

NOTE: Some sellers recommend removing the lithium ion battery unless you are operating the device on battery power or are in the process of charging the battery. Those sellers say that after charging the battery can get “very hot” if it is left in place with the device powered with the external power cable. Unfortunately, in my experience, if you remove the battery you lose all the menu settings after a period of time. That makes the device pretty useless for me. I’m not going to enter all the settings each time I drive my vehicles; I want the camera to come on when I turn on the key and shut off when I turn off the key. HOWEVER, as the device is exposed to the hot sun by being in the windshield, I have covered the top of the device with aluminum foil to reduce heat absorption. Several reviewers have complained the battery compartment cover has warped in the sun. This may be a fatal flaw in the design for devices used in hot climates.

I will update this review in the coming weeks or months as I gain experience with the device.

One reviewer recommended not using more than a 16 gig card because otherwise there are too many segments to sort through. My opinion is that most of the time you are going to want to access a recent segment so having stored many is not an issue as they are accessed in date order with the most recent last. And if there is an issue about something that happened several days or weeks ago, the bigger the card the more likely you can at least find a recording of the event. Another reviewer recommended recording one minute segments. If the quantity of segments to search through is an issue, having a segment for every minute of recording would maximize the number of segments to be handled. Some reviewers complain about lines on the screen. My unit had what looked like thick blue thread or felt tip pen doodling on the screen. The lines turned out to be on the protective film. The film is not easy to get off. Peel it up carefully with a pointed tooth pick.

title: Dash Cam inteferes with wireless locking system...
text: Camera and DVR work but I needed to figure it out on my own.  The instructions are useless.  The higher the resolution you set, the fewer files record.  Now this is the important part.  The shielding is so bad, it interferes with your wireless key fob.  In my case (Ford)  When the unit is left on with the internal battery or plugged into the lighter plug, the range to lock / unlock the doors  is reduced. I needed to put the key fob (with new batteries) up against the window to get the actuators to work.  Tested a number of times and arrived at the same results. If the camera is in the vehicle and on,  the lock system does not respond.  Turning it off and removing it from the car restored the  car's locking system and wireless key to normal operations.

title: 98% Happy
text:
Ordered 8 of these for multiple cars and home surveillance. It works great! A couple negatives:
1) 8 ordered and 3 had the wrong USB charging cords. (Were micro-usb instead of the mini-usb needed.) Luckily, I ordered 8 so was able to interchange for initial charge up.
2) The included battery is rather weak, runs out quickly so I have these plugged in constantly in order to maintain recording. This is the 2% unhappy vote. Would like the battery to last as long as a phone battery at least. I think they are just old, but I'm not willing to purchase new ones yet to test.
3) Instructions were awful, but a previous commenter included his version of instructions which helped tremendously.
As of now, two house windows (motion detection) and 3 cars are in business and recording. Happy customer!

title: Worth It
text: Note: My reviews reflect the "value" of a product as it relates to cost. This item was shipped and delivered extremely fast for standard shipping, ordered on Monday received it Thursday. thank you Amazon and UPS. The camera was packaged as well as any other electronic device that I have ever purchased online, with maybe the exception of Apple Products which tend to be pricey (and worth it) so they can afford a little extra luxo packaging. The camera was obviously brand new out of the box with all accessories included. Note: the 12v automotive power plug-in connects to the camera via the usb port, some pictures showed the plug as having a standard power plug. The camera has a port for a standard power supply plug but I guess there is no need for it. Be sure to remove the protective shipping film from the screen and the tape from over the battery terminals before you complain about a dirty scratched screen or non functioning battery. I used a 120v USB power supply (available cheap from Amazon) to power and charge the camera in my home. I took videos at various settings out my front window. I prefer the 720p setting as it seems to provide more of a widescreen closeup but with the same field of view as the 640 setting which yields a 4:3 ratio like an old TV. There did not seem to be any difference between the 1080p and 720p setting. The video quality is more than adequate for it's intended use. The microphone is very sensitive producing clear audio and can be turned off. The complaints in other reviews about the instructions are valid. The important thing to remember is that you must use the Video Record button along with the menu and up down buttons and finish each setting by pressing the Video Record button before exiting settings. I purchased a Transcend 32GB class 10 SD card with the camera and it slipped right in and worked perfectly with no formatting needed. Connecting the camera via the supplied USB cable allowed me to view the .avi videos on my computer as well as save, edit and or delete them. As for the overall quality of the unit, I see no area to fault. Yes it is light weight plastic but do you really want a heavy plastic brick attached to your windshield. The case provides adequate protection for the electronics and how it feels in your hand should not be a concern, as if it were a phone or a razor. I have not tried the camera in a vehicle yet, but my experience with Radar Detectors leads me to conclude that the hefty windshield mount should be up to the task. I will update this review as I gain experience with the unit, but for now and for the price, Five Stars. Update 01/25/15: The night vision LED's only work at close range, I moved the camera around a totally dark room and objects had to be only a few feet away be visible on the screen. It would be best to leave them off for night driving and rely on ambient light from street lamps, vehicles etc. I did not expect much from the IR LED's so it does not change my rating and I doubt some of the more expensive cameras are any better.

title: Comically horrible
text:
This camera is like the movie 'plan 9 from outerspace' it's so horrible you can't help but laugh.

Now for those who think I'm just being overly picky for the price: I didn't expect 720p (honestly, it looks like maybe 160p at best - I think a first generation Motorola Razr could have out performed it) so I wasn't worried about that (I noted that from previous reviews) The audio recording was terrible, but again I knew that from other reviews (and the $14 price) However....

The part I didn't expect to fail was the primary reason for having it: recording. For the two hours it worked, it did its job: $14 is a cheap insurance policy to simply prove liability at the very least (even if it can't see faces or licence plates) but thereafter it said "No SD card" tried taking it out, replacing etc, resetting, formatting etc. No good.

It's $14, so I really don't think I'm going to bother returning it (The effort to repackage and ship the thing back would cost me more in time than its worth)

Save your money - put it towards a better rated unit in the $40-60 range.

UPDATE: I decided to run an older SD card and it started recording again. I used it for a few days without anything to write home about. However, today it was about 90 degrees out and when I went to go for a drive the camera went was recording just pitch-black nothing (sound only) as the car became cooler, the screen started to show multicolored lines and got progressively 'better' (better being a very generous word)

UPDATE 2: After deciding to dissect this horrid abortion of the lowest Chinese-built technology, I discovered the lens was factory set out of focus - WAY out of focus. After fixing that issue and putting it back together I will say you can actually see things quite a bit sharper (IE a car looks less like a blob) but the video quality is still awful.

Final notes: The battery for this unit is the same one that I used for my Sylvania SP234 Bluetooth speaker, so I can't bitch about having a spare battery for it .

Overall; for $14 I got a spare battery for my speaker, a really good 10ft USB car charger (great for my GPS!), a decent windshield mount for a future purchase of a better dash cam and quite a bit of fun taking it apart and harvesting parts off of it.

title: You get what you pay for.
text:
The old saying rings true in this case. I got exactly what I expected when I made this purchase: a cheap knock off Chinese refurbished piece of crap. But it works. I can see how other reviewers have had issues with their camera not working out of the box; I got lucky and mine worked fine.

I installed a 16gb SD card, ran the (super long) cable down to the power outlet and started recording. I've had it installed for a couple of months now, and the few times I've checked it is working like a charm. I have complete faith in the suction mount as it hasn't budged since I installed it. The video quality is exactly what you should expect when you're spending 25 bucks on a camera: it's not great, but it's good enough.

If you're being realistic with your expectations, I think you'll love this camera. I often forget it's there, but when I do remember I enjoy the peace of mind it brings.

title: VGA only camera
text:
I received and tested the device, I think I can use it.
It is essentially a VGA still/video camera with DVR capabilities. All other capture and recording modes/resolutions are made out of the original VGA image using in-camera software processing. You will not get any improvement in regards to image quality if you choose to capture 1.3M, 2M or 3 Mpixel image or record it in 720P or higher. Here, look at the attached image below. On the left is a fragment cut from 3MP still image captured using the camera (no resizing, other than the crop). On the right is the same fragment cut from a VGA capture and then resized to match the size of the fragment on the left. There is little of no difference in quality between two. So this is it. Do not use higher capture/recording resolutions, just use VGA. I would recommend using low saturation and low sharpness settings. By doing so, for this particular device, you preserve more details. You can always improve image on the computer if you have to. I am going to use it as VGA video/still camera for my 2003 Civic. For the price (under $12 at the moment) it is adequate.

UPDATE from 05/2016: I received the 2nd device, from different Amazon seller (from Dcolor(R)) and it was defective. So my final verdict: better stay away from this.

title: PERFECT for the PRICE
text:
Exactly what I was looking for. Why I'm satisfied (by importance): 1) captures my driving, day or night, as a record of whether or not I was in the right in the event of an accident. 2) captures audio for possible interactions with other drivers or highway patrol. 3) cheap enough that I'm not worried about it getting stolen.

As another reviewer commented, I'm not looking for wedding-quality picture. I could spend a couple hundred dollars for better picture quality, but the likelihood of needing every person's license plate as they pass by me is too minimal for me to shell out the money and worry about it getting stolen.

Like a few other reviewers, I was unlucky enough to have the camera arrive with the language preset to Russian. However, I followed the directions in the manual and I figured out in about 2-3 minutes how to change the language.

I keep it on 15-minute recordings at the highest quality and I get roughly 2-3 hours of video on an 8g card. My commute is 1hr so that is plenty, but carrying a spare just in case is a good idea.

In 6 months, the best thing I captured was having a car entering onto the freeway at about 40mph. She crossed a double white line right in front of me and I came within 6" of rear-ending her. Luckily no accident, but if I did hit her, without the camera it would have looked a helluvalot like my fault.

I've also captured someone turning left infront of me in town, as well as a minivan plowing into a commuter car on the freeway.

text:
If you think less then $20 for a DashCam is too good to be true, then it is...

I have brought this DashCam for less then $20, and i have been using this every weekend going to my girlfriend house (3hr Drive), after a month of use, the camera component start to die out, i keep getting a fussing green lines everywhere, i thought it was maybe the component were too cold due to cold temperature, but once i let it get into a warmer temperature, the camera would still not work.

I did some research and come to find out that Amazon Market Place Seller sells alot of cheap and knock off item especially this dashcam.

The Original model are called DVR-027, (Updated version are now call DVR-207GS), they are in a same plastic case but with better and higher quality and original component. Also... they dont come cheap, the cheapest price can range $65 or more for the real one

Buyer beware, i learn my lesson buying cheap knock-off item, if you looking for a Dashcam for your Car, please spend few extra dollar to buy the real one, you will not regret it.

Customer Image show Comparison between a $20 one vs $70 one, and you'll see the different, please use those for your reference and decide your purchasing needs

You get what you pay for

text:

Apparently the suction cup and mount/stand cannot endure the 117+ degree weather of the Las Vegas summer, which is a disappointment because the device definitely looked RUGGED. Even before I had problems like that, I noticed that the sunction cup sometimes popped off my windshield, or the joints often became loose on their own and the camera setup swung back and forth wildly as I am driving, like a pendulum clock. I had to keep tightening the screws composed of cheap plastic.

When I took the memory card out of the device and reviewed it on my computer, I realized that the picture quality is terrible! I couldn't even make out the details of the vehicles cutting me off or driving drunk in front of me. The license plates are grainy and illegible. At night, everything looked like a bunch of red and yellow flashlights as people pulled in front of me.

There were these three morons that are jaywalking in front of 45+ MPH traffic down here in Vegas, my camera caught them in action but as I reviewed the video I noticed that all I can see are their fancy white shoes reflected from my car's headlights.

Then, sun damage caused the suction cup to deform itself somehow and now it no longer creates the vacuum required for it to stay on my windshield.

title: Good value but only fair quality
text:
I ordered two of these units as I wanted to have both a rear and a front facing camera. After having used them for a few days I have a few comments. Both my units look the same externally but operate differently. The buttons light up different colors and one blinks in record and one is solid in record. The menu/options are quite different between the two units. The sound quality is very different as one is very clear and the other one has much noise. If other comments or instructions in these reviews don't work for you it may be you have a different version of software. After playing with the various menues I have gotten both units to work. They go into record as soon as I give them power and continue to record over files until you stop the unit. A 16GB SD card gives me around 4 hours of recording. While I can't read plate numbers while at highway speed I also have these units on when my car is parked. Other cars parking in front or behind me can have their plates read quite clearly. In parking spots is where alot of my damage occurs so this is just what I was looking for! If you want plate numbers to be recorded on the highway I would just speak them loudly so they are recorded on the audio part of the videos. The same with a description of the other driver or any other info. I did notice with both units that they can lockup or get distorted displays. You have to slide off the top cover and remove the battery to reset them at that point.

The overall quality of these units is fair to poor, but I paid a total of $46 for two including shipping! I have an HD Sony camcorder that I use on the road when I want a top quality recording but these units are set and forget. They will capture that unexpected accident when someone cuts you off and then jams on the brakes. Rear end collisions are almost always the fault of the guy in back. Also a good insurance scam. If you could show that the other driver jumped in front of you and slammed his brakes on for no reason then you just more than paid for the cost of these units. If you want something that works great straight out of the box and has customer support then pay for a more expensive unit. These don't even have a model # or manufacturers name on them!

title: I'd like to address a few of the things that have ...
text:
This is a 3 star product that gets a 4th star for the price (Bumped down to 3 afterall. See that "Product Inconsistency" portion of my review for update.). I'd like to address a few of the things that have been brought up in other reviews.

- Documentation: There are a lot of complaints about the terrible instructions that come with the camera. I won't say that these reviewers are wrong, but to be honest, I never needed them. The menus are intuitive, and simple to navigate. The only thing that's a bit unorthodox is that the "record" button serves as the "select" button when in the menus. It took me no more than 5 minutes to navigate all the menus and set everything the way I wanted.

- Build quality: It's exactly what I expected for the price (which isn't great). It feels flimsy in your hands, and it IS NOT heat resistant. To be fair, I was testing it in the middle of Texas summer, so we're talking extreme heat. With that said, after a few hours in the car, some of the plastic body was warped and, although it would turn on, the camera would not send any signal to the screen. 15 mins in the fridge and it was working fine again. Lesson learned, I'll just take it inside whenever not in use.

- Video quality: Not excellent, but not bad either. There are plenty of reviews here with video samples, and they are accurate representations of the video you get.

- Audio quality: Like the video, it's nothing special, but it's there. As other reviewers have said, there is often a significant amount of feedback from inferior/unshielded electronic components.

- Product inconsistency: I ordered two of these at the same time for each of my cars. While they are largely the same, there are differences between them. The packaging, camera function, and menu navigation all appear the same. One of them has what appears to be an A/C charging port on the side, and the other one has a 3.5mm AUX output jack in that hole. The startup and shutdown images are different for each, as are the startup and shutdown sounds. **Update** After having used these slightly more, I will say there are significant differences between the two cameras, enough that I really only use one of them, and keep the other as a backup. The "worse" of the two has really poor brightness/contrast on the recordings to where you almost can't make things out, even in full daylight. The other major difference is the frame-rate. Again, the "worse" of the two seems to be at maybe 15fps making the video pretty jittery. The better one seems much closer to a typical 30 fps. One minor difference worth noting is that the menus of the worse one are also not as clear. They navigate the same way, but the function of each setting isn't very obvious.

- Mounting bracket: Suction cup works GREAT. There have been a few people that have said that the ball joint won't hold the camera in place after you've messed with it too much. I experienced a similar issue, but then found that there is an adjustment nut that you can tighten down on the ball. I don't feel comfortable making it super tight for fear of it stripping out, but just snugging it down was enough to hold the camera still.

- IR "Night" mode: It's stupid that they included this. The little IR LEDs on the front will not project any further than the middle of your hood.

Anyone who has given these a poor rating either received a defective product or they're delusional about what $15 will buy. Build quality is horrible, but they work as advertised. I probably won't buy more of these once they stop working, but if you're like me and you're on the fence about owning a dash cam, these are a perfect way to get your feet wet and decide if you want to invest in a better one.

title: Junk pixelated images - blurry - cannot see license plate of other vehicles unless super close
text:
I was hoping that this HD DVR dashboard camcorder would be a huge upgrade to the small puny dashboard digital DVR camera I have purchased online three years ago. Nope. It looks like a great video camera on the outside, because it is equipped with infrared light, and has a flip screen to preview/review the movies that you've recorded with this DVR. On the small flip screen, the movie files or pictures taken, look nice and nearly clear. HOWEVER...the bad part is where you view your video clips on your PC. When I view my movie videos with Windows Player, the whole thing is super blurry, the traffic light looks hazy, and you definitely cannot see the other driver's license plate without have to be approximately 3 feet away from the front vehicle.

My Samsung Galaxy smart phone shoots way better quality pictures and crystal clear movie files than this so-called "HD" DVR. It's not way near HD quality.

Another pet peeve about this DVR is that I have had LOTS and LOTS of trouble accessing the files on this DVR to my computer. I thought that I could simply connect the USB cord from the DVR to my computer. sometimes....no problems. But most of the time, my computer would give me an error message where there is no device software to view my video files, or the "portable device" would not show up under MY Computer icon.

Overall, it's too late for me to return this DVR. However, for those of you who are shopping around for a GREAT quality dashboard camera......DO NOT get this product!

title: Adequate
text:
This review is for the 2.5" 20 buck model.

It is not HD or even SuperVGA, just 640x480. You cannot read license plates, unless you drive your windshield into one. It is not 120 degrees/wide-angle, I measured it and it is exactly 60 degrees. It is nearly useless at night, showing only the bright points. It does handle bright Sun directly in view well. The IR LED's are only useful if used off vehicle for house sentry duty at short range.

Despite all that, with a cheap Transcend 16GB card it has recorded in my car for 8 months, 2-3 hours per work day, without fail. The suction cup has only fallen off twice in the very hottest of weather. Not bad for the money.

I live in a city with about 400,000 people so the streets are decently lit on main routes and you can barely see anything on this.  Absolutely worth the buy for daytime driving.  Good note:  It would NOT work memory wise until I was using something LARGER than 8GB SD.  I always made sure the mount was sturdy and not going to slide.  However, when I had an accident rear-ending someone at about 40 MPH with them slowing down for a stoplight, this thing went flying off the mount hook (the suction cup still on the windshield) and broke in half ruining the SD card.  I had no video.  I would not buy again (and haven't).

title: What do you expect?
text:
For the price, it's a decent dash cam. It would work for proving innocence in a courtroom or to an insurance company, which is what matters here. Yes, it would be terrible for broadcast but, it's not made for that, is it? Night time video in the city was better than I expected, which is a plus. Overall, the video quality is VGA and a bit fuzzy. You won't make out plates on it but, you will be able to see cars clearly and hear everything (microphone is pretty decent). Build quality is alright but, I would be careful with it. My unit seems to work great but, it wouldn't surprise me if quality control varies widely across these units.

One feature that I do like is how it turns on and off automatically with the car's ignition. This does depend on your vehicle however. On my Volvo, power to the outlet is cut when the ignition is turned off, so the camera uses it's internal battery to shut down after I remove my key. On cars that maintain power to the outlet after the key is removed, you would have to manually pull the power adapter every time, which would get old.

title: Great
text: I got my first one from another site 3 months ago. After that I have gotten about 20 more from Amazon. I have read a lot of reviews and see that a lot of people don;t know how to use them right. First of all the screens are not cracked, what looks like a crack is a tab to pull off the screen protector, and the lines and  fingerprints that you see are on the screen protector. To get into the menu turn it on and click menu button before it starts to record, menu comes up with 5 choices, click mode it comes up with 5 more choices, if you click down 6 times it will give you 5 more choices from the menu, click down 6 more times it will come to 2 more choices, click menu to clear out of the menu mode. Once you do it a few times you get the hang of it. The ok or record button is the one next to the power button.  I have not seen this in any of the instruction booklets, if you click the up button when it is recording it will zoom up the picture, make it bigger. All of the ones that I have, have a great picture good and clear. Some have said they are a cheep plastic piece of junk but I have not found them to be so, I have had Electronic stores for over 35 years they look to be well made to me. The chargers on all of them suck, I bought chargers and 1020 mah battery from another auction site if you look you can get a charger and 2 battery for $7.59 free shipping, I now have 10 extra battery. Also I see in some of the reviews that some of you are having trouble with the cards staying in, you have to push them in untill they click in. I only buy from the ones filled and shipped by Amazon. I have gotten a bad one or two and can not say enough about customer care, if I had to rate them on a scale of one to a ten, it would be a 15. there customer care is that great. Harry

title: Great! High quality, Adjustable settings, Easy installation
text:
This is absolutely a great purchase! I purchased this unit because I've had so many near-miss accidents caused by reckless drivers and want to protect myself with evidence if ever somebody else hits me. This unit is very compact, lightweight, and easy to install on your windshield. The mounting unit that comes with it is multi-adjustable and actually holds its suction. I have mine set to turn on and off with the ignition and write over older video if the memory card is full. A 4GB SD card will hold about 25 minutes of highest-quality video, but much more when set to standard or med-high qualities. No problems going over bumps or potholes while recording. The infrared lights work, but mostly at close range. The extra-long power cord easily fits behind the ceiling and door frames. Total installation took me about 25 minutes. Overall I am VERY satisfied! The only reason I gave 4 instead of 5 stars is that the video quality, though very good by my standards, could be just slightly better.

Want to see how it records for yourself? Here's a sample video I took during my commute through Providence, RI:
[...]

title: great quality video and working great
text:
This is a great product for anyone that has the need to record when driving. This product comes with main unit, and car charger. The wire is long enough so that you can tug it along the top of your visors and down along the door. Unit itself comes with english language when I power it on for the first time. I don't have to change anything other than the time. It allow you to change the time and the recording quality. I didnt' set it too high but just th regular 640x480 was sufficient for viewing. It does not come with the sd card just to let buyer aware so you neeed to get one, it's fairly cheap now aday for a 32gb.

after mounting this unit which does comes with the suction mounting that works very well. It can twist and turns to the desire direction that you can mount near your rearview mirror or you can mount on your dash if you like. As for the video, it is great. Some people may say that it's not able to see licence plate but It i think otherwise. You can see licence plate very well and clear. The picture is very clear with the recording set at 640x480. Although the audio is a little muffled. I wouldn't totally rely on it but it does work and you can hear people talking in the car but for outside audio it will be a little hard to hear.

I think for the price you can't really go wrong with this product. The seller is very prompt with shipping as well so I see no reason why you would have any problem.

title: Cheap, defaults to Russian menus.
text:
To start off, the dashboard camera came up in Russian. I had to use Google Goggles on my phone to translate the menus until I could set it to English.

It also seems to lock up from time to time and stop recording. Removing the battery and reinstalling it fixes it.
I guess it's ok for the $20 I spent. It will record continuously in up to 15 minute segments where it automatically starts the next segment.

I can't tell that night mode does anything. It records rather poorly in low light.

title: Defective
text: It lasted a few min on my desk,  I tested it to make sure it was working before I installed it.  It did work but after a few recordings it began to get really hot.  The smell of burning components was obvious.  The SD card I bought for it was okay and I could still use it in my camera.  I really wanted another one because this thing was so cool but Amazon refunded my money.  The didn't offer a replacement.  Maybe they were out of stock.  Amazon has always been very good about any Items that I have problems with.  A friend of mine bought the same unit and his is still working fine.  These types of products are super cheap and some of them will just be bad.  I will probably order another one just like this one unless something better comes out later.  They are always getting better and cheaper.

title: Was a Great Camera if you get the right one

6/18/2012 Update Changed from 5 to 2 stars. Bought the second dash cam for my other car and got a different camera, looks the same but has different menu options and the power adapter is different. With this one the date is not saved, I find myself to always have to update the date. The first camera still works great. Good luck when you order, you might get what you order, you may not....

title: Surprising good.
text: For the price, it is a very good buy. Whenever I have long distance driving to do, I set it up and get it going. Have the unit now for almost a year and haven't had any problems with it. For night time I use a different setting and it's not too bad; but keep in mind this is not technically made for night vision viewing. For average everyday usage I find it perfect, works well, and didn't make a dent to my wallet.

title: A Good Value
text:
I bought two of these cameras. I mounted one on the windshield and one in the back glass to record driver's behind me (it recorded a driver who rear ended me while they were on their cell phone). The video quality is best set to 640x480. There are other products that are available at higher prices, but with these I do not have to worry about my device being stolen if I valet my car.

The camera comes with a suction cup mount, battery and 12vpower cable.

If you are looking for GoPro quality this isn't for you. This dash camera allows you to supplement your statement to law enforcement or your insurance company and it does that well.

title: Not dependable
text:
As noted in other reviews, the instruction manual seems useless other than to describe the buttons and their functions.
I bought two units and neither one is reliable enough to count on to properly record events. Sometimes the unit will go straight to record when turned on. Other times I am unable to get the unit to record no matter what buttons are pushed.
Even when I am able to get the unit to start recording, after a cycle or two it stops recording. Sometimes it just shuts off.
I was hoping for a unit that I could just turn on and it would loop record. Neither of these units will do that reliably.

title: Awesome camera for the price**
text: Considering how cheap this camera is, you can't beat it. No, the video is NOT true 1080, nor is it true 720. This is a 480 camera that upscales. However, unless you want to pay twice as much or more for a camera, you're not going to get HD quality. No, the seller doesn't always ship the same model as pictured. Yes, it's still the same camera. I recommend that as soon as you receive this camera, you go try it out and make sure that all the buttons work and that it records in intervals properly. I receive a bad one the first time. Replaced quickly and the second one, although a different model, worked fine. You probably can't see a license plate with camera, but what you can do is enable it to record audio and then you just say the plate aloud. Don't bother trying to use the "night vision" leds, they're crap.

That little device exceeded my expectations. I could be driving fifteen miles over the speed limit and some folks (yes, I know that I'm foolish too) will try to pass me, at times almost hitting me, some of them pass me in no passing zones and pull back in so quickly that if I didn't take precautions they'd hit me.

Having video PROOF in the event I ever do get hit will prove who hit whom. The vendor for it to me gadget than promised. Count me happy!

title: does it's job.
text:
I am a truck driver and recently a man accused me of running over his dog,I did not however it did convince me of trying a dash cam.I bought this one because of price to try as a trial.To my surprise it does a lot more than I imagined.I stuck it on my windshield up in the high middle and plugged it in to the cig lighter.2 weeks went by and a window tinting car cut me off in traffic.If you go to my youtube you can see how awesome this cam is....PLUS the vid on youtube is my phone recording off my laptop...I'm not smart enough and have not the software to edit videos.The programming is a little funky on the cam,like setting the time and date,but if you play with it for awhile you will figure it out.The micro speaker play back is scratchy until you play back on your computer and as you can hear it is very adequate.I put a 2 g mem. card in and carry a spare now in case I need to save something...it's worth it! This cam far and above does what I need.I already have saved vids of 2 more close calls,just in case.Go to youtube and look me up unitruth ,the vid is "cut off by window tinting car 40 mph evansville IN." [...] see for yourself.The audio is crappy on the cam but once plugged in or memory card inserted in laptop you can hear the audio great!
As of this update 3-2-16 it's still going!
I bought a 2nd one but the power cord to the cig lighter fried so now I have an extra cam in case the first one dies.

title: more than expected
text: I got this after seeing the identical looking unit in a truckstop for $100 after using this i was very pleased i got a 32g card for it and can record the previous 7-8 hours of driving for review and if anything i want to keep happens i can quickly swap cards and keep going.  the only downside is the night recording. if you have some light it works great.  if you need to us it in very dark situations it is only as good as the ir leds so 20-30 ft and narrow viewing like the beam of a flashlight.  but greato monitor your truck while at a truckstop or rest area at night. Great product

title: Not bad for the money
text: I've been using one of these for about a year now and bought another as a spare.  Not true HD imagery, it interpolates the pixel count up from a lower native resolution but it's been reliable and is good enough to provide evidence in an accident unless it occurs during the ~3 second lag between recording segments  The IR LEDs are utterly useless and should be taped over so you don't inadvertently leave them on and obliterate your view with their reflection from your windshield.  Recently tried the Vivitar DVR787 action camera which has a dashcam  mode.  It's a bit more money but it provides true 1080HD imagery (you can actually read license plates at a reasonable distance) and there is no lag between recorded segments.

title: Five Stars

title: Dont waste money

title: Not to shabby!
text:
This dash cam does fit the saying: "you get what you pay for".Its a cheap, lightweight, plastic camera, with a corny start up screen from China that works...well Great! For the price that is.

The video quality really is not that bad, and is about the quality that an old smartphone about 10 years old would capture. Semi grainy of the field of view if not to bad. It mounts sturdy enough to stick onto my windshield and the rotating mount is tight enough so the camera itself does not move on sharp turns. I have it set up so when you turn your car on, it immediately starts recording, and when you shut your car off, the camera turns off. This can be achieved by just taking the battery out and plugging it into a car charger instead.

As an almost 16 year old brand new driver, this camera might come in handy if I ever do get into an accident.

title: Terrible Video Quality. Would Not Recommend.
text: This is a terribly regretable purchase. Bought based on the quality of the uploaded film. However, mine is s***. Even on the highest quality it records worse that an old phone I have. It cannot do 1080p and I'm not even sure if it can even do VGA to the quality of a six year old phone.

title: Five Stars
text: Works great. Occasionally you have to tighten it but other than that works excellent.

title: One Star

title: For this price, it does what it's supposed to
text:
If you can... purchase a few models up, but not a lot of models up. Being something that will ultimately be used only in the event of an accident or something, it doesn't need to be quality of a GoPro. However, picture quality is very poor.... and it's large, and the mount never sticks.

The quality I was looking for, was the ability to read license plates. Even at a stop / slow speeds this is really feasible. Video also studders slightly on my Class 10 16GB SD.

I haven't replaced it, however I may in the future. It will provide evidence in the event of something.... which in the end is all I was looking for. Obviously the price is impressive... and it's amazing we can make stuff like this and sell across the world for so cheap, however I would not of minded paying double the price for a slightly higher quality device. Worth the shot though... will move this unit to another car and purchase something else possibly.

title: Order 2 cameras. One was great, the second not so much.
text:
I bought 2 of this cameras they arrived pretty fast. I turned them on, the menus are in English, very easy to navigate even though I didn't need it my instructions came in English.
One of the cameras has amazing resolution, yes AMMAZING! I played some videos on my laptop and they are pretty HD. I thought I was going to be some kind of cheap look, but I can clearly see the license plates in front of my car. The night vision is also great, very neat image. The motion sensor works perfectly, I've tried it so many times in different situation and it always activates.
The second camera however it's not so good, the image is... uhm... ok, no matter what resolution I choose it's somewhat poor. The IRL does not work, I can't see anything when it's activated at night so it's a waste of space. I've tried a lot of settings but it just doesn't work at night or in little light situations, so when it's afternoon it's basically dead.
I've tried both cameras with 8 and 16GB SD and MicroSD class 10 cards, the SD works great very smooth and great video quatily. The micro SD makes cuts on the videos and freezes sometimes but in my case it's a cheaper solution because in my country the SD cards are extremely expensive.
I'm giving one camera a 5stars rating and the other a 2stars because it's a pain not having it work after 5pm

title: Works but not well
text:
When it records the video is pretty good. But most of the videos just won't play on the computer or on the unit.

The IR leds are pretty much useless. They only throw about a foot.

It looks just like the good version of this camera but its a knockoff and not a good one.

For less than $20 it was worth a shot but your chances of getting what you want on video are about 1 in 100.

title: Works well.  Great for the price.
text:
The setup is easy. The mounting works great on the windshield. The display can be set to turn off after 1,3,10 minutes, or stay on all the time. I have it set for 1 min, just so I can confirm that everything is working properly. The image is good, but even at HD, I couldn't read a license plate unless the car was backing into me. But overall, it does a great job of recording in case you get an accident, or a run-in with the police. The price is excellent. I have a 16GB drive and it records a whole week's work of driving.

Added 11/25:
I bought a second camera for my wife's car. The price was actually a little lower. The operation is different. The settings menus are reduced and there are even fewer instructions. In the original camera, there was a slow-blink, blue led to show you that is is recording. The new one just has a solid-on, red led. The newer one says it will do 1280 resolution. The older one only said it would do 720. I don't know why that would be different.
The power connection is different. It comes with a car adapter to USB cable to power it. The older one has a separate barrel DC connector for power, which is nice, because it's smaller and right angle. The new one is straight and sticks out to the side pretty far.

I'm still happy with it. It works well, and the price is great.

title: Hard to beat for the money
text: After seeing several clips on the news caught on dash cams, I thought I would try one out.  Not knowing if I would really use it, I didn't want to spend a lot.  I don't think you can beat this camera for the money.  Easy to install.  Comes with the mounting accessory which is not explained in the description.  I learned that from another rating.  I am going to buy another one for my wife's vehicle.

title: Waste of time.  No market for this in the $15 range
text:
I got what you paid for. $15 was too good to be true. What I got was a camera that only recorded VGA (640x480 resolution) and had allot of issues that pretty much everyone else here has described. It didn't want to read most of my SD cards. There are allot of fake dash cameras and this was one of them. Packed it up for a refund the very next day. If you are looking to get a good bang for the buck dash camera, look for the G1W cameras for about ~$50 range.

There is simply no market for this in the $15 range. I should have known better.

title: You Get What You Paid For
text: First off, this dash cam recorder does record, and it works well for what it is supposed to do. But at this price you aren't getting real HD, even though it says so in the title of the device and on the box it comes with. Also, you must know that it will not recognize any SD card higher (if there are any higher) than 32 Gigs. I tried different kinds of 64gig SD Cards and none would work, only my 32 gig cards. The device feels a bit cheap, at least the plastic it's made of does. And the screen seems a little cheap too, but again.. for the price I would say it's reasonable. If you need a dash cam and are very VERY limited in funds, this one isn't THAT bad. It does record and it does it okay. The video quality isn't amazing or pretty good, but you can see everything and make out stuff (honestly, its okay).. although at night, don't even try to have it recording as you won't see almost anything at all. It has infrared lights but they don't do much. At least not on the device I purchased. The one good thing that I liked was the car charger and it's cable.. it's LONG, and I was able to run it inside the car's interior panels and what not to power it up by my rear view mirror. I wouldn't recommend this if you are able to afford a good Dash cam, those that are way up there in price. Like a Top Dawg HD DVR Dash Cam or something similar, which costs about $120 I think. In any case, like I said. If you need one, and are low low in funds, this one should do the job.. although poorly, it will record what you need it to record. If you can put down a little over a hundred bucks, look for one that has good ratings, as I think they'll work far better than this one.

title: Great price for low quality video
text:
[[VIDEOID:f7f95396c00798a27f0fece7079cba67]] This is a great price DVR among other similar products in the market. Video quality is as the price been paid ($36.95). Just notice that it is not wide angle Lens after 1st try out. It has only 75-80 degree view. Don't mention IR function. It only works within couple feet but a great feature for ghost hunting or looking for UFO while driving. Using 1280x960 video mode to record video has not much different from lower pixels quality. Not much can complain with this great price. I will add one more star two weeks later if it has not broken down as other reviewer mentioned. Add to three stars when it survives the 1st month. Add to five stars if 6 months later it is still working. That will be a great deal as 5 bucks/month rent. Hope that will be the case.

* an update * So far it works almost two weeks. It's been upgraded to two stars now ! :-)
* 2nd update * It will meet one month milestone next week. It's been upgraded to three stars.
* 3rd update * I add one more star because it is still working OK since March, 2012. One of my two DVRs has sometimes frozen and do nothing for recoding. Just simply unplug power to reset, then it will work OK again. I'll add one more star to five if it lasts until next month.
* last update: FIVE Stars !! @ 11/3/2012..It is still working great except the suction cup no longer function due to Sun UV damage. Highly recommend this product to friends. Now it is even cheaper !

text:

Right out of the box the charger cord has a USB connector and "seems" to be charging the battery despite the instructions and the item pic identifying the charge port on the other side where there is a hole but it's marked AV in/out with nothing in the hole!! The recording light never does blink, indicating it's recording. Only clue is that the counter is counting soooo.

text:
