I have only had the camera for a few days and am still learning about it, but here is what I've found so far. The instructions are nearly hopeless. They obviously were written in another language and then translated to English. (And several other languages.) I find the settings on the device to not be very intuitive, but as I keep playing with it, I'm slowly getting it to work like I want it to. I still have not managed to get it to do loop recordings, even though it indicates that I have that feature turned on. The video quality is pretty good, but vehicle vibration makes the picture Pretty shaky sometimes. Overall, I feel that once I get the loop recording feature figured out, I'll be pretty happy with the camera.

4/4/2013 - OK, I give up! I still can't get the loop recording to work. See my comments below. I have reduced my rating to one star from the 4 stars I'd given it earlier.

title: So far, an excellent item for the price
text: I was in the market for a cheap DVR and the price fit the bill. Reluctant because of some reviews I held off and kept it on my wish list. I wasn't satisfied reading some folks got a product that only had Chinese menus, some got a product that quit working after 5 minutes of use, some got a product that was D.O.A. Well, then I read the reviews of folks who seemed to get a good model with English menus and was fully functional and recorded beautifully. For my birthday I was given a 25 dollar Amazon gift card and this was the first thing that came to mind (mind you, I was still very reluctant but figured if I got a dysfunctional model it would soften the blow of only 'wasting' 15 dollars) To my surprise the night of my birthday I get on to make the purchase to find the price was reduced! I purchased it immediately. Shipping was very fast as usual (thanks Amazon!) I opened it up the minute I received it and tried it out. I was happy to see the battery was fully charged and the item was packaged very well. Instructions and device menu was in English!! I had an 8gb sd card laying around so I popped it in. Today, on my way to work I used it for the first official time. I removed the sd card to find my 40 minute commute used a whopping 2.3 gb! That's pretty dissatisfying because I figured I could keep a few days' worth of driving on an 8 gig card. The video quality leaves a little to be desired but like I said for the price I'm not going to complain much. The audio is very good, however. It picks up voices from outside the vehicle, the turn signal (incase you ever need to prove you used it), etc etc. Overall, I say take a chance! Honestly you're more likely to waste your money buying McDonald's for lunch than taking a chance on one of these. It comes with a very nice, very long power cord (incase you would like to route it up through your moldings, dash, what have you.. for a nice clean appearance); a 3 foot usb cable ; and may I note the window suction mount is worth 20 dollars alone..you can mount anything with a threaded mounting hole. Like I said, give it a shot. I'm happy with mine!

title: Save your money, buy a little more expensive one.
text: This thing was broken on arrival.  One of the most important buttons on the back did not work and the clip to hold the SD card in broke shortly thereafter.  When I asked for a replacement, I was told to ship this back to China.  Shipping costs back to China was about as much as the camera itself.  When I explained this to the seller, they still refused to give me a refund or send another camera.  It's only 15 bucks or so, but its the principle.  Buy one from The USA and pass on this seller.

title: Works fine for my use
text:
As others reported, the unit would hang or require reset (battery removal) when plugged into my computer via USB. But when I put it in the car with the cigarette lighter power, all that went away and it works fine.

The design appears sound, but other reviews indicate issues caused in manufacturing.

My only complaint is the battery doesn't want to hold a charge well. The battery keeps the date/time running, which is important. You don't want to have to re-enter that every time you drive. So far so good (1 month) but I keep getting a LOW BATTERY sign. I'll probably replace the battery with a better one soon.

I brought the SD card into the house and watched some of the videos. The clarity is completely acceptable for establishing the facts of an accident. I would say to keep your windshield clean or the sun will make a giant glare on your videos. It records audio too - I didn't realize how much I talk to myself in the car :)

title: Not very good even for cheap price
text:
It took me 3 exchanges to get a working unit. The first one I got, there was a video stutter, the lower half of the video breaks up once roughly every second as seen in this video: [...]

The second one wouldn't power up at all.

The third one worked but overall quality is not too good. It might be OK for when you get in accident (ie someone cuts you off) but when reporting a traffic violator the quality is rarely good enough for anyone to pull the license plate unless you tail gate (and you get in trouble for tail gating, which kinds of defeat the purpose of catching scofflaws). And for night time- don't bother. Even with LED light and your headlights on high. it won't record more than a few feet in front of the car.

The HD sett is really gimmick as well. The image sensor in my unit has a true resolution of 480x212. The HD mode comes from doubling up the video resolution, and from what I've seen, a free program on my computer did a far cleaner job of doubling up a 480 video than the camera can.

It'd be OK as cheap insurance against accident but it's not good overall, I wish I saved up and got a better model.

title: Too unreliable
text:
The image quality, while poor, is acceptable at this price so I can't complain about that. However, the fact that it only seems to work when it wants to is not acceptable. It should start automatically when you turn on the ignition - sometimes it does, sometimes it doesn't. More often it doesn't. To make it do so, you have to take out the battery and the charger and re-insert them, then it might work.

On the plus side, the window mount is good and the charger lead long and flexible.

I'll be buying a better quality camera to replace this shortly...

title: The Heat Gets to It
text: I bought this having very low expectations. I wasn't really expecting something amazing for $20. With that being said the camera did pretty well to start off with. The quality of the video was good considering the price. Night time shooting, however, is nonexistent. I travel down an extremely well light highway every night when I get off work and  the camera would only pick up little dots of light that were the street lamps. Again, I was not expecting much from a $20 camera as I know that even more expensive cameras have issues with nighttime recording. The problem that finally forced me to move to a different solution was the image becoming very blurry when the unit would get hot. I tired to help solve this by powering off the unit whenever it was not going to be needed for long periods of time (ie: at work or sitting at home) but the Alabama heat defeated my efforts. I can only assume that this unit would do better in cooler climates just not in the south.

title: Way better than I expected
text:
I first set this camera up in my car where it worked great and then installed it in my dump truck. I thought I would be able to put the video on my Kindle Fire and show people how a dump truck rides. Wrong,,, it is just as solid of a picture as in my car. Driving in the quarry you can hear the truck rattling and just barely see the hood shaking, but the picture is wonderful. There is no way I can show anyone how rough a truck rides with this video. It doesn't quite show license plates, but many times you can see electric wires or when birds fly in front of you. I put a 16GB Transcend in it and at the lowest video setting I get about 5 hours worth before it starts to dump the oldest segments. It saves every 5 minutes and you lose about 6 - 12 seconds of video as it saves but that's minor compared to having everything else recorded so beautifully.

It is definitely plug and forget. The hardest part, a few times was getting the suction cup to stick. I plug in the lighter power cord and forget about it till I'm done for the day. I'll probably buy another one for my car so I don't have to mess with the suction cup. The cord is definitely long, would be no problem to route it out of the way if desired.

title: You get what you pay for
text: Do not be an idiot.  I was.  $15 for a dash cam?  Honestly, the video is ok, but I had issues with the plastic housing within weeks.  Then it started having issues saving to the SD card.  Within five months it started randomly turning itself off every couple of minutes or so.  Frequently, though, it would just stop recording.  That's worse because it doesn't beep when it stops recording whereas it does when it turns off.  Where I live there are a lot of psycho drivers and several near collision would not have been recorded because this thing wasn't recording at the time.  At least I'm convinced now about the importance of having a quality, reliable (ok, expensive) dash cam.

title: The video quality is very poor. Setting date/time is very difficult
text: I purchased these because it seemed that 3 stars was worth the $15 "bang for buck."  I have 4 of these, one mounted in the rear windshield of each car and one mounted in the front of the primary vehicle.  The main issue I have is the adjusting mechanisms become loose when the vehicle has been sitting in the sun, and need to be retightened almost daily.  They can only be tightened so far before it goes over and strips the threads.  The video quality is very poor.  Setting date/time is very difficult, and sometimes when you push the buttons the device isn't aware of it, so you have to hit the buttons several times.  On the plus, there is still value in that when this is placed in the rear view mirror, and the driver behind you sees it, most of the time they will back off.  Folks... please do not tailgate, it is against the law and it is dangerous and it stresses out the person you are tailgating.  Be kind to each other, please.

title: Pretty good but not quite there
text:
Have had the unit in operation about two weeks now. So far, everything seems to be working fine as far as the electronics go. I've installed at 32gb card and have had no problems reviewing the video and snapshots. However, the optics aren't quite there as reading a license plate of a vehicle sitting pretty much on your front bumper is impossible. The 6 IR's are totally useless at night and the optics overexpose at night with the headlights reflecting off of the plate. The battery cover, once taken off, will never snap back into place. (hello scotch tape). The suction cup mount does not stick to the windshield even after wetting (may be the Florida heat) and should be mounted on the dash. All in all, for the selling price of $22.00, the unit is marginally acceptable.

Update: 4/16/13. Have had the unit now for about 3 months short of a year. Used every day on a dashboard mount as the suction cup will not hold on the windshield (I think this is an issue with all suction mounts regardless of quality. I have a Garmin GPS mount that does the same thing. A little silicone adhesive on the cup seems to work) The unit has stood up pretty well under the Florida sun. Battery compartment lid has loosened and has to be kept closed with scotch tape. Today the unit stopped working but after some refitting of the 12v plug that goes into the unit it came back to life. We'll see how long that lasts! Video quality is still marginal; again, don't expect to read license plates! Won't happen!

title: Its NOT whats advertised. Works ok for the price.
text:
Well, i knew (for the price) this was not the same thing the title said.
Even the LCD refers to the "wide view", and 5M pixel camera.

No, this is not "HD". Not "wide angle". The manual (can it be called that?) is a bad translation from Chinese, as the GUI.

Build quality is ok. Looks sturdy. Image is clear in daytime. At night, the IR can get reflected by the windshield and the video become useless.
Software as lot of bugs, nothing too important, but annoying. Power saving features are a mistery. There is a function "Panel Protect" that seems to turn off the LCD after some time. I still cannot figure out when this works. Sometimes it works while charging, other times only with battery.... and other times doesnt work at all.

The bullet shape is light, and can be mounted on a bicycle or even a helmet.

Again, for the price, it is worth it if you :
- Dont mind having the LCD on almost all the time (closed it leaks little light)
- Dont need a real "wide angle".
- Dont need a real "HD" quality.

title: Couldn't ask for more
text:
I have not tried any others but for under ($14) I cannot imagine you can get a better camera.

Coolest features to me are that it virtually has night vision (as in it can see in darkness where none of my other cameras could = Nikon L840, Cannon camcorder, and LG smart phone). Looks like I shot a paranormal film..very cool!!

I really like the motion detection feature as well. Could be great for catching parking lot burglaries.

It's video quality is as expected. About as good as most phones 8 years ago.

The mount works excellent, solid attachment to window, easy to move or lock.

The flip view is cool because the camera runs with it up or down in case it distracts your driving.

I get about 45 min worth of video from an 8GB SD card.

The charger works well and has a long cord.

I haven't tried USB because I use the SD drive on my laptop but would bet it works fine.

Overall I feel like I got a great deal as long as it continues to operate.

Another thought is that it could easily be used for home surveillance using the motion detection and an adapter for the power supply to A/C outlet. Just stick it to a glass plate/cup and put it in the window seal (or over your cookie jar...lol)

Only downfall is it only supports up to 32GB which probably gets over 24hrs worth of video.

Very satisfied!

Looking forward to more products like this.

title: Great device for the price!
text: [[VIDEOID:moBAIJ8R927PRO]]For less than $25.00 it does a nice job. I don't need a camera that costs so much that I fear that it will be stolen or broken.  Has a semi wide fish-eye lens. I'm not looking for wedding photo quality, come on its only 25 bucks. Comes with car charger and suction cup mount, not mentioned in the description. Also comes with a cellphone type rechargeable battery. Plugged into the charger, I get over 9 hours of video (with audio) on a 16GB card. VGA quality is 640x480, so stay with that mode, because the other larger sizes that it records (D1, and SVGA) are actually not different at all. The SVGA 1280x720 is the same as the VGA and D1 680x480, but with thick black edges on the sides, video is not sharper. You may want to buy a different smaller sized window mount that has a "ball hinge". The mount that comes with it is somewhat large, but still fine to use. The charger wire is long enough to tuck under window trim and dashboard trim and reach the car's power socket. Not too bad at night time, so see the attached video sample that I made. The camera comes with infrared lights, but I see no use for them unless you are video recording your hood ornament, or if you use this device as a home security monitor inside of your house. Not a bad idea, just buy one of those 120volt wall adapters to plug your charger into, then attach the camera to a window or wall. If you are not sure you need a DashCam, but still want to give it a try before you go all out and buy a 200 dollar HD broadcast quality one, then this one is just for you. I like the home security idea myself.

title: Save your money, pay a little more and avoid this unit
text:
[[VIDEOID:a1566bc2340bdbebae42e22cda75503]] I wasn't expecting dazzling crystal clear video from a camera at this price point.

What I found with this unit is daylight video is, at best, average albeit grainy. You can't read license plates and few road signs. Morning and evening driving conditions increase the graininess of the video. At night the video is all but useless unless one is on a well lit main street.

I purchased this based on the review of the "DVR 027 720p" on Dashcamtalk.com. For less than $16 I didn't have much to lose. On their "Dash Cam Comparison" page there is a warning "Watch out for fakes." The videos posted in the Dashcamtalk review are much better than this one achieved. I've used it over a number of days with half a dozen class 10 cards, four class 6 cards, and five class 4 cards of varying storage capacity. None of them made a difference in recording quality.

I purchased the 720p unit from Tolin. It arrived covered by "blackout" plastic. The box is missing the UK Limtech, Inc detail. The unit has no identification / certification on it nor in the battery compartment.

The one nice feature is the unit uses a Nokia phone battery which is readily available. Using only the internal battery I've gotten between 30 minutes to one hour of recording.

Returning the unit is an option but at this price point it's pointless.

...

Updated November 6th

I've continued to use this despite it's flaws. Tonight's near miss with an idiot serves to underscore why one should purchase a better dash cam. Other than seeing this idiot swing out over the double yellow line to go who knows where he thought, you can't tell much about the car. Had he hit me there would be a record but very little useful beyond the obvious...

title: Worthless
text: I wanted a car cam for quite some time and my wife surprised me by buying this DVR for father's day. The instructions difficult to understand but I did manage to set the device after playing around with it. I charged the camera overnight and wanted to test it out the next day. To my disapointment, the camera couldn't even record the whole 20 min drive to work because the battery died. What a piece of junk. Additionally, in this modern era with HD and high tech smart phones, this camera is no where near HD quality. I couldn't even read street signs with this thing let along license plates. So I decided to return it. I was truly disappointed with this product even though I knew that it was only 20 bucks. I was determined to have a car cam and did much research but I could not find anything with good quality video in my price range. So after much thought, I started looking at phone apps that can do the same as this camera. To my surprise, there are so many apps out there that will act as a DVR. Like most phones these days, they actually have HD quality video. All i did was download a free app ( I like daily roads voyager) and I bought an iottie phone holder to attach to my winshield. Both work great and the videos are exactly what I wanted in a car cam. Dont waste you money on this cam. The iottie costs 20 bucks and you would only need to buy a sd or micro sd card if you wanted to store the videos on your phone.

title: pretty good dashcam
text:
I've played with this thing a week now. Not bad for an under $20.00 dash cam. I was impressed with the quality of video it produced. I'll list the things about it I don't like first. You can't preview or watch the video from the cam. You have to view it on your computer or laptop. It doesn't come with a memory card, you have to buy one separate. I bought the 32gig card like they suggest. Didn't need that. An 8 gig would have worked just as well. Another thing, the infrared night vision apparently doesn't work well. At least on mine, when I tried it at night, . It was dark as hell. All I could see was what was in my headlights. I'll mess with it some more after dark and see if it was something I want doing right. If I was wrong, I'll repost what I did wrong.

There are two buttons to use. On/off, and record. Plug the unit into an outlet, like your cigarette lighter outlet. When you crank the vehicle the unit will automatically turn on and start recording. Unless you are like me and your auto has an always on outlet, then you have to unplug the adapter each time. The cord is long enough to hide it under the glove box and across the bottom of the windshield to keep it hidden.

The setup was easy. First throw the Japanese written instructions in the trash, then click then menu button to navigate through the options. When you find an selection you want to change, hit the record button to change it. The sound is good. It records any sound you or your stereo makes. I turned my sound off.

It's lightweight, not very sturdy, so be careful with it. Would I buy another or recommend this product to someone? Yes.

Don't forget, it has no card and it has no internal memory, so you have to buy one to be able to record anything.

title: Barely Adequate

title: Good for the price, but battery failed out of box.
text:
I bought this camera because it was cheap and some of the reviews I saw said it was good for the price. When I received it I set it aside for a few months without even taking out of the box, that was a mistake. When I took it out and finally powered it up the menu came up in Russian. Being that I don't speak the language I had to go to Google translate to figure out how "language" looks in Russian, it took a little bit but finally got the menu to display in English. Once it was up and running I let it charge for awhile and took some test videos. Quality and sound were decent for the price I paid for the unit. I put it in the car and let it charge the first 2 day I was driving. After that I unplugged and the battery indicator showed full. After a few minutes I heard a beep and saw the indicator had dropped to one bar and was flashing. I plugged it in and the unit started charging. After a few minutes it showed full so I unplugged it, again the indicator fell to one bar and was flashing. I noticed that when I plug it in it goes to full and stops charging, then when you unplug it goes to empty and dies.

I still use the unit but it must be plugged in at all times which is annoying having a cord hang down from the windshield. I regret waiting so long to try it out because I was now past the point of no return (return date). I will probably spend a little more money and get a better unit in the near future.

title: For the price: Worth it.
text:
Look, lets be honest. It's not the best Dash Camera money can buy. But for 17 bucks why/how could it be? CYA people. You don't have to have the best equipment money can buy. As long as it works.

I bought it and a 32 GB Class 10 SD card (About 20 bucks) for it. I run it at least 10 hours straight. I just start recording at the beginning of my shift and let it run throughout the whole thing. I can get (Give or take) about 4 days or so of recording with it set on the lowest video setting (Which is all you need) before it starts overwriting the old files (Set to 5 Minute increments). (Note that the time is on Night Shift as well. It seems like once the sun comes up it takes more space. Possibly because there's more going on in the video). If you're right behind a car at night the license plate can get over exposed but everything else still comes in pretty good.

As a suggestion: Buy a small USB card reader. Yes, for the most part the camera is plug and play with the computer but it never seems to install the way other (NAME BRAND) devices do. It also makes it easier to get video off in the middle of the shift without removing the camera from the windshield.

My partners car was hit by a drunk driver while on a traffic stop. We (Our Department) do not provide dash cams but mine (This camera) was in an running nearby. Despite the driver being drunk, his defense was that he couldn't see my partners car. Since he plowed into the car by the time the supervisor arrived the electronics inside were turned off to make sure there was no fire hazard (Disabling the overhead lights). We work for a department that investigates EVERYTHING. All the arriving supervisor would have had to go on would have been my partners word that his overhead lights were on. But since I had the camera, there was Video Proof that his car had the overheads on (And they were working properly).

NOTE: This product is NOT properly shielded from RF interference. If you are into HAM radios (or you work for a police department and use your handheld radio while inside the car) and key up your HT anywhere near this thing while its turned on it locks up. You can fix it by unplugging the power and removing the battery (Forcing it to turn off) then putting the battery back and plugging it back in. Then you've got to reset the time and date before you can start recording again. The wired mobile radio doesn't seem to effect it, but on HT it freaks it out. I have not tried a mobile using a magnetic mount antenna yet, only a mobile with the antenna mounted doesn't seem to effect it.

Even with that issue, I still use the heck out of this camera. It's not a deal breaker. For 17 bucks even if you decide you want a better one down the road, this was your introduction to know if you like it or not. Again: CYA

title: Crap Shoot Dash Cam
text:
I previously tried to review this item, but my review vaporized - trying again...

Received dash cam today, along w/32Gb Class 10 SDHC card. Card is needed to function as camera's "hard drive". Looks EXACTLY like a camera I purchased previously elsewhere, but don't let looks deceive you. There are apparently several flavors of this dash cam out there, with differing levels of quality in instructions, hardware quality, and firmware quality/options.

The camera I previously purchased is VGA only, and is powered by a conventional power plug. This camera, in contrast, uses the mini-USB port to charge the battery and transfer video. The spot where the power plug is on my other camera is filled by a A/V OUT jack on this dash cam. Neither features a HDMI jack. This camera actually has rather comprehensive instructions in (microscopic) english - the other camera's instructions were scanty and barely comprehensible. This camera had an easily-removable screen protector. the other has a screen protector that "took an act of Congress" to remove, with a big bubble in it. The (retail) boxes both cameras arrived in were identical, and both appeared to be brand-new. While the window mounts are different, both should work fine (I've been using the other camera in my vehicles for over a month with no mount problems).

The only problem I've encountered with my older dash cam is that the power plug sometimes works itself loose, Also - the previously-purchased camera cost almost twice as much, but is VGA only - this camera will go all the way to 1080P.

Both cameras were easy to set up without the instructions, although you have to use the record button on the rear of both cameras as the enter button during setup. I turned off the almost worthless IR LED's and audio record option on both cameras. If you're moving, the headlights will illuminate the scene ahead. The LED's will light only a few feet ahead, and the audio is nominal at best, and I'm hoping that with no audio, my file sizes will be smaller.

So, I guess that what I'm trying to say is: your best chance of getting a good, cheap dash cam is to be mindful of what specific vendor the reviewer obtained their camera from, and purchase accordingly. (I bought this one from EVER LIGHTING) Again - be aware that I got 2 very different (internally) dash cams in identical boxes. Your vendor may re-order and get the switcheroo too.

title: different brands but the same camera and they're both horrible when it comes to the quality of video
text: I have to agree with several of the reviews on this dash cam. I have 2 now...different brands but the same camera and they're both horrible when it comes to the quality of video. I have tried everything possible to hopefully improve the quality....reading tips from other users....changing out SD cards....even changing the program for video playback and....nothing works. At first...I thought there maybe a protective shield over the lens but there was nothing on either camera to cause this very grainy video. People are saying...you get what you pay for when it comes to the price of this dash cam and the quality of video. I have to disagree. I have 3 other dash cams....different styles and paid very little for them. The video quality on all 3 of them are amazing....one even having a pretty impressive night time video quality that's not dark and virtually impossible to see more than 10 feet in front of you like most of these camera's tend to be like. One of my main issues with these camera's is that there are no company name or brand on them so that they can be recommended to users on here who are looking for a better quality dash cam from such a cheap price. I'll keep these 2 HD DVR cam's for spares but....the other 3 that I have will be used in my vehicles. Do your research and watch the video's of the different dash cams to see what they're truly like. I say that and I watched one of the video's posted on one of the 2 camera's that I'm putting aside and the video was crystal clear so....take that advice for what y'all will. I have another cam coming in soon...one like the one I mentioned with the better night time video. I'll take a pic of it and post it here if I can for y'all too see and maybe think about getting instead of this one.

title: Great Price but Not As Advertized
text:
I would have given this Five Stars if the item description was accurate.

First of all, the item sent to me is a USED product. I wouldn't even call it refurbished judging from the plastic bags the pieces were wrapped in. I even had to fish a small nut for the mount from the box that had come loose. It had obviously been opened and used at least once, probably more since the bags looked pretty hammered. All they had to do was include the word "Refurbished" in the product description and do a better job of repackaging and I wouldn't be dinging for this. In fact I would have felt better about buying it for the seemingly unbelievably low price if it was listed as a refurbished product.

Secondly, it is advertized as " Recording resolution:1280x960 / 720x480 / 640x480 pixels". This is not true. It only has one size, labeled "VGA" in the setup, which is 640x480. The box it came in says "HD DVR" and most people interpret HD as High Definition. The instructions (which were obviously written by someone who doesn't speak English) says you can change the video size in the settings menu but it only has one option -- VGA.

Thirdly, the description also says it has "120 degree wide view angle". Perhaps if it actually did allow you to record in 1280x960 resolution this might be true but since it doesn', this is also a false statement.

It does, technically, have IR LED for night recording. You turn it on by clicking the on/off button which switches between Day and Night mode (hold it in to turn off/on). But the IR LED light only works for objects within a few feet of the camera. Only a very dim and narrow beam actually reaches the hood of my car making this feature worthless.

The instructions must have been for a different model or firmware since the settings described in the manual don't match what is actually available on the menu. For example, it says there is an option for IR LED that can be switched between "Atuo or Off" (type-o included). But this option doesn't exist.

Having said all this, I wasn't expecting much for $15. Even though the video is only 640x480 you can read the license plate of the car in front of you while waiting at a signal. Once cars gets much beyond that, plates are unreadable. The mount is very secure and the power adapter has enough length that I could hide it by tucking it between the windshield and the roof at the top, the door weather stripping and column on the side and up under the dash, still reaching the power outlet under the center of my dashboard. I also put the wire coming down from the top of the dash in with the wires to my rear view mirror which are covered so there are no noticeable wires.
It has a "Voice Record" mode that will record your voice as long as there is no other ambient sound. But if you have the radio on or a loud cabin fan blowing all it records is static. So I just set it to not record sound since it's worthless unless you want to record dictation or something.

It requires an SD card to record (not included) so be sure to purchase one if you don't already have one. It says it supports cards up to 32GB. I use a 32GB card and it works fine. One advantage of lower resolution is it won't take up as much memory space so you should be able to use a much smaller card unless you want to record a 10+ hour road trip.

It can be set to record in 2, 5 or 15 minute increments (with a few seconds lost between segments). It can also be set to just record continuously until it's turned off. I think the only disadvantage of this is that when it needs to free up space it deletes old files which would mean losing an entire trip. I think it's better to do that than lose a few seconds that might be critical footage.

If you want high quality recording you'll probably want to pay more and get a better dash cam. But this seems like a cheap entry level camera that will help you decide if you really want or need a more expensive device later.

title: Incredibly Affordable and Actually Quite Decent Dash Camera
text: You simply cannot find a more affordable dash camera. Photo and video quality are surprisingly good for the price; and actually much better than other similar models at this price range. I am easily able to make out license plate numbers at a reasonable distance and other details in the video. The software was already in English, and adjustments are fairly simple to figure out, if you are comfortable with electronic menus. The suction cup mount is still holding strong, despite being exposed to intense sunlight on most days for hours at a time. Finally, the camera records automatically, without any intervention needed from the driver. I did need to reformat the SD card to get it to work, but otherwise this stellar dash camera for those looking for a simple, no frills or GoPro quality images, and affordable dash camera.

title: Video recording works, but no menus maintain settings.
text:

The problem I am having is that it does not remember any of the settings, Once I found English and set that, i was able to set the date and time and how long I wanted it to loop. Then as soon as it is turned off it restarts back in which ever language it was set when it came, the date an time are wiped out, so you have to start all over. Not convenient but its also not very expensive so maybe it just has to be on the wrong date and time and not in english... i may return this though as I would like it to remember my settings. that seems pretty basic.

Also noticing that the unit i received is not the same as the unit in the pictures. and there is no Red button as talked about in many peoples answers, my record button is white. there is no audio jack like in the product photos.

title: It does a great job!
text:
[[VIDEOID:6eecec2fc9eb412679d23b75d9ae9ce2]] Before you start, make it clear - this is a low-end dashcam, you do not have to complain too much based on its price range. It does what it should and to me the value is there.

It will not read the tag if it is more than 2 cars away from you, but it can show clear evidence of what happens ahead. It will not show you HD crystal clear motion picture but it provides you the peace of mind.

Most negative comments are the battery. It can not hold the charge. You can find the same type cell battery around $5 @ amazon (BL-5C) that will solve the problem. It adds up the dashcam to around $20. But for $20, it does a great job!

Video: has to reduce the size to meet Amazon requirement (640*480). The night view shows brighter light v.s. the real environment.

title: Not bad for its price
text: I have two of these and they do their job. Of course it's not HD, it just interpolates the images to make bigger files with no additional information. Of course, they don't have "night vision" and in the dark you can't make out anything more than the lights of the car in front. But it does record continuous video that will in most cases serve as evidence for whatever happens in front of you. The field of view is quite wide, so it captures a wide swath in front of you. The resolution is not quite good enough to make out license plates. Although the cameras are the same, the software seems to vary from one camera to the next, with slighly different options etc, neither of which is accurately reflected in the half-a-page "manual," but through trial-and-error you can probably figure it out. It is what you can expect for a $25 video camera.

title: It does a good job recording video during the day and night (as ...
text: All I can say is that you get what you pay for.  It does a good job recording video during the day and night (as long as you switch it to night mode).  I've had it either not turn off after pressing the power button or fail to start up at times.  I've had it for less than 2 months and the cigarette lighter charger cord already has a tear, exposing the red wire.  The video is decent quality but from personal experience, it's hard to see the plates of the cars due to glares.  Aside from the occasional problems of not starting up or turning off properly, the camera does a good job for it's price.  I've recorded a few bad instances and video replay was good enough.  Sometimes license plates are easy to read but at times it's hard to.  For the price though, it is definitely worth it and what it does.  If you're looking for a dashcam simply for the purpose of possibly having evidence to your advantage, this cheap camera is worth it.  It's not like you absolutely need high-def cameras with outstanding night vision.  If that's what you're aiming for, prepare to pay $200+.  I'll update this post after a while to see how long it lasts or if any other problems come up.

title: Love it so far
text: I ordered this on a Friday and it arrived on a Sunday. I'm very impressed with my Prime membership. I ordered 2 of these. One for the car and one for the house. Once I read a comment from someone that it had a motion sensor I had try it for the house. My 1st day having it in the car I encountered a lunatic on the road. She was riding my bumper (I wish I had one for the back window) and then went around me and cut me off. If anything were to happen I'm glad I would have had footage. I can the other one is going to work great for the house. With the motion detector it runs for about 25 seconds once it detects movement. If there is constant movement it will run continuously. I will update this if I have any new experiences. I just took it out of the box today... I would have given it 5 stars if it came with a home charger to charge up the battery prior to putting it in the car. The one I use in the house I use a 6' usb cord extender and plug it into a usb plug that comes with most cell phones.

title: Terrible.
text: The backlight on the first unit I ordered eventually stopped working. I had to send them several e-mails, which took WEEKS, until I threatened to contact Amazon.com customer service on them. At that point, CE Compass finally told me that they sent out a replacement unit. The first tracking number they gave me was for a replacement charger that also took several weeks to get from them that I already had. I demanded them to give me the real tracking number or I was going to notify Amazon. Well, finally I got the replacement unit, but it doesn't work right either! It glitches out constantly-- even more so than the first unit. The replacement glitches out at about 40 seconds of video recording, which is bad, because I was out on the road the other day and someone almost t-boned my car and now I have no way of identifying them. I will now begin the arduous task of requesting a refund from them. After that, I am never doing business with them again.

title: The first one was from Hong Kong that took two weeks to ship and liked it so much that I bought a second one
text:
This is my second model of this camera. The first one was from Hong Kong that took two weeks to ship and liked it so much that I bought a second one.

However, the same product quality appears to be missing. The description suggests that there is a 120 degree viewing angle, which is very likely to be untrue. It's actually the sole reason why I have already bought my third camera [[ASIN:B010GYYSU2 ZeroEdge 2.4- inch 135° View Angle, Full HD 1080P with G-Sensor Car Dashboard Camera Bundle with 16GB TF Card (Black)]]

I would highly recommend avoid purchasing this unless you really just want a camera for your car at little cost. The viewing angle wasn't worth much to me on a multi-lane road. I could barely see the bumper of the car in front of me in the full view of the lens.

title: Not good for anyone on night a night shift or night driving.
text: I bought this to mount in a work car I have. The microphone works well and picks up voices well. The daytime video records really well. The nighttime video sucks. I tried to set the camera to a night setting and I was unable to get it to work in that setting. The battery will last 5 minutes or less so make sure you keep it plugged in. I haven't used the motion activated part so I can't say anything about that part. The flip down screen is handy. It's fairly easy to figure out use on your own and the directions are pretty generic in explaining things. I spent $15 on this camera and feel like it's about a $15 item. If you need video during the daytime I say you should buy it. If you work nights like I do then I would look for something different.

title: Skip the ones you see on tv!!
text:
Not a bad little way to record while driving. It's not the sturdiest recorder out there but it works quite well on paved and gravel roads. If you plan on using for serious off roading I'd skip this one.

The daytime recording works quite well but the nighttime recording is fairly dark. It's simple to operate even without directions. My biggest complaint would be the battery as it can only be charged via computer usb or 12 volt plug. Don't plug it into an iPhone charger because there's not enough juice going through. I should have know but I was being lazy.

Overall it works good for the price and as always with Amazon it came in a lot less time. You have to supply the sd card to get up and running but the options are impressive. The quality of the picture is fantastic.

title: Ordered two, returned two
text:
Was looking forward to monitoring both front and back while driving and at $20.21 ea how could I go wrong? Upon opening the outer box I discovered one of the camera boxes was taped up as if it had been previously returned. Undaunted I unwrapped the power cord and jammed a 16Gb SD card in it. Flipping through the menu it had many options for resolution, color correction, etc.

First test was a fail by me, I had the SD card formatted for my Sony, so I formatted it with this cam. Second trial I get audio and distorted video! So on to test subject 2, strangely this was the one looked 'new' because the box was not slathered with 2" clear packing tape. First thing I notice on firing this one up is the setup menu is VERY different than the other identical looking cam. Well number 2 recorded audio and no video, fail #2!

I am kind of thinking these may be returns already since most come direct from China (Hong Kong) this may be their stateside sort facility recycling these things.

title: This is a keeper.
text:
Works nice, and I changed mine from HD to VGA just to save memory space but that is not necessary.

The suction pad appears defective and sticks to nothing but when I put it onto my windshield it sticks tight, and it will stick there even in a crash as it is so tight.

The LED lights are not meant to function, as for driving those lights would be a huge distraction or worse, so they are deactivated and just for looks.

It has a standard USB connecting wire for my computer and pictures and videos are easy to view or to download or to delete.

Mine has been installed and functioning for months now and after a while I just forget about it, as it records the videos and the sound just anytime I start up the engine.

For an inexpensive DVR which does the job then yes I recommend this one.

title: For this price, awesome camera
text: For the price it is really good. I wanted to buy a dash cam for just in case as it seems like I am always being "almost hit" by someone while driving.  However, I didn't want to spend a lot of money. Because they are so cheap, I bought two and put one on the front windshield and the other on the back windshield so I can have better coverage. They size is good as it isn't too big and with a 32 GB SD Card I can record video for weeks before it runs out of space and starts recording over stuff. I was surprised at the video quality considering the price, it is very clear in the daytime. It is OK at night, but more difficult to see things that aren't in your headlights. I would totally recommend to others who just want a dash cam for protection in case of an accident.

title: This is a sweet dash camera for the money
text: This is a sweet dash camera for the money.  Mine came with an 8gb SD card even though the description didn't mention it.  I just plugged the camera in and it turns on and recorded automatically.  By default, it records 2 minutes, then automatically autostarts a new recording every 2 minutes.  The 8gb card held 56 two minute videos, and when the card gets full, it overwrites the oldest files. The camera can be set to record longer files, but 2 small 2 minute files are perfect for a dash cam.  If you're ever in an accident, you already have the short file ready to go.  To download files, you simply plug the camera into a computer with the included USB cable.  My windows PC detected the camera automatically, and I was able to easily click on the DCIM folder and drag them onto my PC.  I couldn't be happier with my $14 dash cam.

title: Great cheap little DVR dashcam
text:
Nice wide view - it's pretty much what I can see from the left-hand-side of the windshield to about the middle of the windshield (I have the camera mounted in the middle). You can't read license plates unless they're very close - the quality is about that of 3 to 5 megapixel camera, but it makes me feel a lot better about commuting knowing that I have this recording.

The device is easy to install, and has a very long power cord so you can put it anywhere in the car. Starts recording when the car turns on, and shuts off when the car is turned off (so long as your car turns off power to cigarette adapter devices after you remove the key). I have an 8GB memory card, and it records about 45 minutes of video on the maximum settings, more than enough video if I ever needed to review an incident.

title: Garbage Video Quality
text:
I thought I would give this a shot since it had a few decent reviews. First thing I noticed was the poor build quality. The OK/Record button did not work at first (had to mush it down really hard to get it to register).

The worst part of this is the video quality - absolutely horrible regardless of resolution setting. The mic picks up a huge amount of white noise that makes the audio unusable. I could do better with an old Android phone, a mount, and a dash cam app.

title: Good Video, Causes Radio noise on AM/FM
text:
I gave this a tryout for many months and i actually bought 2 of them before i decided to write this review. First off the video is good enough if youwere to ever need it for evidence in an accident, to prove you stopped at a stop sign, or get some cool shots of lightning bolts, etc. I also used it to take video of the suspension on my classic car as i was driving down the road to look for issues and it worked great. The suction cup worked very well and i didn't have any problems with it falling off the windshield.

Now the bad parts (Both had the same problems): the audio recording is practically non-existent, you barely hear loud music and there is no chance at ever making out what someone is saying. Next is the fact that it will cause noise in your radio, it is the camera itself that causes the noise, not the charger. to replicate it you can run the camera on battery but plug in the charger cord to the camera and you will get a rhythmic popping and static on AM/FM. This happens whether or not the charger is plugged into the car or not; so, the camera is broadcasting a signal through the charger cord that the radio picks up, i can say this with certainty because i tried multiple cameras in multiple vehicles and got the same results.

title: Awesome Dash Cam for the Price
text: Hang on to the instructions because the default menu language on the camera screen is Chinese. So until you figure out how to change it to English it is challenging.  The instructions give you a clue as to what each line in Chinese means so you can find "language" and then change it. After overcoming that hurdle, this thing works great.  Records a great picture with or without sound using the default 1080 picture setting.  You can set how long each video segment is (1/2/3/5/10 min),  This will break your trip into files for playback and when you run out memory it overwrites the oldest file on the card with a new one.  I bought a 32 GB card which is the maximum it accepts.  The camera automatically starts recording when you start the car and stops when you it shut off.  This purchase exceeded my expectations.

title: Good Product for the Price.
text:
I own a pilot car company. I bought 6 of these for use in our pickups. They serve our purpose. The quality of video in day time is good, but not great. Night time is very poor. You can only see lights of other cars. Audio will pick up all noises, including wind noise if side window in down. But it also pickups conversation between the driver and truck driver over a C.B. radio. The electronics work slow when you are setting up DVR or playback.
Using the DVR for play back as a good picture, but no audio. DVR does not have a volume control. If it does, I have not found it, but has good volume played on laptop.
The only problem I had was the DVR lockup. Would not record, play back or turn off. I removed memory card and reformatted and have had no problems since.
For the price, it is a good buy and I would and have recommended this product.

title: DVR Dash cam
text:
OK, I got this thing from CE COMPASS. I took the chance for the price. My basic expectations were not met and I'm not going to waste my time arguing with the seller or evem calling them. First, If you purchase this product, you might as well also get a Mini Usb car charger, cuz the one included doesn't work. I asume this is for most people since other reviewers of this same item, or the same item listed elsewhere on Amazon has similar issues.

People are also correct about the HD recording. Its only like 12 frames a second or something. I saw it once transferred to my PC and its like watching pic,pic,pic, instead of video. The DL or whatever (the one below HD) is much smoother, but you lose definition, no street sign words viewable or liscence plates. I havent used this at night yet so who knows.

So anyways, I use the mini USB charger for my cell phone and plug it into this. I use it on D1 or dl recording mode and all it well. Others mentioned that these stop working or something after a week or two. If it does, the trashcan this will go, and I'll by a brand name next. UMM.. there's a slot for HDMI cable, but its only the impression in plastic, no actual slot. UMM, 2.4 inch screen... makes a big difference to a 2.5 which is almost a centimeter off. So they should just be honest and say its 2.4 in. Um, the battery does charge and works for about 2 hours without the Mini USB car charger plugged in.

update: 9/13/2011 ITS IN THE GARBAGE!! stopped working this morning. The videos becan recording like the old tv channels used to come in with house antennas that were positioned wrong. It was crazy. I reset the battery afterwords with zero effect. I also noticed the thing no longer worked without the car charger plugged in aswell. So I wasted money again on a dvr dash cam. I'm fed up. title: Great Starter Unit

title: You get what you pay for.
text:
I ordered two. One for each car. You get what you pay for. One works fine, but the ball bearing is really loose and the camera kept shifting around during normal driving.... so I ended up painting some nail polish inside the bearing to get it to firm up a bit. That seems to have fixed it. That camera now works with no issues and is serving it's purpose.
The second one - it arrived with a cracked battery casing, but it seemed to work at first so I kept it... but it freezes up constantly and basically is non-functional after a couple months use. So it's hit-and-miss I guess. If I had to purchase over again, I probably should have just spent more money on a better product. Oh well.

title: Pretty good for $20
text:
I just got it, so I can't attest to it's durability, but my initial impressions are quite positive. All functions & features seem to work great, save for the fact that I cannot turn on the date/time stamp. Maybe I'll figure out that I'm doing something wrong, but I followed the instructions. Otherwise, though, seems like a solid little product. It'd be nice if the settings were a little more customizeable, but for the price, I can't complain. Beware, though; The IR illumination is pretty mediocre. More than a few feet away, it won't pick up squat. But again, for the money, it's not really fair to compare it to my Swann 8 camera DVR or my ATN night vision scope. Besides, it's intended purpose is to capture video of driving incidents; If it can't see what's in front of the car for lack of light, neither can you!

If it holds up well over the next 6 months+, I'll upgrade from 4 stars to 5.

title: Very pleased with purchase
text:
Well I received my replacement unit since I believed the first one had a fault in the LCD display. Turns out it is a film protecting the display. That is why I returned the first unit thinking it was an LCD flaw. Removing the film is a little hard and I was worried that it might be a fold in the LCD film. No Instructions of course. So if you see a small green square in the top left corner of the LCD screen this is where you can carefully grab or use tweezers to pull the protective film off. That said for the price the camera does a decent job. I mounted it just below the mirror and ran the wires around the head liner and down the windshield column, under the dash to the cigarette lighter socket. My wife got into the truck and didn't even notice it. Currently have a 32GB stick installed. It is fairly easy to pop the SD card out and check the videos on your computer. Media player classic home cinema had a problem but MS media player worked good.
Video is good enough for the price. I set resolution at 720. White balance sometimes gets upset if there is a bright sky and dark road but might need to look at the settings and test again. Not a really critical issue. The menu operation takes a bit to get used to but does work ok once figured out. All and all I am happy with this dash cam and would recommend it to others who want a budget device. Time will tell if it has long term reliability.
Thanks for reading...

title: ... camera about four months ago and I was very pleased with it
text: I bought this camera about four months ago and I was very pleased with it.  I then started having focus issues and it was so bad that you could not make out the car's license plate in front of you or any street signs.  I wrote to the seller twice and never got a response. The camera at this point was useless to me and I was ready to dispose of it.  I had a few camera's years ago and at that time we could adjust the focus by turning the lens but looking at this dash cam I couldn't tell if it was fixed or not so I took the camera apart thinking at this point I had nothing to lose. I saw the lens was not fixed but was threaded so I put the camera back together and using a pair of pliers on the lens turned it 1/4 inch clockwise while video taping and seeing the change of focus on the cam monitor.  I used white out on the housing to keep track of how much I turned the lens.  My camera now is back in focus.  Another thing...Don't leave the camera in a hot car as it is not heat resistant and may be the reason for the focus problem.

title: Interferes with GPS in my 2011 Nissan
text: The camera worked as advertised for a few months.  No complaints.  Then one night the GPS showed our location to be 10-20 miles away in the Pacific Ocean.  At first I thought weather might be interfering with the satellites.  When the problem didn't go away the next day, I thought there was something wrong with the GPS (which is built-in original equipment).  The GPS continued to show our location to be 5,10, 20 miles away.  It took me a few days to finally guess that the continuing problem was RF interference from the camera mounted on the windshield.  (If the problem had surfaced immediately after I installed the camera, I would have guessed correctly right away.  But it didn't cause any problem for months--until suddenly it did.)  I suppose the camera would still be working if I didn't have to remove it.  Maybe three stars is too generous since I can't use the camera at all.  But it would probably work o.k. in another car.

title: Cheap, but not as functional as I had hoped.
text:
The good:
Not very expensive at all. The mount is secure, there's plenty of power cord available, it's a nice form factor, and doesn't block my vision too much.

The continuous recording function doesn't seem to work. I have to periodically format the card and start recording again pretty much every time I start the car. Sometimes the card isn't recognized, and the unit must be rebooted. The video quality is very poor. Unit has locked up three or four times since I got it, and needed the battery pulled before it would work again. The night vision is useless past 5 feet. Field of view is very narrow.

title: Quite terrible but does the job
text:
[[VIDEOID:ddaa0663bc511cbfbf6d3d6be0148d4]] This is a sample video. Please ignore the small crack in the windshield - that's been there for years and isn't in my vision. The sound track on the CD does have gaps - there's a problem with the CD.

The video recorder works - it's quite poor definition. This was shot in bright sunlight with a clean windshield. The video seems to have unexplained clicks, an annoying high-pitched whine and some kind of cutout in the signal.

I tried an eye-fi card and it will not recognise it unless i pull it out then plug it in again. It needs to be switched off before you turn the ignition off and on after you turn the car on again.

Video length seems to be 3 minute segments. My eye-fi couldn't pick up my wifi network so I had to upload manually which took forever.

This is a neat unit if all you're going to do is use a 32gb sd card and rotate cards every day.

It's better than my previous unit but there's plenty room for improvement.

I don't recommend leaving it switched on in the car as it and the cigarette plug get very hot - maybe hot enough to cause a fire

UPDATE
This was purchased in 2012. Today (December 1st 2018) it blew fuse after fuse for my cigarette lighter sockets. I’m going to say that it’s probably dead after 6 years of sporadic use.

title: Sets Up Quickly. Turns on and off automatically. Works well.
text:
Once it's setup, it works well. Doesn't required any other maintenance. It turns on when I drive off and turns off a few seconds after I turn off the engine. You don't even realize it's there. It just works.

The image quality is good. With a 32GB SD card, I can record about five hours of video.

The suction cup holds the camera to my windshield surprisingly well. In over a month, it fell off once when I originally set it up. The viewer is also useful for leveling and adjusting the camera.

The battery charges and holds the time and date settings but after a two week vacation, the settings had reset. No big deal. I don't need to display the time and date on my video anyway.

I'm quite satisfied with this gadget. I purchased another one for my wife's car.

When I finally got it in, it glitched on every recording that I took. It would basically keep screening a ghost image of what was on the screen when it first started recording, and it showed that over the whole recording. It wouldn't record and none of the buttons would work. So I couldn't turn it on or off, I couldn't manually record it. I also couldn't access the menu or anything else. The only way I could turn it on or off was by unplugging it from a power source. If I had known this was going to be such a piece of junk I would've gotten the cheaper version of my camera.

title: Also had the blurry problem, but kind of found a solution
text:
The setup of the camera was very easy. Turns on and starts recording, shuts off when you turn off the car (assuming you have a switched outlet, of course). The 1280 x 720 setting is a lie, it looks worse than 640 x 480 and probably takes up more space. All 1280 x 720 does is chop off the top and bottom of the 640 x 480 image. In other words, you capture less of what's going on outside. Mine was working fine for the first 3 minutes, with my wife driving. When I later drove, it immediately became blurry. Over the next few days, I would wrestle with it, tapping it to make it focus, but it would only last a few seconds. I then realized it was becoming blurry when I accelerated (I guess I drive more aggressively than my wife), and cleared up when I would hit the brakes. What I did was to aim the camera a little more downward, so I could see the hood more, and that has helped a lot. It seems like the lens inside are loose, and are working when there is pressure pushing them to the front of the camera and not the back.
Still, it is defective so I'm returning it, but I'll give it 2 stars because it was so cheap. I'll keep ordering and returning until I get a good one. I don't want something expensive hanging in my windshield, and it's a little tough to dismount it and remount it, so I'll stick with something cheap and not $50.

***UPDATE***

By the way, the review above was from a seller named fastNeasy.

While returning the first one, I ordered another from FAR CLOUD. I got it today. It looked the same, but the software running on it was completely different. It has more options in some places, and less in the others. It was looking real good, like it wasn't going to have issues with the focus. But before I could install it in the car, it suddenly shut off, and now will not power back on. I guess it's going back as well. I plan to order a third from this seller because I liked the software running on this one. Watch me get one with a 3rd type of software running on it, heh. I'll post back with the results.

Since Amazon is paying for the return shipping, and I have a UPS drop box on the way to work, I can do this all day. Bring it on! I'll keep ordering until I get one that works.

***UPDATE 2***

Alright, that 2nd cam did power back on the next day, so I decided not to return it. Being pleased with FAR CLOUD's camera, I ordered a 2nd one, and when I got it, I returned the original blurry camera back to fastNeasy. So now I'm set with dash cams in both of my cars. I recommend you purchase from FAR CLOUD.

title: Quite Bad video and sound quality
text:
I bought this knowing that it's only an upscale 720p, not true HD. But this is quite bad; the video resolution is more like 480x240. I can't even see the license plate of the car park in front. The sound is terrible. Here is the summary of pros and cons:

Pros:
_ Cheap as dirt
_ Most of the functions work (except for night vision of course)
_ Can make out the shape of the cars in front of you
_ Sound works (but barely)

Cons:
_ The video quality went south after 1 week
_ Sound works terribly
_ The mount is ok (not cons, not pros)
_ Night vision is useless

Bottom Line:
I know a lot of people buying this as their first experience of car dvr as I did. But please save your money and buy something better. I will buy something else when I have more money. As for this, I will keep it on my new car for now (it's better than nothing).

title: Great product!
text: I've had this dashcam for a few years now and love it!  It recorded several car accidents and incidents in front of me and saved me a $500 deductible when a texting driver hit my car.  I caught it all on video with this little gem.  Well worth the money!  Get a 16 or 32 GB memory chip and set the record time down to about every 10 minutes.  It makes it easier to locate an incident to put on DVD for the police.

title: Great cheep and affordable camera. Great for RC Video.
text:
So this camera was pretty great for about 3 months. Unfortunately after 3 months the camera no longer powered on at all. I disassembled it and have it powered by some extra lipo batteries i have. I now use it for recording video on my RC Multi Rotors!

The good news is i was able to capture my naber running into the front of my car using the motion capture mode. So it payed for its self in that way!

Things to note about this camera. Its not really a wide angle lens. I want to say its more like a 120mm, Depending how wide your car is you might have to place the camera directly in the center of your windshield.

The battery will only last for a good 2 hours. So if you drive in a lot of traffic make sure you bring your battery charger.

I had a problem using SD cards larger then 16 gigs.

This camera actually makes a great lightweight RC hobby camera! Its cheep enough to where you wont cry if you break it and its light enough to put on any medium sized RC aircraft, or MultiRotor!

You will end up spending the money fir a good dash camera. The instruction manual is horrible, it does not tell you in plain English how to set the date and time. It doesn't work properly 100% of the time, the materials used to make it are flimsy, but for $20 you get what you pay for and if it's being judge based on price then it's perfect.

title: All in all it's a good temporary camera if you want one.
text:
Lets face it., It's a $13 camera. It's not going to be amazingly high depth, and work forever or even all that long. It will break quickly and have problems, it is the cheapest dash cam you will find after all. It will take videos at a surprisingly good quality for the time it does work however.

Mine lasted for about a moth before it ceased to work for unknown reasons. Just the amount of time I needed to save up extra cash for a high quality camera that I wanted. Therefore it did do it's job. It would have been nice if instructions were included rather than scouring the internet on how to get it off of the Chinese language settings that are default. Once again as expected of the cheapest camera out there.

title: Easy to operate
text:
Really easy to operate without reading the instructions. It came with English and Chinese leaflet.
Two push-button on the back of the main body.
Left one is power ON with ON symbol.
Right one push to start/stop Recording also function as "select" on the menu. Should silkscreen it RED.
Four push-button on the flip down TFT screen, all silkscreen from Left to Right on the bottom of the screen as Menu, Down, Up, Mode.
By default, record time set to two minutes, I set mine to the longest > 15 minutes.
It even record sound! Make sure you watch your language in case of in an accident :p
The battery cover kind of flimsy. If you don't open it too often would probably be okay.
The battery use BL-5C 3.7V 1050 mAh Lithium-Ion rechargeable.
The device fail to install on my Windows 7 x64 Bit. It's okay I just take the SD card plug in to the Desktop PC.

title: Came repackaged and not functioning
text: I bought one for myself and the quality was eh. What can you expect for a $20 dash cam? It went okay and sometimes would go gimmicky, but it was okay. This product was from itsun E market or something. When I bought 2 more for my friend, the seller was Amazing Tech Depot. When I received the two new dash cams, they weren't new. One package was obviously re-taped several times and when he opened it, it felt like there was superglue on it and the stand was cracked. The dash cam NEVER turned on. The second one was functioning for 5 minutes then shut off. We thought, "Oh it must be the batteries cause that's what happens to electronics when you don't charge them." We charged it for 30 minutes on a USB-to-Desktop cable and when we took it out, it would not turn on. We tried the car charger and left it there for 30 minutes. Still no bulge. It never even turned on. Out of the 3 dash cams I bought, 2 of them doesn't even work, came repackaged and one of the stands were broken. Don't buy this product; it has too many problems. Debating if I should return mine and get a better one...

title: Just remember it's only $24
text:
As others have said, you get what you pay for. I'm not sure if everyone who orders this is actually getting the same product... for example, some reviewers say it deletes old files when the SD card fills up, others (including me) report that it just stops recording with a "memory full" message when that happens. I've tried various settings to try to fix that, to no avail. In the discussion section, whenever the question is asked the people are just talking past each other which reinforces my belief that not everyone is actually getting the same product. Because the instructions are in such poor English, you really just have to try things to try to figure it out.

It's a neat toy for a while but once the novelty wears off it's really of no practical use if I have to keep taking out the SD card and deleting the old files every 2-3 days.

title: Inexpensive, but has issues...
text:
The phrase, "You get what you pay for." should be the slogan for this product.

It was hard for me to imagine that a small camera, with battery, and charger was under $15. I read the negative reviews and decided that for that price, it was still worth the risk.

Does it work. Yes it does. It records quite well and has lots of features including motion detection and night time recording.

Does it work like it should... no. After just a week, one day in the heat caused the lens to dislocate and blur. So, now my recordings are not nearly as detailed. Can you still see everything, yes. Can you read a license plate or get fine details for the video.... no. Apparently, you can fix the camera (lots of reviews with those who have and give detailed instructions)... I just haven't gotten around to trying it.

Now, after a few weeks, I find that the battery no longer works. This means the camera cannot function without the car being on and that the date/time reset each time I stop/start the car.

I wanted to try this camera out as an experiment. I knew it was a faulty product (from the reviews) going into it and had low expectations. That being said, I'm pleased with the fact that it actually DOES work but still disappointed that it's no longer clear and crisp video. And, for the cost of a meal, it was worth the investment, even if it might be a short one.

I think it's always a good idea to have a camera in this day in age with insurance scams, road rage, etc. If you're THINKING to try out a dashcam, I'd say this is a good starter. If you're SURE that you're going to get one permanently, invest that $15 with a camera with better ratings.

title: Tough to rate...
text:
...when it appears that the unit I received may be a returned unit in the first place.

Got this today, all excited. grabbed the dc power adapter and the glass mount, and headed out to the truck. DC adapter lights up, but when I plug it into the camera and try to turn on the camera, nothing. look things over a bit more, see that yes this needs a SD card. So, I grab one, install it, hold the power button down for a moment. Nothing. Well, maybe I'm not holding the power button down long enough, so hold it in longer. Still nothing. Take the unit off the window mount, and take it inside with me. I get back inside and see the panel on the top of the unit, slide it open, and there's the battery. What? The unit was shipped with the battery installed? that seems odd. Well, OK. plug the unit into a computer to see if it will either charge the battery (I'll leave it plugged in that way overnight to see if that helps) and also to see if I can even see the memory card in the unit as if it were a drive. No.

Well, at this price I can try ordering another and see if I get a different setup when the box shows up. If I do, this unit is going back. And I'll write a different review. But not quite yet.

I soon found out, as others have said, that the battery simply will not hold a charge. I don't like constantly have a cord running from the windshield to the 12v outlet. If you don't mind having it plugged in all the time, it's a great little camera for the price. But if you plan to use it on battery, don't bother.

title: Great to review after an incident
text: It's just as described and all works well.  It only has about 24hrs of straight recording with a 32g card then it starts recording over the oldest saved. Great to review after an incident.  So it's good for watching cash register and review after it turns up short, or any place were vandalism or theft is possible, also great for liability protection. I wish and think it should be 72 hrs or more as there will be times you won't notice the trouble more than 24hours later.  But for the price it is an incredible opportunity for a little piece of mind.  I use a 110v ac --> 12v dc adapter ($2) and a 32g card ($11) and leave it running constantly with out the motion activation.  But it can also be set up to only record motion and will then have a longer playback time depending on the situation. Great little camera and with the proper packaging an marketing I could see most people owning many and using them to watch over their home, car, pet,  children, pool, businesses and more.

title: Works OK until it doesn't!
text:
I bought this unit 4 months ago and it just stopped working. When I got it the battery wouldn't hold a charge for more than about 5 minutes. Since I would have it plugged into power in my car I didn't really care about that issue. But, now all I get is a white screen and no action from any buttons. It's just frozen and I can't find any way to reset/reboot it. It's now functionally a brick.

Of course I've had it too long to return to Amazon and for the price it's not worth the effort to contact the manufacturer. But, who knows who made it since this exact same unit is being sold here under many different brands! It seems obvious that some company is spitting these out in huge quantities with zero quality control hoping that the low price will sucker people into buying it. Don't!

The biggest issue is that as a dash cam you want to just set-it and forget-it. Mount it somewhere in the car and you then only take a look at the videos if you need to save something. It's then that you discover that it stopped working weeks ago and didn't record the incident (this is how I found out mine died).

I could live with the useless battery they shipped, I could live with the so-so video quality (it was good enough) but if I can't depend on it working 100% of the time then it's useless!

title: old web camera video quality (in daylight), rubbish audio quality
text:
I have been using this dash camera for about two weeks now. For what it is and how cheap it is, it is good. I can't complain for something that is only $21 dollars. It automatically records when the car is started (as long as the power is plugged in), deletes old recordings as new videos are shot, automatically shuts off when power is cut, and is fairly small and unobtrusive and comes with it's own window mount.

The video quality is actually quite poor by today's standards but it's a dash camera and doesn't need to be amazing. It's okay in daylight. Pretty much just black if you're driving at night without street lights on the road. Barely registers my own vehicles' headlamps unless they are shining on something other than the road. It's better if there are street lights and other traffic during night footage.

The audio quality is just terrible. I don't know if there is a problem with mine or not, but when i was testing it out in the house when I first got it, it constantly records a very annoying loud noise that doesn't exist. Subsequently, audio while driving has to be louder than the imaginary noise to register on the videos. I'm always blaring my radio so you can hear that, but being quiet or speaking soft around it just sounds like loud noise.

There is also a constant defect or something that shows up in the audio on the videos every few seconds. Almost like a split second of radio static every few seconds.

The camera has a full-size sd slot. I purchased a 16 GB card for it. It fills up pretty quickly. I do maybe three or four hours of driving a week, commuting and a few other minor trips here and there. It currently has only a week and a half of footage on the camera and it's full. But as I mention earlier, it automatically deletes old footage for storage of the new. If you want more of a buffer, however, I recommend you get the largest capacity this camera will support (32 GB). I personally find the 16 GB works just fine.

This camera claims to have a 270 degree fish-eye lens. I am not entirely convinced but I have no way of proving it does or not. I have footage, but I have no idea how to submit it for reference with this review. It's mounted at the top of my truck's window, and it can't see both corners of the hood.

The mount functions great. Very similar to any gps or phone suction cup window mount, but just with a camera screw mount point for the dash camera.

For something so cheap, I think it functions great. I believe that for its intended purpose the quality is decent. Enough to show things moving around and if it's a clear day and sunny, you can get a few good details if you're close enough.

text:
Originally I liked this. I've used it for 3 days now and that has changed.

It has a generic cellphone battery. It doesnt hold a charge. I can charge it for 24 hours and as soon as external power is removed I get a low battery warning. and when external power is applied the unit will not poweroff.

The picture is out of focus. It says full HD but the picture is grainy and pixelated. It does not seem to have a focus mechanism.

once it is set up, its easy to use, one button recording is awesome. However the initial setup is very awkward. The instructions talk about an ok button but its not clear what button it is. (its the record button) so youre moving from the LCD panel buttons to the main unit.

there are a few errors in the instructions as well but I expected that.

I didnt expect a lot for $15, but with most units being around $40 I expected a little bit more.
