title: unreliable but cheap
text:
This camera is acceptable considering its price. However, this dash cam is not very reliable: the battery will inexplicably die, the software and controls will malfunction, the suction mount will crack/fail, and the camera will sometimes not save videos correctly.

I put up with the unreliability for a year until I had a car accident and the camera did lost the video. The other driver was at fault, and I had no video to prove it. Fortunately, the insurance company came to the same conclusion based on forensics of the damage, but the whole experience made me realize that the single most important characteristic of a dash cam is **reliability**.

Other characteristics such as price and video quality mean nothing if I cannot count on the camera to always be recording and saving video. I recommend spending an extra $50 or $100 dollars to buy a camera that you can depend on. But if reliability is not a concern for you, then I would say this camera is a good value for its price.

title: OOOPS
text:
Had a spare $20, so I decided to try this.

I am giving this item one star, because the review system would not let me do zero stars!!! I gave it such a horrible rating for the following reasons:
1. The box was torn.
2. Put battery in, and got power button and record buttons to light (usually need to charge it first).
3. Nothing else happened. No screen filled with pictures of my office nor of my ugly mug, nothing!
4. Deleted after email from vendor.
5. Could not get unit to turn off! Had to remove battery.
6. I found a VERY old and used memory card in the unit!!! The "Product Features" clearly state that it does NOT come with a memory card!

Contacted vendor by email and he suggested charging unit for two hours and trying again. 2, 4, 6, 8 hours charging. Same lights. No video.
Vendor said that test technician may have left the sd card in unit. Sounds like a missed step in the test procedure. I still think it is a bad/defective unit and I am sending it back. Problem is that in order to get another one, I have to spend $5 on something else to avoid the $6 shipping, which is why I ordered it with the other stuff last time.

title: Has Glitches
text:
Works fine when it does, but some times the camera powers up and tries to start recording but it fails.
it would shutdown and restart and tries to start recording again only to fail again and restart once more, it keeps doing that in an endless loop.

when this happens this is what i do
1)pull out the power cord and restart it.
2)make sure you don't hit the record button after you got it to start or else it will do the same endless loopy thing.
3)format the sd card
4)turn it off
5)reconnect the power cord, now it will start recording without shutting down on me.

also, the material used is not very strong.my suction cup mount is no longer working as the plastic around it has broken after 2 weeks of normal use.

now i am trying to figure out my options now that i cannot attach the camera to windshield.
i think i got what i paid for it.

title: Not the one I looked for
text:
[[VIDEOID:b29b50273027116132672e404b2d9a7c]] The camera actually works, it records sound and image. I will be able to use it for something, if not as dashboard camera. And it is cheap. That's why it gets two stars.

However, this is just a cheapo Chinese copy of the camera I was looking for. That one I bought somewhere else on the internet about 6 months ago. I was satisfied with it, and wanted to buy a second one for the other car. Then I run into this cheapo copy. Its price is about 1/3 of the real one. It looks exactly the same. However, it is not the same. Its field of view is much less and it doesn't record in real HD. The quality of this piece of junk is below VHS. You can set the recording quality in the menu up to 1280x960 but I believe this is just interlacing of a 360x240 image. The CMOS image sensor light sensitivity is poor and it becomes grainy in lower light conditions.

Don't buy. Look elsewhere. Pay real dollars for a real camera.

Update: I used it for one day. The sound is distorted, unintelligible. The field of view is the same as a 50mm objective with a small film camera, no way "wide". You can't see the traffic lights in front of you: how you can argue you passed in yellow? The image quality is terrible: you can't read the license plate of the car directly in front of you, except when you stand right behind with a few feet gap. The capital letters of overhead directional signs are legible only when you pass "under" them, of course as permitted by the poor field of view.

This camera worth about $20, not much more and don't expect to measure up with the original, identically looking real HD camera that is called Trek View. I will try to add a video to demonstrate the poor quality.

text: The price was good. Packaged well and came on time. Records well. I found the navigation buttons not as user friendly as they could be. The mount holds it well but I would recomend that you keep it in the car and not take it off of the mount daily as I think you would strip the threads before too long. Over all my experience with it has been pretty positive.

It also changes speed, making it seem as though you sped up and slowed down impossibly quickly.
A little exploration in the menu will help you customize the settings, but nothing will let you change the focus, as far as I can tell.
I imagine that some of them will be in focus, though mine isn't.

With that said, it still works. I was T-boned by a woman who ran through a stop sign. I have the evidence, though blurry, to prove that I was not at fault.

title: Cheap Chinese Crap
text:
At first this was a steal. The image quality was bad but it did the job. Who cares if you cannot see the image clearly as long as you can make out who was at fault in an accident.

Anyway aside from the poor image quality the device was shipped with the digital menu in Chinese. This wasn't a huge issue as I was able to flip it to English, but I don't think many other people will be able to do that because I had to have a Chinese friend do that for me.

But the thing that made be hate this item was the following;

When left in the car, the device overheats. When it overheats it cannot record anything. What's the point of that? So it doesn't work unless the temperature is room temperature. Where I live the temperature is regularly 90 or higher in the car before the AC cools everything down.

TL;DR;

- Poor image quality
- Wont record when device is overheated from sitting in the car on a hot day
- Degree of view is not what is posted. Degree of view is probably closer to 90 degrees
- Makes noise when plugged into car charger. Said noise is also recorded in any recording
- Without car charger connected batter lasts 2 or 3 hours.

title: Does what it's supposed to, but horrible video quality
text:
First, the good --

-- it turns on when the power is turned on, turns off when the power turns off, creates a new file each few minutes. Since my car turns on and off power the cigarette lighter with the ignition, it's all automatic -- perfect.

-- these videos do show what happened and when.

-- even at night you can see cars, lights, etc.

And the bad --

-- build quality is quite low. Though given the price, this is not unexpected. It's low, but adequate.

-- I'm still investigating, but the 12v power supply seems to create a lot of RF noise. When on, my GPS seems to have a problem picking up a signal, and it might be responsible for my TPMS light coming on (it came on shortly after I installed the DVR, and I need to see if it'll turn off after a while of not using the DVR.) TPMS is RF based, and it happened at the same time as the GPS and when the DVR was installed -- so that's why I suspect it. Still not sure.

I may need to find another power supply, or add ferrite beads or something. Or maybe it's just a coincidence, I don't know yet.

And the ugly --

-- video quality is *extremely* low. A $12 808 #3 keychain camera at 640x480 has better video quality.

During the day, everything is washed out -- it's too bright. You can see the road, cars, signs, etc. but if there's a car stopped right in front of you, the odds are very good that you won't be able to make out its license plate even under those ideal conditions.

At night, things actually improve a bit. You can make out the road, cars, signs, etc. (as long as they are illuminated by your lights, of course) and you probably can make out the license plate of a car right in front of you. (But if it never stops in front of you, and you never get 3 feet behind it? Forget it.)

Strangely enough, the quality of the image in the display actually seems somewhat higher than that saved to the SD card. I'm going to have to test it using the AV out cables and using it as a webcam to see if that makes a difference.

In any event, if there's a "he said, she said" situation in a collision, this video will probably show what happened. But if there's a hit and run or something, it probably will *not* catch a clear picture of a driver or their license plate, even under ideal conditions.

Considering how cheap it was ($22), I don't think I'll be sending it back. But I do think I'll be buying something better at a higher cost.

title: Re-set of camera  that is non-functional
text:
Proper functionality sometimes requires RESET

additional items required:

1. (5)volt (1)amp power adapter (proper size such as... Sunny SYS1196-0505)
2. proper small screwdriver set for (2) sets of 4 screws

To reset item remove battery and SD card. Remove 2 sets of 4 screws. Disassemble ribbon cables from camera lens, and cable to LCD screen assembly.

Re-assemble unit, plug in power adapter (no SD card or battery)
RESET complete...

Power up
Unit functional

title: 5 stars because I quickly got what I wanted.
text:
Excellent purchase. Best price for what you're looking for, if you're looking for a new man-toy to utilize on a budget. If you want green screen night vision recording, this isn't the one. I got what I wanted though. Delivered sooner than it was anticipated, instructions are botched in proper "Engrish" fashion, but that validates its authenticity. And the instructions ARE readable and able to be understood, provided you have a brain regularly used for thinking. Yet - I must reiterate - they are in ENGRISH; a.k.a. the grammatically incorrect form of the English translation of a beautiful Asian language (There are other languages the instructions provide). I digress; It captures a healthy field of view, though I cannot tell exactly how wide it is. When I say "healthy" I mean it will capture the color of the light at the intersection at the top of the screen, your vehicle hood just barely at the bottom of the screen, and the sides are proportionate to that. The 270 degree whirl part is to describe the screen that flips down to display what the camera is capturing. I originally thought it was a 270 degree field of capture, like a fisheye lens. I think I'd have to get something with an actual "fisheye" lens. Regardless, it has enough settings in it to document any traffic accident with ease. You can change recording duration, video quality, and the option to record video, capture images (and change all settings about that process) and record only audio. Then you can play all of that back. The only downside is the battery life. Do the initial charging processes before tripping out about it. But I keep my charger plugged in or nearby most of the time if the battery is going. It's more than likely my settings that are causing a faster battery drain... Or I'm accidentally leaving it on sometimes.

Regardless - a great buy. Master the settings with your brainpower and hands-on experience, and you will have a fun and useful tool with you. Almost making you want to dare traffic to screw with you... But be careful about that because it goes both ways. You're on camera until you're off it.

title: Doesn't Always Work
text:
Like a lot of people, I was looking to purchase a dash camera to have in case of an insurance incident in order to prevent fraud and any subsequent rate increases. Seeing as I had never purchased a dash camera before, I had no idea where to begin. There are hundreds of listings that all have a very wide range of prices - featuring HD recording, non-HD recording, HDMI outputs, different resolutions, and etc. Needless to say, I was confused. Though, one thing was for sure: I was not going to spend a lot of money on a camera, especially seeing as I wanted to get one just to try out and see if I could get the hang of having one around in my car.This is where this camera caught my attention: For a sub-twenty dollar price range, this camera seemed to have some decent features, even for an entry-level or "knockoff" model. So, I decided to purchase it. And this is where my experience began.

First off, I must admit that the shipping was very quick from this particular seller (Dowson). I opted for standard shipping and received it in what seemed to be a matter of two days or so. A very nice bonus. Upon arrival, I opened up the packaging and started the un-boxing process by looking at the contents and checking to see if everything was there. It was, so I continued. Eventually, I got to the camera and when I inspected it there was a problem: the screen has a noticeable line going through it, almost as if it was dropped or nicked with some sort of box cutter during the production or assembly process. While it doesn't affect the device's operation, it still can prove to be very annoying. Some sort of clear sticky tape solution was over the screen (a screen protector, perhaps?) and when I tried to remove it (I thought that it was just a protective layer of film to guard against any more dings or scratches), it would not come off. In fact, the glue and sticky residue from this film was so stubborn that I was afraid to permanently damage the screen if I continued. So, I didn't.

After the screen fiasco, I went ahead with bringing all of these things outside to my car to see how (or if) the camera worked. After inserting my SD card (I used an older 2GB one that I formatted, as the 16GB one that I ordered off of Amazon was arriving the next day) I powered on the camera and cycled through the menu items. Then, I hit record. And ... nothing happened. It seemed as if the camera had recorded around three seconds of video and froze. I could still see a live feed of video coming onto the LCD display, but it would not record. I pulled out the rechargeable battery and replaced it; still to no avail.

Moving on to the next day, I tried the new SD card and the device seemed to work. I managed a fairly long (fifteen minute) recording session and when I reviewed the driving footage it looked good. The on-board battery had died so I removed it and plugged in the car charger that they supplied with the device in hopes that I could record some more footage. I hit the power button again, and the device proceeded to do a number of strange things. It made a "popping" sound (similar to the sound that an audio auxiliary cable makes when you touch it with your finger), the screen went on, faded to white, and froze to the point where all I could see were multi-colored stripes. To try and fix it, I unplugged the USB car charger and let it sit for a few minutes. But, after plugging it back in, it only worked for a few seconds and went through the motions of getting stuck at a multi-colored stripe screen. Very frustrating.

Over all, this dash camera seemed to have some good recording capabilities and the quality was not all that bad. I know that the camera wasn't of the highest quality - especially for this price range - but all I wanted was for it to work properly. Is that too much to ask?

title: Surprising for the Value... at First
text:
I wrote my review (below) too soon. It worked great at first. After about a week of using it, it no longer powers up and the SD card slot is broken. I'm generally very good with electronics and pride myself in taking care of them. This device simply did not hold up to the first week of use. :(

Original review:

I was only looking for a very limited dash cam and that's what I expected given the price. But this little device is quite amazing... three video quality modes, the ability to snap photos, IR light, video playback (forward and backward)... there is more here than expected. With a 2GB card I noticed right away that it will hold about 75 minutes of video on the lowest quality setting, and about half that on the high setting. The video is of course not the kind you'd get from a camcorder (I'm sure the sensor is pretty basic) and the playback framerate looks like 12fps or slower, but it's not terrible and the camera seems to know not to focus on beads of water or dust on the windshield, which i was worried about and saw bad reviews of for other cameras. Overall, great product, great value, great shipping/packaging... would recommend.

title: Worked great... for a short while
text:
I was really excited to receive this, and began playing with it immediately. The expandable SD card slot allows for essentially limitless memory, the video quality is adjustable and has a good frame rate. Color is a little washed out, but unless you're professionally recording then that's usually a non-issue. However, after only two or three months, I ran into some issues. Here's a list of pro's and cons:

Pro's:
+way cheaper than alternatives like the GoPro, which cost twice as much
+very lightweight
+suction cup mount included, choose where you want it, or move it around
+as mentioned, expandable/swappable memory
+USB charging makes this quite versatile

Con's:
-first thing to break was the mount. The suction cup failed, and the fall from the window to the car floor irreparably broke the mount.
-after about 4 months of light/intermittent use, the battery stopped holding a charge. Perhaps more frequent and full charge/discharge cycles can keep the battery in working condition longer, but this still a problem. From then on I ran this off of USB power
-after 5 months, the software began failing, freezing any time I hit record. This essentially marked the end of the camera's usability.

title: Solution for looping problem?
text:
Received the item the other day and plugged in an old 1gb kingston SD card I had lying around. Even though it only gave me 15 min of record time, I could not for the life of me get it to loop. Changed it to a 4gb Sandisk SDHC card from the camera and it started looping. Did the same thing with a new 16GB class 10 SD card and it also looped the recordings.

For those who cannot get it to loop, I suggest trying a newer SD card to see if it solves the
problem.

Some pointers that makes life easier
1. The "OK" button is on the top next to the power button.
2. to access utilities, press menu then press mode. Once you press up or down, you cannot access the utilites menu until you restart the whole process
3. When you turn it on, the center of the screen looks like there is a giant light purple orb. This is from the IR lights, not a faulty screen.
4. You can zoom in and out with the up and down button.
5. "Continue" in the menu means the amount time you want the camera to stay on after power is cut from it.
6. Be careful with the mount, the screws holding the adjustment pins can come loose and you can easily lose the little nut that secures it.
7. I would consider putting one of those tinted screen protectors around the front of the camera to help with the white balance.

title: Low Quality, but works.
text:
It is low quality recording, but you can make out vehicles, lights, and pedestrians. If you get really close to vehicles, you can actually make out their license plate number sometimes! (i.e. stopped at red light) This wouldn't be very useful to provide evidence for a crime, but it would help to prove fault in an accident.

I wouldn't suggest using these if your vehicles power ports are always on, rather than on-and-off with the engine, as the camera can overheat from prolonged usage in a hot car. However, the climate control that you will certainly have on while driving is enough to prevent this while you are actually in your vehicle.

Also, I wouldn't suggest trying to use an SD card any bigger than 32 gigs.

If you're using this during the summer, take it off the windshield/dash when the car is parked, or you may come back to a drooping, melted "decoration". If it lasts for over a year, you've definitely gotten your money's worth.
"HD" is actually a single mode 640x480 with continuous looping, with many of the full capabilities as listed on the enclosed directions not present in this camera. far too blurry to capture license plate numbers. but it can prove who did what if you need it.

title: Best Bang for you Buck!
text:
I bought 3, one for each of our cars. They are cheap, simple and effective. Buying a 4th today. It shuts off when at a programed time (you set it) after the car is turned off. Does have a battery power, back up, I just keep mine plugged in all the time as the battery may be limited. Pretty wide angle and pretty good also at dusk and dawn lighting conditions and night time with street lights.

Con on them is they do produce radio static, and they do not loop record. Once the SIMS card is full it turns off, so you have to reformat the the SIMS Card in the unit, takes though less than a minute. A 32 gig card lasts well over continuous 8 hours of recording.

Pros on them. Extremely cheap and basic. If you want the just added insurance with driving, these low budget dash cams are the way to go. Remember you get what you pay for. If you want all the bells and whistles then dig deeper in your pockets and buy a higher end model. I figure for $20-$25 bucks even if it lasts only year it will be worth it. My guess it will last a lot longer. Its a pretty good unit.

So for what it provides for what it costs I give it 5 stars

title: Stopped working after eight weeks
text: I was happy with the product until it stopped working... It worked fine for about eight weeks then one day I noticed that the power-on chirp wasn't happening any more. Then noticed that the display wasn't coming on and it also wasn't recording. Did normal things such as remove battery and power in an attempt to reset it. Manual says the following (copied verbatim): "DVR will restart after press Reset Hole gently by diameter less than 1mm column." I searched to the best of my ability and I can't find any recessed reset switch/hole. The manual has a diagram that calls out 17 items (e.g., Lens, Mode Button) on the device but none of the items listed has anything to do with reset.

text: I just received my "new", Dowson brand camera yesterday, March,1, 2013. The instructions were in English, Chinese and Russian. title: Great cheap dashcam
text:
I bought this dashcam to put in my car as a 'just in case'. It was cheap enough to justify the purchase and I figured why not. The dashcam feels and looks pretty cheap, but is exactly what I expected. It does it's job and is virtually maintenance free. I turn on my car, the camera turns on and starts recording. I turn off my car, the camera turns off. The menu is a bit wonky but once you figure out that you have to use the top two buttons to select things and not the buttons right under the screen, it's fine. Capture quality is pretty mediocre, however it's good enough. It's just as good as those youtube videos. You are able to distinguish cars and you'll be able to see the license plates of cars right in front of you. Good enough for me.

The dashcam will automatically delete the oldest video files and you can set how large you want chunks to be (I set mine to 5 minutes). The IR LEDs are pretty useless unless you're up close. It also keeps track of date and time as long as you don't remove the battery (comes with a flat lithium battery). My dashcam also came with a very very obnoxious beep, which I don't think you can disable. I ordered another one to put in my other car and this 'beep' was far better and actually bearable. I ended up opening the first one and cutting the speaker wires so now it's totally silent. The power button pulsates a dim blue when it's recording. You can also disable the recording of sound so no one will be able to hear my terrible taste in music and my singing.

On the highest video setting, my 8gb SD card was able to hold about 4 hours of footage.

Overall, this is a great value and does it's job.

title: Answers for Memory card problems
text: I just found out (Thanks to Radio Shack) that there are three bastc types of memory cards.  The regular card which is used to store photos would need to be formated on your computer before use in your camcorder and this is why you would get a "no card found " on the camcorder.  Another type is a class 10 card used for videos and no format needed for your camcorder.  The third type is for the use of a 3D camera. (Never heard of one till now.)

title: Worth the $30
text: I've had this dash cam installed in my car for about 2 months now.  It does come up a bit short on quality, but it certainly does the basic job, and for $30...that's not bad.  The angle isn't as wide as I would have liked, but not as bad as some say, at least in my eyes anyway.  You can only read the license plates if a car is within a foot or two of your bumper, and the lighting is right.  You wouldn't be able to pick someone out of a police line up if you only had the dash cam to go by.  Also at night, it will only pick up what is in your headlights.  However, you could easily tell that someone cut you off, ran a stop sign, brake jammed you etc.  You could also tell that a high school kid ran out in front of you without looking like a 2 year old, which is the main reason I bought this as this nearly happened to me, but luckily I'm a good driver and braked in time as I am always extra cautious when kids are around.  I have mine set to 1 min loops and get about an hour of driving out of the 4 GB card I'm using on the lowest setting, as I found there was minimal difference in the quality settings.  Also as other have said there are different models being shipped as mine has no option to turn off the audio (poor quality anyway, so you cant make out a typical conversation). I hope to put some pics up and maybe a video soon.

title: Works Great
text: The dash cam arrived today.  I have one installed in my pickup and wanted to add another to the van.  I have been happy with the previous purchase and this one was better priced at $13 and change.  Don't worry about the settings and controls.  Just insert the memory card (16GB works fine for me) and install it in the car.  It will start up and start recording right away in three minute segments.  It's a five volt system so don't try to wire it straight to the car's power system as 12 - 15 volts will fry it.  I installed a second cigarette lighter under the dash and ran the wire under the panel to make it a neater installation.  I recommend using the Pico 0956PT 10 Amp ATM Mini Blade Fuse Add-A-Circuit Fuse Holder (or similar) to add the circuit.  Then you can use the supplied power supply to plug into the newly installed cigarette lighter.  Like some others the only reason I didn't give it a five star rating is the poor instructions.  I say ignore them, plug it in and watch it start recording.

title: A good car camera - especially for the price.  Works fine.
text: I bought 3 of these, and they work great.  I can't believe they were so cheap.  I paid more for the 32 GB class 10 memory card than the cost of one camera.  I used the included suction mount to locate it behind my rearview mirror. That way I don't lose any visibility out of my windshield.  It has a lever that really sticks it to the windshield firmly.  I only flip down the viewing screen while pointing the camera, so from the drivers seat, you can't hardly even see the camera located behind the rearview mirror. The camera mount has a ring that you rotate to lock the camera into precisely the correct position, and it holds fast.  I ran the included power adapter cable up over the passenger side sun visor, down the post beside the windshield (attached with a few small pieces of double sided grey tape to match my cars interior), and then taped the rest up under the dash.  I just leave the power cord plugged into the cigarette lighter - so when I start the car the camera comes on automatically.  When you turn off the car - the camera stores the video and shuts off the camera.  You know when the camera comes on or off because it plays a little music clip. The "user manual" is very brief. The user manual is in English, and I think Chinese.  It is pretty cryptic, so before mounting it in the car, you just need to sit down with the camera in hand, and play with it until you are comfortable.  The included battery looked pretty cheap, but it works.  I only paid about $15 per camera, so I don't mind, and my camera is always running on the car charger anyway.  I have not viewed the video from nighttime recordings, but daytime is fine.  Looks like it records to an AVI file.  I believe it is supposed to record 8 hours of video on my class 10 32 Gig card, and then begin overwriting the oldest video first.  I think the class 10 card is recommended.  As long as you don't need super sharp video at distance, I recommend these little cameras.  For $15, you can't lose much.

I put a 16gb memory card in and gives me almost 3 hours of recording on full HD. I set on 2 minute loop and works great. I will probably order a few more to place behind me up high to capture view out each side window and it will also catch view in mirror down the whole side of my truck as well. I drive a 2009 Freightliner Cascadia for any truckers wondering how I might achieve that. My rig has tons of head room. Big cab!

title: It does what it says
text:
I like this product. For the price it does well, and I'm satisfied with it. One thing I like about it is that it starts recording as soon as I turn the key to the ignition and shuts off when the key is off. My vehicle is set up that the accessory socket only works when the key is on so this works well for me. Otherwise it is a matter of remembering to turn it on and off each time you get in the vehicle.

It would be nice to be able to see the license plate of other cars in the case of an accident or a hit and run, but it does not record with that much detail.

It records well at night, although the infra-red doesn't really seem to help at all. I would recommend this to a friend as a cheap dash cam. If you want more detail, I would recommend another model.

title: Very good camera for the price.
text:
I read a great many reviews and decided on this unit as my first.
With a average 450 mile commute per week then driving for a living I run one camera
in my work truck and two in my commuter/carpool car (front and rear)..
With this cam you wont be able to read a license plate from space but you can identify
who did what and read the plate of the car in front of you at a stop light.
I have had them for two months now and I am happy with them.
One of the camera's is a little out of focus but instead of sending it back I installed it in the
rear window of my commute car knowing that the anti fog grid in the back window would confuse
the auto focus and that seams to work adequately (though not as well as the other two cams).
Example videos are on YouTube under "Delta Alfa Sierra"
~[...]
(See contestant number one and contestant number two).
I don't use the IR led's as the range is limited, the night vision borderline but acceptable.
The window mount is better then many and the set knobs do need to be retightened once a week,
but come on people it's a $22.00 cam what do you expect?
I use the 5 min file setting and a 32G series 10 card. I also carry an extra card with me so I can swap out cards if something happens.
The power cord is long enough to hide the install. I have the cams set up to to start and stop with the key.
I would defiantly recommend this camera.

Pros. See above

Cons. Instructions and menu's are a bit confusing but with a bit of experimenting you'll get it.
Set knobs need to be retightened once a week.

If you are looking to get into the world of dash cams this is a good one to start with.

title: great dash cam that i use every day
text: I had this cam running on my work van when I got pulled over by the cops. Some lady called and complained about my driving and they were going to write me a ticket based on her moronic opinion that I jammed on my brakes in front of her on purpose. It took about ten minutes to rewind to the precise intersection she claimed it happened at and voila I had perfect video showing a black honda swerving from the right turn only lane across three lanes into the far left lane and of course I jammed on my brakes as was required . She was getting left behind me at the same time and had no idea about the honda  while the cops didnt show her the video they told her they saw the video and they werent writting me a ticket and she acted like the cops were lying to her. This is not why I bought this dash cam but it worked for me. Just a side note it records sound as the default so if you like to sing along to taylor swift songs just remember if chit happens the cops will be listening to whatever happens in the truck along with watching the video

title: Works...sort of.
text:
Can't expect much for $22 but it works after a fashion.

-This version came from Alfunta-mall
-The instructions are very poor and incomplete, you need a microscope to read them and some don't even apply to this model.
-It won't set a loop time (2, 5 or 15 min) but just continues recording.
-It won't loop record even though it's set to 'ON', it just stops recording when the card is full.
-The playback is jerky as if the car is stopping every few yards and then shooting ahead.
-There are obviously several versions of this camera according to the different menu layouts in the videos and instruction interpretations etc. Mine is not like the picture either. It does not have the light sensor cut-out on the top.
-I also tried a friend's $100 truck stop version which looks absolutely identical, has exactly the same menus too but it was far superior in playback quality, had an HMDI out jack and the mount was bigger.

It's hardly worth the bother of sending it back but I figure the outlay was worth it in order to learn about dash cams before I eventually buy a decent one.

title: mine works on Harley Sportster 1200.
text:
had it a mo. today,4-3-13(new) received it in 2 day, (fast). instruction had english (really fine print) & camera was already set to english. at first had a blue screen with a purple line across it, finally figure out by reading reviews here that it was a plastic protective cover on it. removed it, went out side everything looks purple & white, videoed a little, (pictures not like a cannon)plug it to pc, while it was loading i click erase after loading, down loaded into windows movie maker (from the little screen that poped up then you have to click the ok button, (on right next to power button. have to do this everytime you plug it up & it charges battery as long it's pluged up. no disk to down load.
you have to figure out how to use split in movie maker & drag to time line so you can shorting video. i made one & didn't save it to pc or public or utube, copyed & sent as email.
worked fine in car and harley sportster stuck to windshield, viberation is not notsible, to me i'm still learning how to made a short video by using split.
like to have another 1 for car 1 for mc. some of the results here from others are scarey But, i'm happy. everything works, usb cable,(short), battery, 16gb class 10 card and power cable from power port to cam in vehicle, on & off with ignetion. hadn't used motion yet. you have to format card,&set date. if date don't change next day do it again, you didn't do it right, happined to me.
you can use zoom (up or down arrow)in video or while in play back mode. if you hit ok button in photo mode you'll take a picture. i get ok & mode button mixed up sometimes.

title: Setting up clock / language is actually easy. Great for its price.
text:
Menu is lousy. I bought 4 from 3 different vendors, some have a menu only in Chinese, some in both Chinese and English. One came in with both USB and video cable, two came in with USB cable only, one with none. Don't have time to figure out which vendor is the most generous.

To get to the menu of setting clock, language etc, at the video mode, press the menu button once, then press the mode. You will see the settings menu right there.

Be sure to adjust your expectation according to its price. A hamburger costs 6 or 7 bucks. 3 hamburgers together can continuously record video of OK (if not good enough) quality. What do you expect more?

title: Not Bad for the Money
text:
I recently bought one of these from another source (for more money, unfortunately!) I like it pretty well, though I just like to tinker with gadgets. I ordered another on Amazon.

User's Manual - Many reviews mention the poor user's manual, which is just 3 small pages is not very good. Do a google search for "Road Safety Guard sites.google" for expanded information on how to use the device.

Included is information on setting the clock and recovering if the language is set to something other than English, and how to use the zoom functions, which are not mentioned in the "manual".

This site is not connected with any seller and does not have any links to any vendor that sells it, but it does have some tips on usage that may be useful.

title: Could interfere with your car's GPS system
text: For $15 dollar, you get what you paid for. It works in most cases. Be aware that it could interfere with some GPS systems. This works fine with my Nissan Leaf, but makes my Mitsubishi Lancer GPS unable to get satellite signals. I started noticing it when my GPS location are always off by a few streets as time goes by. This is because even without satellite signals, your GPS system try to estimate where you are depending on the direction you are headed and the distance you travelled. But without the signals, plus with the GPS's trying to put you at the nearest drivable street you are closest to, you'd be about 50 miles away just in days. At first I thought my GPS system went bad until one day I had to unplug this cheap dashcam to charge my phone, then my GPS corrected itself. I went to the GPS system and did some traiging. With the dashcam off, my GPS system can get signals from 8 different satellites. When dashcam is on. Zero satellite signals.

title: China is finally good for something, afterall..
text: I've only used this for only one day and I'm SOLD!  This device only proves that the cost of hi-res cameras will soon be in the gutter.  For the price, it's my best and most exciting purchase in the past year or two, hands down.  Exceeds all expectations.  This is the ultimate starter dashcam, and my only regret is that I'd not discovered this thing sooner..  You can't go wrong risking the measly amt for this wonder device.  I will be picking up a pocketful of these.  This can keep dirty cops honest, or cover your rear when fault is at question from an accident.  This can only incriminate you, if you foolishly surrender YOUR memory card when requested..  My advice if you've captured yourself doing dirty, is to eat or otherwise destroy the memory stick before the warrant is served!!  Hahaha!

title: Perfect. Does exactly what I wanted
text: Continuous recording. Auto start when ignition is turned on. Auto stop when ignition is turned off. High resolution 1280x960. Over 5 hours with 16G card. When card is full, deletes oldest segment and continues recording. Also does still photos in color or monochrome. Audio also. Can be used as a USB web cam. OS agnostic; appears as a disk drive. Works with GNU/Linux. MJPEG (AVI). Manual sucks, is not clear, and is inaccurate but can be worked around. I'm ordering another as a rear view cam, and one for my son.

title: Disappointing product
text:
Upon reading the item description, this Dash Cam seemed to have everything I was looking for at a very reasonable price. However, after I got it I was very disappointed for the following reasons.
1. (and most importantly) the video is in 19 second chunks, with a 3-5 second gap in between each file. A lot can happen in 3-5 seconds, and I don't like having big gaps in the recordings.
2. The instructions are vague. It tells you what each button is, and some basic functionallity, but does not go into detail, and I still can't figure out how to operate it properly. The navigation through the menus is awkward and it is obvious the instructions were written by someone with limited English language skills. I just have to keep pushing buttons till it turns off, or take out the battery.
3. The field of view is narrow.
4. The swivel on the mounting arm is flimsy, and I can't get it to tighten down so the whole unit does not move when I open/close the video screen.
5. A little big for a dash cam. It's about the size of a radar detector and takes up a lot of area on the windshield.
6. The battery does not last very long.
7. Misleading description as far as "auto start". It doesn't tell you that you have to hard-wire it into the ignition for this feature to work.

On the positive side, it does take pretty good video and audio; you can replay the files right on the device; and the suction cup mount works pretty well, less the swivel tightening portion.

I am overall disappointed with this product and am actively looking for a better model. Save some time and spend a little bit more money to get a higher quality dash cam.

The camera does have play back on it with sound which was good. Showed the cop doing the report of the accident and made his day because it made it a lot easier seeing what had happened.

Sorry my review isn't that good as this is my first time reviewing a product.

title: You get what you pay for. It is worth it.
text: I've been using this device for about a month now, paired with a 32gb SD card. It records up to 5 hours with looped recording. The overall quality of the video beats expectations for how much the device cost. However, the battery that I had received with the device will only hold about 1 minute of charge. Also, the device will not power off when pushing the power button. In addition, the monitor for the device has glitched out, in times of heat above 90 degrees, and when using wiper blades on a high setting, as the repeated wiper motion messes with the focus and causes it to glitch out. The device is not very good in dim lighting, but whilst driving through the city under streetlights, the amount of imaging that you can see does suffice. Only 15 bucks is a steal as most are 60 and up. The device has yet to completely glitch out or break. After it glitches, it has always returned to normal after resetting. Would recommend to anyone with half a brain, who owns a motor vehicle, as these come in handy during accidents and reports.

title: SD card unseats over time and eventually the card door stops latching
text:
When I first received this 39 days ago, I was very happy with the product, considering it's price. The video is clear when reviewed, it came set up for English language, and it worked reasonably well.

The only complaint I had was that the SD card occasionally shakes it's way lose of it's contacts, without actually popping its door out, so I needed to pay attention to the recording indicator to determine whether the SD card had worked its way lose and I needed to reseat it to get it recording again.

The SD card slot itself relies on the tension of its door to hold it against it's contacts, with a spring providing pressure to pop the card out when the door is opened. There is no separate catch for the SD card, and the door itself is has a very weak latch.

I was happy, considering the price, with this issue. Unfortunately, although it first appeared about a week after I purchased this, it happened more and more often over the following 4 weeks. Now, 39 days after purchase, the door itself no longer stays closed. Whenever I attempt to seat the SD card, the door doesn't catch, immediately popping open again, unseating the SD card as it does. It makes this otherwise well designed dashcam completely nonfunctional.

I gave it two stars since issues were expected. This is a VERY cheap dashcam and I originally purchased this assuming it wouldn't last very long. I wanted to use it to determine whether or not I wanted to purchase a more expensive option or have no dashcam at all. After the first few days I was pleasantly surprised at the deal, considering it gave me everything I needed. Alas, it needs a better SD card enclosure to work long term - either a better, solid latch for the door or a separate latch for the card itself.

title: Works Good.
text:
If you're looking for an inexpensive camera that works good, try this out. I haven't had one problem with this working incorrectly.

Issues I have with it (but for the price, is just fine...):

Picture isn't the greatest. It isn't real clear. If you're using this to read road signs or license plates, forget it. If you're using it to show that there are in fact other cars or large objects, it is just fine.

I've noticed that switching into the 720p mode, it does jump a little bit. It isn't bad though, just slightly noticeable.

The infrared for nighttime use isn't the greatest either. It shows picture great to the front of the hood and then it loses all IR because of the headlights.

It does feel a little cheap, but again, for the price, not bad.

I have used this for a couple of weeks now. If you'd like to watch a few videos of me responding to calls (I'm a volunteer firefighter), go here: [...]

The oldest videos with me responding, are w/out 720p and the newer ones have 720p. I don't notice a huge difference, just the slight jumping of the picture...

Overall, not a bad product for the price.

title: Interferes with my GPS.  GPS will not work when the camera is on!!!  Beware if you want to use both!
text:
The cam works OK. It is not fantastic, but for under $20 what do you expect. I have had it a few days and already it caught a guy running a stop sign in front of me.

The bad is that it interferes with my GPS to the point that I can not use my GPS with it. The GPS gets no signal at all when the camera is turned on.

If you google dashcam and GPS you will see that this is a known issue. This should be noted right on top of the ad for the thing. I might not have bought it if I knew this in advance. That being said it is not worth returning it.

title: Great price, menus and manual are deceptive
text:
This item is a great deal, but the menus/manuals are a bit deceptive.

The menu lists:
VGA
1080P
720P

for resolution options in that order.

The reality is:
the VGA option = 320x240
the 1080P option = 640x480 (aka VGA)
the 720P option = 720x480 (and it is just a horizontal stretch so you don't actually gain any resolution)

So realistically, one would want to pick the "1080P" option to get a non-stretched resolution and decent framerate.

Otherwise, running off battery is neat, the suction cup mount works great, record-at-boot is very helpful, and the files work fine with Macs as long as Perian is installed.

title: Good inexpensive investment
text: I did a lot of research on these dashcams before i purchased one and i was hesitant to buy because of such a low price i figured there couldn't be much to it, and besides that a lot of the reviews were not good. I figured i would buy one and try it . I bought this dashcam for a steal of a price and shipping was fast. I bought a 16gb class 10 SD card on sale here locally to use in it. The operation of the unit was easy for me to figure out  and i started with the HD settings of which i didn't care for the results (not the best or clearest picture and certainly not HD). The 640 setting has been my favorite setting and i've not had any problems with this unit. Yes, the video is somewhat "jerky" when played back and the image is not HD but for the money i paid  this unit has far exceded my expectations. I mainly wanted a dashcam that recorded video and sound and would show the date and time and be totally automatic without me having to remember to switch it on or off. As soon as i start my vehicle the camera switches on and starts recording and when i shut the vehicle off the camera shuts down automatically. I wish i had purchased this camera a long time ago, it gives me peace of mind.

title: Easy to use
text:
So Last Week I looked on good old Amazon and found this little jem for 24 dollars. It turn on and off with the car. rolls out the oldest videos when the sd card gets full and on 16gb card I can hold about 3 hours of full resolution video. I am now thinking about getting one for out the back window.

On the downside, and it is not that much of a big deal, I had to turn off the IR emitters they were reflecting off the glass and making it hard to see. That said Ya at night things are dark, You have headlights and they light up what's out there. In the city you can see intersections enough to judge what is going on. On back roads you can see headlights, taillights and break lights. All in all I suspect it could help you out in a pinch if you needed to present it to your insurance company.

Sound Bit crappy but not bad. You can hear your screams of terror as you launch into a snowbank, or conversation in the car.

Build Quality ... Duh it's $24 keep it out of your way, be mindful of, and take care when loading an 12' 2x4 into the car and it will be fine.

The UI is a bit hard to grasp but Managed to get things set up then I looked at the "Manual". Let's just say you might be better off figuring it out yourself. There is one item in the menu(s) I have not figured out it was "Auto Shutoff" and it is set to 3 minutes. I have no clue what this is, because there is a septate section for the LCD screen.

Thats all for now

Dave.

Dave

title: Good product for the price
text: Good product for the price.  Does the job very well.  The video quality is reasonable but not in HD as it claims.  I am not expecting an HD quality for the dash cam.  For $14, this is a great value.  Definitely get your bang for you the buck.

title: Great Item!
text: This product arrived in time. Item as described in listing. Menu is easy to use. User friendly. Great price too!

title: Very happy with product.
text: The quality of this item was better than I anticipated. The sound quality is less than desirable if you have your windows down in your car and moving. When you are parked or not moving the sound quality is better. The video quality on its highest setting is really good. Its hard to make out license plate numbers even when setting still but I haven't had a whole lot of time to play with the settings yet. For the price I highly recommend this item. I actually just ordered seven more of these camera systems for the municipality that I work for. I am the chief of police for my municipality and the quality of this item was good enough that we are going to try these cameras in a few of our patrol cars. Our sewage department, parking authority and road department checked out this item in my patrol car and liked it so much that they are trying them out also. I would not compare this system to a GoPro, Digital Ally, or other higher dollar system but for the money you cant beat it. Not to mention that this item goes for $122.00 retail through our police vendors that we normally purchase through.
